The headphones are very nice for the price -- when they work. I have no idea why, but they randomly turn themselves off in the middle of use every 20 minutes or so (bluetooth). In order to consistently use them, I HAVE to use the included AUX cable. It's a shame, because the noise cancellation works pretty well and the sound quality is nice.
Comfort and noise cancelling is great. Quality product as with all Anker products.

After playing with $120 Samsung buds (cool idea; poor performance) and a budget pair of buds from amazon, I went this route for the gym. I was not expecting this sort of performance for the price point! Very pleased with the sound quality and the volume levels. Not so bulky/heavy that I can't train with them on my head. Battery life has been awesome as well.

Excellent set of headphones. They don’t go super loud but I mostly got them for watching tv at night and they are perfect for that! Also good for music. Super battery life! The best noise canceling I’ve experienced so far

review_title: Does everything promised for a great price. Like a spa for your ears!
review_text: Comfortable, good sound, good noise cancellation. I'm very happy to have these. I use them to help me concentrate when I work in our open office space or at a cafe, and they work beautifully! If I had a magic wand, I'd tone down the bass, but it's not a deal breaker. Yippeee!

review_title: Great Headphones for the money, except...
review_text: I first would like to say I loved these headphones! They have wonderful features (for a budget headphone) like the more expensive models. They tell you how much battery life you have left when you turn them on, they tell you when you turn on/off noise cancelling and they tell you when you turn on the bass feature. The ear cups are very spacious, super soft and comfortable. They also have the L & R in them for left and right. I wished I could have kept them! However, why I marked them down. I did find at the beginning they were a little muddied with the sound quality. That did seem to clear up after a few hours of use. They have a higher natural tone much like the Bose (but definitely different quality) but they have a bass you can add if you like even more bass! Maybe it is my skin sensitivity but from the moment I put these on my left ear I felt a slight tingling/burning sensation. I kept using them. The next day my ear was so red and swollen it was awful. Itchy hurting red! It stayed that way for a week. I cleaned these headphones and tried them again only for limited times. Several times. Same thing, it started to bother my ear and face on the left side. Then I put my hair over my ear as a barrier, but same thing. I read somewhere in these reviews where these headphones were warm and people’s ears were sweating so I think this must be it. There is just isn’t enough ventilation as my ears did feel warm! The only other complaint I could find is, they could be louder. I hit the max level a coupe of times watching tv. But other than those 2 things I just loved these headphones. I tried the Tao Tronics and they are more like the Sony’s with a natural deeper bass sound and they were louder but their ear cups were to small and didn’t have these high end features this headphone has like knowing how much battery life you have left. I also tried the Bose 700’s but that is a different price group and they have an issue with an auto off if your head doesn't move for 10 minutes that they can’t seem to fix. So back at looking for another headphone to keep. Please give these a try though. Maybe they will not bother your ears and the volume goes high enough for you! They really are lovely!
Over the ear cups get a bit uncomfortable after extended use. Use for music and TV and Skype. Noise cancelling feature works very well. I think these headphones are very good considering the price.

Update: I bought some more expensive headphones, and honestly, the NR wasn’t that much better. Maybe my expectations were too high. Considering the price, I think these are a steal. Original review: I typically enjoy Anker products, but this one was a miss. They are inexpensive, so I like to keep that In mind when using them, but the noise cancelling is pretty worthless. The weird thing about the NC, is it does a great job of removing background hums (like airplane engine noise), but leaves all of the other random noises (people talking, glasses clanging, doors closing). It’s almost more like a hearing aid instead of canceling noise. If that is what you want out of headphones, then maybe they are for you, but for flying, they are worthless. You’ll actually have a harder time sleeping with them on, because now you hear all the conversations instead of having them be drowned out by engine noise. I’ll be returning these and spending more on something else.

First off, I'm not an audiophile or anything, but these headphones sound very good to me. The construction seems well enough and they're large enough to fit my giant head, which is nice. The issue however, is the inability to maintain a connection with my laptop (5th gen Microsoft Surface). They're fine at first, but eventually disconnect and power cycle on their own and continue to do so. They disconnected about 8 times during the first half of a movie I watched a few days ago. I have had two sets of these, and the issue occurred on both. The first I thought was a fluke so I got a replacement from Amazon, but the issue persists on the 2nd pair, so I am in the process of returning them. I have contacted Anker support and their suggestions were basically "do a factory reset and forget them on your laptop" (I did) and "pair them with another device", both of which are moot because a set of JBL and a set of Sony headphones both work on my laptop without the connection problem. Anker offered to send me another set through they're warranty, but I'm not going to risk the issue continuing and will just order from another manufacturer.
For the price, these headphones are awesome. Full, rich sound and very comfortable. I have been super happy with Anker headphones. I also have some spirit pros for the gym. Highly recommend them.

review_title: Music when noise cancelling is on is not very good quality
review_text: Sounds better when noise cancelling is off. When noise cancelling is on, there is a buzzing sound and the music or whatever I listen to takes a hit as well from the noise cancelling. I have the previous model of the Soundcore noise cancelling as well, and the noise cancel on the newer headphones is definitely more noticeable, but, again, at a cost of worse sound when music is playing. I also have a fairly old wired noise cancelling headphone from nose and that is still far superior sound to the anker headphones. I guess you get what you pay for. For the current price (got one on a sale), however, I would be happy to stick with the new anker

I was looking to replace my broken Bose QuietComfort 20's with something I could use at the office to drown out noise while providing a good listening experience. Was happy to find an Anker product that met those requirements for a price that seemed very reasonable. Pros: - Pleased with the sound quality. I'm not an audiophile, but these are great for my 'general listening' needs - No noticeable "hiss" when noise cancelling is on. - Noise cancelling is great, especially when ambient noise isn't too loud. They're great for my office. - Even using the noise cancelling, these carry a charge that is good enough for a few days of use, in my case. Really pleased with that. Cons - After wearing for about an hour+ straight of wearing these I usually have to take them off to give my head a rest -- over ears just feel restrictive to me. This is true of most headphones, so not blaming the product for this. - I'm a little disappointed in the build of these. Anker's stuff is usually so solid that I didn't expect creaky joints. I may have been expecting too much for this pricepoint. Overall, I'd say for $60 you can't go wrong. I've been pleased with these!

My sound preferences: I own the Bose Soundlink Mini, JayBird wireless ear buds and cheaper Anker ear buds-all excellent poducts. My usage for Q20: travel on airplanes, at home for music or tv via streaming device. The SoundCore Q20 are solidly built and comfortable. Sound quality is good and there's a bass boost button. Not as good as an equalizer app like JayBird but that's a cost trade-off. In listening to a variety of music I did not feel the Q20s made my listening experience bad. True, they don't have the articulation of Bose where you can hear every plink of an instrument, but overall the sound experience is good, satisfying and full. NC is okay: they will lower the noise of a dishwasher, for example, to a mild hum instead of an annoyance. There's no case, just a rubbery bag which has an unpleasant odor, so plan on an extra $13 for a case which is fine because you can choose your preferred configuration of folded or flat layout. Very good value. Recommended for people who want the function of wireless with a sturdy build and price point that doesn't make you worry about traveling with them.
Love these headphones, but unfortunately I have experienced an allergic reaction to the ear cushions. Wondering if there is an ear cushion replacement for them.
A+

review_title: Ok design, poor sound quality, mediocre battery life.
review_text: Sub par headphones - with the overall sound quality being very poor. Probably the biggest issue with these headphones is the fact that there is a slight delay when using the headphones and watching videos (youtube) on mobile.

Had a problem with left channel was at about 70% and right channel at 30% volume. Resetting did not cure the problem. After contacting Anker they sent out a return label and within three days I received a new headset, which now works flawlessly - as it should. Anker stands behind its products and has a great customer service.
This is the second pair I get and it does not work properly. The sound quality is not good.
Sounds great. Connects quickly to all my devices. Charge is lasting a really long time.
The volume is low running wireless but perfect with cord to other device.

review_title: more than what you pay for
review_text: really quite good for the price point. They won't win any style points but the sound quality and noise-cancelling is excellent.
Great headphones for the price

review_title: They're almost perfect if they can be a little louder in ANC mode.
review_text: Almost perfect headphone. I just wish they can be a little louder when in ANC mode. Comfortable headphone, decent build & sound quality for the price.

These headphones are a great, basic noise cancelling option without any bells and whistles. If you just want a comfortable pair of headphones that noise cancel most droning noises with decent sound quality, this is it. It's basic but there are no glaring faults. I would expect these headphones to be closer to low 100s pricepoint. Great headphones for the price. Noise cancellation is good enough to completely remove low, constant noises (Air conditioners, refrigerator, outside noises, engine/airplane). Doesn't do a fantastic job of removing less predictable sounds like voices, but has enough passive noise cancellation to eliminate some of those sounds. Sound quality is "good". I have no complaints, but I'm not an audiophile by any means. For the price point it definitely sounds great. Only complaint is the bass boost is a bit much. Build quality is "average", which is great for this price-point. They don't feel incredibly cheap but obviously don't feel like a $300 headset. This headset is remarkably light. Very comfortable set. Ears get a tad hot over time but the headset is very comfortable to wear, even more comfortable than some higher end models. Both wireless and wired mode work well. Battery life is actually superb. Last all day.

review_title: Replacement unit stopped charging after 4 months :(
review_text: Update: Replacement unit seems not have that issue that often. However, it stopped charging after just 4 months! The sound is great, ANC does a good job reducing the noise; HOWEVER, there's a SERIOUS problem. When ANC is enabled, any moderate shaking/vibration movement (fast walking on hard floor or jogging) willl cause the headphones to emit VERY LOUD cracking/popping sound. In addition, when entering a car and closing the car door, the sudden change in pressure also cause the loud cracking/popping noise. Another way to reproduce the problem is to tap on the top of the headband (when wearing it). This issue only appear when ANC is enabled, the cracking noise is unbearable rendering the ANC unusable when I'm not sitting still. It could just happened to be a quality issue with my specific pair, I'm getting a replacement and will update the review.

review_title: I used to believe in Anker.
review_text: As the titles states, I used to believe in the Anker brand. I swore by it and purchased their various usb chargers. I have their SoundCore portable speaker and it preforms well. Everything went south when I was bragging about the quality of the brand to my friends during a vacation. I was sharing their 5 port corded usb charger; New in box, when 2 of the ports failed after a day of use. That made me look like a complete fool of course. As for these headphones, the battery life is lacking. There is also a lot of quiet buzzing in them. I have exceptional hearing and use my various headsets at low volume, this buzzing absolutely ruins any sound quality they might otherwise offer. The only thing that's outstanding about them is the noise cancelling feature, it's very effective. Unfortunately the other problems ruin that. I'd avoid these despite the attractive price.
Blue tooth range 50' Battery 40+ hours very comfortable

review_title: Noise cancelling isn't supposed to be sound cancelling.
review_text: Let's deal with the mythology called 'noise cancelling'. With my Bose 35s, I can hear a flight attendant ask if I'd like something to drink as if she was in my living room. What I cannot hear, however, is the engines, the blowers, the whines. It is noise cancelling, not sound cancelling. And, that's priceless on a cross country flight. The other complaint I've seen in these reviews is Bluetooth dropping. Keep in mind that a good Bluetooth connection requires both devices, the headphones AND the phone or tablet or computer to work well and be fully updated and reasonably new. If guess that most of the dropping Bluetooth complaints are related to older devices. Anker builds great devices = it's not fair to compare them to Bose 35s and yet, at $50, they do a pretty great job for a 6th of the cost.

I came here from a wirecutter budget pick recommendation and as a broke medical student they seemed worth the risk. I cannot recommend these enough if you're looking for a decent pair of noise cancelling headphones and you're on a budget. I put them on in a loud library, turn on the NC, and with music on its like no one else exists, without music you can still hear people but far less. Cons are they are a bit big even on the smallest adjustment but not enough that they're uncomfortable. The connection to BT was so easy and the battery life has been fantastic and I have yet to charge them. They're not fancy but they absolutely do the job.
Absolutely great for the price! I am sure avid sound junkies may find them lacking in somethign but these work great for airplane and public noise cancelling.

Great battery life, quick recharge, clear sound and blocks just about every sound in the room when noise cancelling is on. I especially like that it is blue tooth but has an audio cable to use with devices that do not have bluetooth capability. I can use it with my phone, my chromebook, and my computer.
Great on everything but theres laf when using with transmitter on tv..

review_title: More comfortable than Bose or Sony, barely acceptable noise cancelling
review_text: Over the last few months, I've had and used the Sony WH-1000xm3, the Bose QC 35 II and this headset. Without question, this is actually the most comfortable of the three. The earcups are soft, the headband fits well and my ears aren't sore after an hour-plus train ride. In terms of the noise cancelling ... it's decent, and better than I'd expect for the price. It's nowhere in the same universe as the Sony headset. It's closer to the Bose, though still not nearly as good. But then again, the Sony headset is about $300 these days and the Bose headset is $250+. This is $60 or a bit less, more comfortable than the other two and with noise cancelling that's good enough for a podcast on a crowded commuter train at rush hour. If you absolutely must have superior noise cancelling, get the Sony headset. If good enough is good enough, or if you prioritize comfort, save $250 and buy these. EDIT: Updating this review after two weeks to lower to two stars. These are still really comfortable but for whatever reason the noise cancelling has stopped working. The light is on, the automated voice says NC is turned on, but there is almost no cancellation whatsoever happening anymore. Don't know if something broke, certainly didn't update any software, but they've almost totally stopped filtering. Shame, as they were good value for the two weeks they worked.

review_title: Bluetooth might be flakey, good sound cancelling
review_text: Every so often these head phones cut out. Can happen every few minutes which gets annoying. I like the sound quality and love sound cancelling. You can vacuum and hardly hear the vacuum.

I got these on sale for a few upcoming business trips and they worked great. Never used noise cancelling headphones before so I can't compare them to more expensive brands but the background and engine noise was almost gone when the feature was enabled. I actually had to turn the music volume way down because it was too loud. Sound quality was great, build quality seems good so far, and battery life has matched expectations.

I bought these mainly to see if the noise-canceling would be effective enough to minimize the construction noise from a new hotel being built next door. So far the major test has been the beep-beep-beep of the vehicles backing up and this headset does eliminate most of those sounds. However, I am unable to get a good connection with any device except my phone. When I try connecting to my Fitbit, Jabra Earbuds or Amazon Echo the connection is extremely choppy. I am waiting for a response from Customer Support, if they can solve the problem I will update the review.
No los recomiendo

review_title: The popping noise is a real problem
review_text: Not bad for the price point, but there is a pretty major issue. Sound--These sound pretty good! No real complaints. Fit--Comfortable to wear, but these are definitely designed for larger heads. Mine are being used at the smallest headband setting and I would probably adjust them down more if I could. ANC--This is where the frustration lies. For ~$50 these offer above average noise cancelling. Used on transit and in noisy environments I was pleased with the isolation/cancellation but... The popping sound is real, and I see this in other reviews as well. A tap on top of the headband, a jog across the intersection, lightly pounding my chest, adjusting the headphones, turning my head suddenly are all things that trigger a loud popping noise in the earpieces. It is quite jarring and not at all pleasant. This does not happen with the ANC turned off. I thought this was a one-off issue with my headphones, so I ordered a replacement pair. Same issue out of the box on the 2nd pair. I have also discovered that the issue only occurs with a fully or mostly charged battery, as it goes away when the headphones have medium or low battery.

review_title: USELESS. Hey Anker, are these really yours, or just name badging on an inferior product ????
review_text: CONS: Extremely poor design for fit They flop around your head, just sitting here, tilt my head forward slowly and they flop around Cups do stay over the ears well, they slide down Very SLOPPY fit PROS: Don't know! How can there be pros if they don't stay on your head or ears???? Note to ANKER: I use so many of your products and they are so great! What happened here? It like a train wreck You should take your name off of these because it will hurt your reputation on your so many other good items
It works. Good sound, great noise reduction, comfortable and solidly built. A real bargain.

review_title: Works like a $400 Headset for 1/6th the cost
review_text: Everything works, the sound is great, and it pairs to even the most tricky Bluetooth device in our house. Looked seriously at the Bose, etc because of the sound and build quality, but took a chance on the Anker. Anker has provided many peripherals like USB hubs, portable batters, etc. with great success. I could not be happier. It's early days, so something bad could develop, but for now its very much worth the price.

review_title: Good but I wanted a Bit Better
review_text: .. it is not a bad headset, I just wanted just a little bit better then these delivered. They are great for the price.

The bass won't blow you away but the value for what you are getting will! I use these in the office and they are comfortable for hours at a time. I also just took them on a 2.5 hour flight from KY-->FL and they did a really good job filtering out the airplane drone (I was sitting on the wing so right next to the engines). The mic kept getting hit by the overhead air vent so that got a little annoying but not the fault of the headphones really. I have them synced with my iPhone 8 Plus, Dell XPS 13 9380, and my son's iPhone 6S via bluetooth. I've also used them with the cable connection (on the plane - headrest mounted screen) and they work great both ways. I've had them for about two months now and the battery life is fantastic!
Was really surprised with the quality for the price. Sturdy build, sound quality is good. Excellent buy for price point.

I bought these headphones to use in vehicles and planes for noise cancelling but I'm considering just giving them to someone else. Like other reviewers have stated, any slight bump or movement, such as going over slightly rough pavement in a car, creates a popping sound. In a car or bus there's also what I can only describe as a buffeting sound -- a repeated low frequency sound that hits several times per second that becomes extremely irritating and almost painful to bear. I've owned other noise canceling headphones, even cheap ones, and never experienced any of these problems. In addition, there's no way to activate the noise canceling without turning on the bluetooth feature of the headphones, leading to a shorter battery life for noise cancelling if you're like me and don't use bluetooth all the time. Maybe the way you use them will be fine, but for many people like myself they're of far too subpar quality to handle. Anker should have invested more time in real life use testing of these headphones and the obvious result of that makes me distrust the brand as a whole.

First off I got these to test and compare them to the Life 2. Sadly, I wanted to like these I really did, but they are 2 steps backwards from the Life 2 and the Vortex and Space NC. These just do not sound good, the sound is all muddled and thats with bass up turned off. Even using an equalizer I could not get acceptable sound from these. With bassup on the volume would decrease drastically and just furthered the muddiness of the sound, Keeping bass up off the volume was decently loud...but of course at no volume level did it sound good. Battery life is probably the best feature of these headphones as it lasted: With ANC I got around 25 hours with 75% volume, without ANC I got almost 28 hours with 75% volume. Both times are with bass up off. The ANC is ok, given the price point I dont expect Bose quality, with that said it does help drown out low frequency noises and can help one concentrate when working. But as far as recommending these, I cannot and advice users to spend a few extra bucks and get the Soundcore Vortex or Space NC

review_title: My experience with it from 2 star to 5 star!
review_text: I can call myself Anker fanboy. I always look for their product to compare and try. They have perfect customer service and everything. But this headphone disappointed me so bad. The only reason i got this cause it is hybrid active nc headphone. But it makes that white noise. It is so annoying. When you don’t listen anything it makes that white noise and some short signals that i can hear. I was planning to use it in my very long flight to sleep and rest. But it is not possible. For the price it is a fair active noise cancellation. But it is not hybrid, it should be feedforward active noise cancellation which has only 1 mic outside. I had to returned it sadly. It could be a perfect product for this price and service. ——————————————————————- UPDATE They reached me with an email to find out what is wrong with the product and to ensure customer satisfaction. After mailing each other couple of times they sent me a replacement. I am glad they take the action cause i figured that the first headphone i got was defective! Now I don’t have any problem with the new headphone. Noise cancellation is perfect for its price level. Comparing to Bose NC700, Anker shows %75-%80 successful performance. Sound quality is really really good. Surprisingly rich and loud. Sometimes too much bass but you can turn extra bass off with a pyhsical button. I am very satisfied with their customer service and experience. Also with the product! 5 star.

What I liked: • Price Point – $60.00 for a solid pair of Noise Cancelling headphones is a great price. • Battery Life: Rated at 40 hours of battery life. • Sound: This probably being the most important. The sound on these is really good. I’m not comparing them to the Sony or Bose Headphones of the world as that wouldn’t be fair since those brands cost so much more. • Noise Cancelling: Noise Cancelling built into this headphone does a pretty good job. Again, I’m not comparing to Sony or Bose. • Build Quality: These seem to be built well and I think they’ll last a while if taken care of. I do wish they came with a hard case. • Comfort: To me these are very light and comfortable. • Connection: Bluetooth 5 is always welcomed to reduce latency. What I didn’t like: • BassUp Technology: I like that these offer more a more bass option with the BassUp technology however I felt that it was a bit much and overall made the mids and highs quite a bit muddied. • Charge Port: Micro USB……It’s time for everyone to use USB C. • Carrying Case: I do wish these had a hard-shell carry case. Overall Experience: • Overall my felling on these is for $60.00 it’s a win. I would recommend these to anyone that needs a solid pair of headphones that sound nice. Great job Soundcore!

review_title: Not bad for the price, volume not great
review_text: Nice, comfortable headphones, clear sound but if you like loud quality sound, these are not for you. When listening to music they're decent, but when watching video on a tablet or phone, the volume is pretty low even when the volume is turned up. Probably give these to one of my kids & try something else.

review_title: THIS IS SIMPLY AMAZING SOUND PRODUCTION
review_text: Very clear rich sound and for action sports fans when watching basketball you hear the shoe squeaks net shots rim dunks crowd cheers so clear it puts you in the game. When watching football you can distinct the sounds too so well and when watching boxing my goodness🤩....it's as if you were facing the punches. The noise cancellation is very effective. I tested having my fan on and when I turn on the NC the fan noise is blocked out very fairly well and the focus of the music becomes very powerful. You will love purchasing this headphones. As if the Bass wasn't rich and smooth enough already, it has bass boost in there as well (double click the play button). This headphone is superior for the price.
I was so ready to give it a 10 out of 10 but one thing mess it up. The build quality and the sound from the build quality. I almost return then because of the sound.

The earpads on these headphones get way too hot way too quickly. I don't like putting them on because I know my ears will quickly become hot. I can wear my Audio-Technica M50X headphones for hours, so these are disappointing and I will need to swap out the earcups to use them for extended periods of time.

review_title: Quite effective, and great performance, for a very fair price
review_text: In the past month we flew on a tedious multiple-legged international round trip using these headphones. I really appreciated the noise reduction (not complete, but very substantial), and the sound quality. And they are reasonably comfortable with the large soft ear pads. The bluetooth wireless feature made it easy to listen to music stored on my phone without being tangled in cords. Nice to have the backup stereo jack and cable for if/when the rechargeable battery is depleted. Much more effective than a slightly cheaper model from a name brand that we bought 2 years ago. We will be buying a second set for the next trip!

I have been using the Life Q20 headphones for about 2 weeks now and they are worth every penny. Anker made an impressive headphones for under $60!!! If you are looking for an impressive sounding pair of headphones without breaking the bank then you found your pair! Let me go over the details General Specs The Life QC20 pack bluetooth 5.0, active noise cancelling, Hi Res Audio and 40 hours of battery life with ANC on! The headphones could be used in a wireless or wired mode and come with an auxiliary cable if your phone supports an auxiliary jack but mine does not so I have to use them in wireless mode. The headphones come with a carrying pouch, too I was hoping it's hard carrying case vs a pouch so I don't have to worry much about the headphones while they are in my gym bag. Design and BuildThe headphones are very stylish and well built. Out of the box, you feel you're handling $300 headphones and not $59 headphones. The black and graphite grey colors are perfectly balanced and the headphone adjustment mechanism is spot on, not stiff or loose. The ear pads are memory foam wrapped in faux leather, they are comfortable on the ear but I hoped they would be a tad bigger and wrap around the ear. The buttons are big enough and easily accessible, thumbs up to Anker! SoundThe headphones sound great, maybe if you're an audiophile you will have different opinion but they sound better than my beats that cost 3 times as much. I did not find active noise cancelling effective at low volumes but once I turned it up to 40% and above I could not hear anything but my music. The range of the bluetooth 5.0 allows you to enjoy crystal clear sound over 30 feet away. Battery LifeThe battery life on those headphones is impressive with 40 hours of playback with ANC on! Turn off ANC can you can extend the battery significantly. I really never needed to turn the headphones past 50-60% so I was able to get the 40 hours of battery life on a single charge easily. Obviously, if use the headphones in wired mode then battery life is of no issue. I can't believe what Anker was able to do with those headphones for under $60. They have a great battery life, excellent sound, good noise cancelling, wired and wireless modes and support bluetooth 5.0. If you are not looking to spend $300-$400 on a pair of ANC headphones and not an audiophile then those are headphones for you. Now Anker just needs to release a hard carrying case for them, you can do it Anker!! !

The best of this product is the battery life, I been using for a week and still didn't need to recharge. Impressive. Sound is good, expect than the volume is reduced and I cannot get too loud sound, I guess to protect your ears, which is good, I guess. Noise cancellation is ok, a bit weird when you move your head and the system try to compensate the noise surrond, the sound change with it.

Okay. So when I first got this, the sound quality was good for the price. After a few days though, I started hearing this loud popping noise that would only go away If I either turned the volume all the way down or If I turned off the cancellation which was one of the main reasons I got it. Doing that renders this headphone essentially useless to me because I can’t take that loud noise coming from it and I would like to be able to listen to the music. It’s a good price but honestly I don’t think it was worth it.

review_title: It’s less expensive for a reason
review_text: Noise cancelling was nonexistant and at random times these headphones have this strange crackling that actually hurts to hear. I cannot, in good conscience, keep using these because I’m afraid of what will happen to my hearing. These suck. Save money for a decent pair.
thank you
Excellent on airplanes even without the NC on. Feels sturdy and more stable than others of the same price range.
I've had beats headphones, chorded bose noise canceling headphones and these stand up against all of them. completely satisfied.

review_title: Sound great, comfortable, ok noise-cancelling for the price
review_text: So I personally use Sony WH1000XM3 after trying the Bose for quite some time. This Anker pair was a gift to my 15 year old son. He's used mine in the past and knows the noise cancelling is not as impressive and neither is the sound but, for the price, these are a very decent pair of headphones. He loves them and can comfortably wear them all day long ( for better or for worse). If you want a good pair of noise-cancelling headphones but you don;t want to spend $250 these are perfect.

review_title: (Update, sent replacement) Loud popping with Noise Cancelling on.
review_text: Update that Anker sent me a replacement. I'm not sure if it is running newer software or a hardware revision, but it has fixed the really loud popping sounds. I still get small sounds, when really loud activity happens, but it's not the ear hurting pops and I do use these on a loud bus. (Original Review here: Like some of the other reviews, I get loud popping sounds when sudden external noise happens and ANC is on. I wear these on a bus during my commute and whenever the bus hits a bump, I get massive popping sounds. It makes these nearly useless as the noise is more jarring than just letting the bump noise come through. I end up wearing these without ANC on.)

Used it on a 15 hrs flight, fit nicely and do a very good cancellation of the airplane noise ( but, not like the $300 Sony headphone), I due like the fact that I can still hear few sounds/voices, the charge is super good. Oh, did had another layover and another 2 hrs flight, and 5 days later and the charge still say halfway. For the price it's a 5 Stars.

review_title: Great sound and comfort at this price!
review_text: Outstanding product for the price. Sound quality is excellent at this price point and noise cancelling is rock solid. Nice for an office headphone so you don't have to worry about your QC35s disappearing if you forget them on your desk over the weekend. Only reason don't give it 5 stars for value/quality aspect is that it has VERY annoying habit of disconnecting from bluetooth device; only way I see to reconnect is going into bluetooth options on phone and tapping paired device. Especially annoying if my hands are full and disconnects when I'm jamming out.

These are an excellent set of headphones. The build quality is solid, and I do not see any major flaws. The only thing I would have wished was to have a more solid folding mechanism for the headphones. Because sometimes when I try to fold up the headphones, the ear cups meet in such a way that it presses the buttons on the left earcup. But that is a very minor flaw, and it should not prevent anyone from buying the headphones. The setup was super easy. All I had to do was, enable the Bluetooth on my phone. Then I put the headphones into pairing mode by holding the power button until the blue light started blinking fast, and selected the headphones which showed up on my phone's Bluetooth list. Onto the sound quality. I have gotten decent bass, mids and highs from the set. The noise cancellation works surprisingly well. Even when I don't have any music playing, the noise cancellation works to minimize most of the outside noise, though it could be a bit smoother. When I have music playing, I do not hear a single noise from the outside. I also like the fact that they include an auxiliary cable in case you want to go wired for your listening experience. The case that is included in the box is also very nice. Though I wish a hard case was included instead, but for the price it is okay. The charging was also relatively quick, and I had no outliers in terms of charging time, meaning that it always charged within a reasonable amount of time. Overall I would give these headphones are solid rating of 4.5 / 5. Highly recommended for the $60 price an even better deal if you can get it under that with coupons, etc.

Extremely disappointed worst Anker product I have ever purchased I had high hopes for this product but it fell well short of it. ANC cannot be used if the power is not turned on even my cheap MPOW has that feature to use ANC without powering on the headphone. The audio quality is suspect it breaks up at times when is was watching movies or even talking on the phone. Sometimes laying down with the headphones on watching movies yet get this weird rumbling vibrating sensation from this headset as if it was a rumble feature in a gaming console remote. This was a total wasted purchase I am so not please with this piece of JUNK.

I've always had good luck with Anker products, and these headphones are no exception. I purchased them after being dissatisfied with a pair from another brand (TCL) that was $25 more expensive. I use these Anker headphones primarily for watching TV and movies and listening to music, all via Apple TV. (I live in a condo and don't want to disturb my neighbors.) They connect easily to the Apple TV, and the sound is surprisingly good. The noise canceling blocks the sound of my upstairs neighbor walking around, as well as the sound of a tower fan that I typically keep on high. These headphones are quite comfortable, from the easily adjusted padded headband to the large, padded ear cups; I've been fine wearing these headphones for up to four hours at a time, which says a lot considering I have a large cranium and usually find headphones uncomfortable after 30 minutes or so. The connection is stable as long as I stay in the room where the Apple TV is located or the adjacent kitchen, but if I venture to the back of the condo it begins to break up. Still, for the price, this is a surprisingly good pair of headphones.

review_title: Good buy when budget is inportant. Battery life is super.
review_text: Affordable, comfortable, full sized headphones. Foldable and light weight. A bit much plastic but its price is fair. Sound quality is okay not super.

I'm not an audiophile or expert by any means, but these are very nice. I was using a $300+ pair of Bose headphones for years, and these do the job just as well. Love the cordless nature of them. The battery life is excellent so far, and the controls are fairly intuitive and give nice feedback when used. I prefer the soft bag these use for carrying over the hard case my old Bose headphones used too.
The Power Off button stopped working after 3 weeks.
Very good

review_title: Bose features without the price tag
review_text: These headphones are great. Some of the buttons need some " getting used to" ,like the long press or double tap. Sound quality, comfort, battery life and noise cancelling are great ( 10 hours to Europe) although noise cancelling does NOT work in aux mode . Also the bluetooth stays connected to my TV when using them at home after I turn them off, never had to re-pair or anything like that.

review_title: Entry level noise cancelers, good on the road
review_text: Let's make one thing abundantly clear: When it comes to great Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, there are definitely tiers that correspond with price. The Anker Soundcore Life Q20 are nowhere near the level of the premium ANC headphones yet at the entry level range they are more than worthy investments that can be used on a daily basis. As a frequent traveler, I have tried the Soundcore on a variety of flights (1 hr, 4 hr, and 12 hr) to really see how they feel. Here's a quick synopsis: 1: Audio quality is acceptable, but not "elite." You don't get the full range of mids, the bass isn't quite punchy... but it's acceptable. 2: The ACN feature is a step below the premium models. Cabin noise is a lot more prevalent, engine noise will trickle in too. I was a little surprised how much I could hear of the world around me in this context, and was definitely a bit disappointed with this feature. 3: However, the battery life is stupid good. If you are on any long haul flights, you may not even need to recharge these for the return legs. I clocked 40+ hours on one charge, which absolutely blew me away. Assuming you're not wearing it 2-3 hours a day on top of a long flight, you're good to go. 4: Ahh, bluetooth. What great range you have! Take a stroll up the cabin with the headphones on and there's a good chance you won't go out of range. Really wonderfully done. 5: Comfort is, once again, acceptable. They feel a bit taunt on the head after more than 2 hours. My ears were gasping for fresh air, at that rate. All in all, these are not perfect and definitely not made to last for 3-5 years. But if you need something for the next 1-2 years at an entry level price point, Then you couldn't do much better than the Soundcore Life Q20.

review_title: Pretty good, if price is your primary concern!
review_text: For the price they’re great. If I had one issue it would be that they are slightly incompatible with anyone who wears glasses. It would take a minor design change to resolve that. The noise cancellation is surprisingly good. As with any over the ear headphones there’s a sweat and tightness issue, but that’s not uncommon. Can you get better? Yes. For the price, probably not!

review_title: Great budget headset, excellent customer service and support
review_text: I purchased a set of these in early October. The set is easy to get connected via Bluetooth pairing, with my Android Phone and Windows 10 laptop. They're stylish with clean design. The buttons are easily accessible and have the standard set of functions you'd expect from a set like this. The audio quality is great and the bass enhancement does drive the bass up considerably. The retail packaging is nice but not something that I really care all that much about. Delivery was on time and the package arrived undamaged. The noise cancellation is pretty awesome. This is the first set of headphones I've owned that have noise cancellation, so for me there was a high "gee-wizz" factor. ;>}. The noise cancellation was fantastic for blocking out background noise, and when my Mic worked, people could hear me clearly, even in the worst of background noise conditions. Initially I was impressed. High-end features for a budget price. I picked the over ear style because I work in loud environments and needed to be on calls while working in those areas. This is where I ran into my issues with the product. Many times I'm required to be on calls or in on-line meetings while in loud areas of our factory. Sometimes the headset worked perfectly fine - everyone could hear me and I could hear everyone else. I could also watch videos and hear audio from online music providers. However, many times when in online meetings or while on phone calls, the Mic would not work. Several times, the headset would spontaneously disconnect from my phone or my PC with no apparent reason. If I'm using my PC, I disable the Bluetooth on my phone and vicea-versa. The recommended fix from support was to forget the headset on all devices, power it off, plug into a power source and perform a hard reset. I did that several times but it has not resolved that issue. Another problem I have is there's and extremely loud popping, like a bad connection in the headset. If the headset is shifted too much or if, while walking I go down stairs or step too hard, the headset makes a very loud popping noise. I'm currently working with support to get an RMA. Hopefully the next set works better. If I had not run into these issues, I would have ranked these at a 4, or better. ************************** UPDATE ***************************** Soundcore customer service and tech support are top notch. My replacements were on the way immediately after my RMA'ed set shipped out. I don't know that I've ever had a better customer service experience. They kept me updated, checked in on me during the process and followed up after I received the new set, to ensure I was satisfied with my replacement. The replacement set was brand new in retail packaging. Exactly as if I purchased a new set off the shelf. I work in loud areas of my factory but these things make you feel like you are working in your own private studio! Crystal clear calls, bad @$$ audio playback, and Skype, Zoom and WebEx calls are flawless. People are constantly asking me which headset I'm using. I'm floored by the performance of these. Sure its a budget price there's no expense spared with the components and output of these babies. Not just in calls but the active noise cancelling, the bass response and the mid/ high range audio properties. I don't get that ear-piercing audio from the highs, just nice balanced highs and mids. Bump up the bass and you start thinking your 2 Pac or Biggie bumpin' to your favorite jams. Rock, classic rock, rap, hip Hop, anything you want to listen too just sounds better with these. I know you want to impress people around you by getting Bose, Sony's, Harmon Kardon or Sennhiser headsets, but you'd be a fool. Actually I'm going to point and laugh at people that pick those brands over those because they wasted their money in a failed attempt to look cool. Thanks for taking such good care of me, Soundcore team! you've made a customer for life.
Not bad headphones. Only problem is they’re not loud AT ALL. Makes them basically unusable

I absolutely love these headphones. They are very comfortable and produce a high quality sound. I have tried a lot of different brands, at a lower price and more expensive, but these have to be on of the best. Easy to connect via blue tooth, excellent battery life and the comfort while running is awesome. I Highly recommend.

review_title: Great Sound experience for the price
review_text: I was blown away with the price of these over the ear headphones when I purchased them back in September.they have great sound and feel amazing. I am an Anker fan and have used almost all of there ear bud headphones. I did have one issue with my pair the sound became imbalanced in one ear so I contacted Anker and they sent me a replacement headset and I've had no issues.
Great on an airplane

review_title: The Anker Soundcore Life Q20 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones are terrible!
review_text: The Anker Soundcore Life Q20 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones that I purchased came defective (the right side of the headphones did not work) and were very uncomfortable because they would not fit my head right. What a waste of money!

review_title: Sudden loud sounds will cause the noise cancelling to shriek
review_text: I think the product is adequate.............except when you want them to work with the noise cancelling mode. If there is a strong wind, slamming a door or other loud shocking sound - there is a shrill sudden noise that is extremely disorienting. Buyer beware. I basically do not use the noise cancelling because of that. I purchased these since my wife took my Cowin E7s and I wish I just bought another pair of Cowins. The noise cancelling does not have negative effects when there are sudden noises. The non noise cancelling mode works well and the shrill jarring noises don't occur in that mode.

review_title: Decent wireless headphones. One the best in this price range.
review_text: These are no Bose, Sony, or Beats headphones. The sound quality is pretty good. You will get small nuances in songs that you might not hear with most basic corded headphones. The noise cancellation will take out small sounds but higher volumes things will get through. It is a good headphone for home use. I use it mostly for when I am on my laptop at a coffee house or on my desktop at home. They are a good budget level headphone.
For the price you pay, Anker provides unbeatable quality. Don’t expect a Bose or Sony headset and the Soundcore Life will exceed your expectations
Improve my driving experience!!! No more noise fatigue))))))

review_title: Exceptional value with a couple of vices. Awesome customer service.
review_text: To begin with build quality is reasonable - when I held it in my hand for the first time, I was shocked how light it was. No breaks so far; but below are my speculations. The usual points of failure are the swivel joints of the cups and the slider mechanism for the headband. The swivel joints are made of good quality plastic, but I don't expect them to last for ever, as they are loaded when you wear the headphones. But my main concern is the headband - fixed metal with plastic sliding over it. This is a recipe for disaster. The rigidity of the metal band and the plasticity of the plastic slider results in the plastic slider disintegrating at around the one year mark. Ideally the plastic slider should be reinforced with metal on the inside, so it becomes metal slider in a metal band. I'll update if I decide to have this till then. This has not been an issue after 7 months. Speaks volumes about the quality of plastics used. Skullcandy can learn a thing or two from this model. One aux cable and a micro USB charging cable were provided in the box along with a pleather finished carry pouch. Comfort is - good. The cushions are kinda small and may make them "over the ears" if you have larger earlobes, but I don't have this problem and I have no complaints. The cushions are soft enough and there clamp force is not excessive. It is freezing here, so can't comment about how it reacts to sweat and hot weather - something for an update. Sound quality is above average for it's price. The bass is a little boosted, not overdone - but it is muddy. There is no separation at the lower frequencies and you can't resolve the different instruments and the different tones. The mids are there with better resolution and the highs are slightly recessed. Overall not tiring or shrill and just about worth it for the price. No aptX support here, so I expected latency, but surprisingly, there is none. Can definitely use this for watching movies and videos. I suspect this is the reason for the general lack of separation and resolution in the otherwise good sound. I didn't like the bassup feature, makes the already muddy lows muddier. Noise cancelling is great for this price, almost all the lower frequencies - road noise, water flowing., etc are filtered out almost completely. People speaking, not at all. But this is quite impressive to say the least. It almost has the Sony XB950N1 (IMO one of the worst built headphones ever) beat in noise cancelling, which is impressive at this price point. Connection strength is impressive, I can now move around the house (or move the music source) without the music being interrupted (there are other actions that do that, more on that later). Bluetooth 5.0 seems to do the trick here. Battery life is also impressive, I expect to hit the claimed 30 hour mark easily. Now the issues I've had with the device 1. Even though this is the costliest headphone, and the latest one at that, in the soundcore website, it looks like this is NOT the flagship product in the headphone category. The soundcore app doesn't support the life series (only the true wireless earbuds and the Space NCs, the previous flagships, are supported). So, no way to adjust the sound profile. 2. When I walk normally (or when I am not absolutely still) with these headphones on, there is a faint creaking/vibrating sound coming from the cans - like a small weight mounted at the end of a horizontal spring is vibrating due to the movement. This is an isolated issue, didn't happen with the replacement I received. 3. The bigger problem is when I eat something (move the jaw) or when I walk fast or when the vehicle hits a small bump in the road, there is a short jarring high picthed screech which is very irritating, to say the least. This is what I need to see if I can live with. This is prevalent in all three of these headphones I've used so far. So, if the ride is tough, you will have to switch NC off. So, is it a good value proposition? On a normal day, it is. There are not that many better options at the price point of $50. If NC is important then none as good till you hit the $150 price range. But with Thanksgiving around and the Sennheiser HD4.50 BTNCs discounted at $80, I believe it is a better deal to shell out the $30 for the Sennheisers, only if you are okay with the Sennheiser quality of uninspiring, but very high quality sound. The Sennheisers have bluetooth 4.0 with aptX support. Which should be fine. But at the end of the day, if you can live with the small niggling problems, these are a steal at around the $50 price range. The Sennheisers above had a vice like compression which became very uncomfortable very soon. [UPDATE] reduced rating because the power button is acting weird. Not powering on or off most of the times. Also cannot double press it to connect the second device. I have to put the headphone on charge for the power button to work exactly once after that to turn the device on or put it in pairing mode. After pairing the power button again goes back to not working. I am trying the reset (charge while long pressing power * volume+ buttons). Will update rating if the reset fixes the issue. Else i will have to make a warranty claim. (UPDATE) Raised a warranty claim with the description of the problem, and received a replacement within a week. Almost no questions asked. The new one works great, at least for now. But honestly I didn't expect this to last this long and perform this well, for it's price. So, definitely worth the price and I would highly recommend - especially if you are about to buy a Skullcandy - these sound much more balanced (better implementation of bass boost) and are better built at a third the price. Can't go wrong with these.

Para dar un poco de contexto diré que tengo unos audífonos Bose pero esta vez quería un producto más económico para uso en oficina o viajes, con las siguientes características: calidad decente de audio, inalámbricos y con la función de cancelación de ruido NC. Con este fin adquirí previamente los Sony WH-CH700N los cuales tienen calidad de audio buena pero pésima NC (Noise Cancellation - Cancelación de ruido), por recomendaciones de varias páginas adquirí los Anker Soundcore y verifiqué que realmente tienen una buena calidad de audio (recomiendo desactivar BassUp) y el NC funciona bastante bien, obviamente no llega a los equipos lideres de Sony o Bose, que pueden ser catalogados de nivel alto, pero diría que estos audífonos Anker se encuentran a un nivel medio alto, solamente que para bien o mal, depende del uso personal, diré que la cancelación de ruido está configurada en modo que no elimina tan eficientemente las voces de la gente a tu alrededor, pero funciona muy bien para frecuencias generadas por equipos de aire acondicionado, turbinas de avión, etc. Aunque los Sony CH700 tienen una ligera ventaja de audio y materiales, prefiero los Anker Lite Q20, porque además de las ventajas mencionadas previamente, tienen mayor duración de batería, carga mucho más rápida y un precio muy económico.

review_title: Drops bluetooth connection after hour of use
review_text: Decent headphones with somewhat comfortable wear, altought after about an hour start bothering my ears, headphones just seem not to be enough to hide my ears entirely within a cup so be aware if you have larger size ears. Another thing that drives me mad and the reason for low rating is that bluetooth can disconnect on its own without any input from me and within a foot of device it is connected to. Not sure why it drops connection but now that I cannot any longer return these headphones I am irritated (only used them for a month or so) and wish I could just send them back. Save yourself $60 and don't buy. Save and get something better.

Great value for a $60 pair of headphones, but the power button is annoying meaning they're hard to turn off/on. It requires a 3 second hold, and you have to check to ensure you've turned it off properly so they don't go flat.
Super comfortable, great bassup

So far, I've only tested these in the comfort of my home and they work great. I'll soon try them out on an airplane to see how it drowns out the noise of the engines to watch a movie on my tablet. The sound is great, nothing is lost with the base and I really enjoy music with these. IT doesn't seem to matter if I use the wire or Blue Ray connection, the quality of the sound is the same.

review_title: Great value sound and functional NC for those prone to lose headphones
review_text: Bass heavy but generally great sound for ~$50, oddly long press-time to turn on and off, sound cancelling is functional and a bonus in office/train/plane.

Just got them today so early to decide, Right now I’m very happy with sound quality, noise canceling and comfort. Amazing value! Been considering spending big bucks on Sony or Bose, at this stage I don’t see the point.

review_title: High Quality Headphones for the Budget-Conscious
review_text: These are fantastic. I bought them to better my focus at work, and they did just the trick. The ANC is not the best you will get out of all options, but my firm opinion is that this is the best you will get it at this price point. I would say it is comparable to a $100+ pair certainly. The audio quality is pretty great as well. Full and mostly flat response, not quite up to par of an audiophile’s level of quality but nonetheless these sound like a quality set of headphones. I did not charge the headphones at all when they arrived. straight out of the box, powered on, and paired to my phone and ipad. Your results may vary, however I got 8 straight days of continued use without ever plugging them in to charge. I would assume an average of 4.5 to 5 hours of use per day, when factoring interruptions. To summarize, Anker yet again made a quality product. This company seems to do very well with their product line, and this is no exception.

I like every feature of these headphones. They sync with my iPad to watch movies but do not lip sync with my new LG tv. Tried everything but the headphone sound was almost second behind the lips on screen. Intollerable. Will have to return.

review_title: 40 hrs of battery life with NC on
review_text: Excellent battery life, very good noise cancellation, Audio quality quite good

review_title: Would not Recommend it for Calling and Everyday use
review_text: I am writing after using this product for a week constantly. Active noise cancellation is good to remove constant background noise only when the unit is switched on. Overall, call quality, sound quality and Bluetooth connection are ok but found many issues which make this unit not suitable for everyday uses. The headphone is not stable on head. It shifts very easily even with slight movement. I tried to adjust headband many times to get the best fit but no luck. It also generates heat in ear cups so not comfortable to wear for more than 30 min. Sound is breaking many times when one is moving. Wired rumbling and popping sound are coming while talking in noisy and windy surroundings which is very annoying. I tried to reset it twice but the problem was the same. I would not recommend it if going to use it for call and everyday use.

I really like the sound quality and noise cancellation. They are also very comfortable and they damp sound a lot even without NC on. Before I had only one pair of Sony NC headphones that were about three times more expensive than these a few years ago. That's my only comparison and I like these more. Built quality is perfect and the size is probably large. I have a bit larger head, most baseball hats are tight for me but these headphones on my head are fully closed, I mean not adjustment is necessary by extending the band. They don't look as sharp as many others but I'm very happy with them. The battery life is very good, I charged them only once after a month of almost everyday use for about 1 each time. It translate to about 20 hours of constant use and they were not fully discharged yet. And once I left them ON but not playing for 24 hours.

review_title: 1st pair of headphones would not pair reliably. Replacement phones OK.
review_text: Had a pairing issue with the first pair. AnkerDirect was gracious enough to replace the headphones (even after my Amazon return window had closed). Took a star off for the Bass Boost. These have plenty of bass in the normal listening mode. Lacking mid-range punch. But overall not bad for Anker's first NC phones, at an affordable price!

Works great. I live in NYC and I got these because I couldn't stand to have all the noises of the city in my ears one more day. They are comfortable enough that I can wear them all day no problem, including two recent cross country flights and 4 hour Amtrak trips. I got them in mid October and have only charged them twice since then, and one of those charges wasn't because it was out of battery, but because I was leaving on that cross country trip and wanted to get them topped up. When traveling I don't have to bring a charging cable as I know it will stay charged the entire trip. The noise cancellation is exactly what I wanted - I can still hear that a train announcement is happening and pause my music to hear what it is, but I can't hear the roar of the train, and it dampers the loud conversations happening around me. Jackhammering in Times Square becomes a dull buzz instead of the loud roar it usually is. Sound quality is great (approved by the two professional musicians in my life) and the controls are easy to learn and use, and super handy. Even though I have an Apple Watch I now just use the controls on the headphones. I'm also finding that they double as earmuffs for the winter. If you are considering these, just get them, they are truly great - especially for $50!

review_title: Comfortable fit, clean, clear, crisp sound reproduction without interference from external sources.
review_text: *comfortable fit: With other headsets, I used to feel a discomfort after prolonged use. With Anker, however, I don’t even know they’re there, such a soft, velvety coolness. *Sound: Full, clean, stereo, can hear the individual instruments,like I’m in a room by myself soaking in the music. *Smell: None. No plastic smell or other nauseating odors. *Noise cancelling: in the house I can only see lips moving when people are talking to me when it’s on. *Calls: I used WhatsApp just a moment ago and the party on the other end was able to receive my call with great clarity. I was able to open WhatsApp using Siri (reg’d TM). *Airplane use: Ill be able to give accurate and honest feedback when I fly next 3 weeks. *Battery: Simply marvelous. I’m using this thing for 2 days now, for intermittently long periods, and the battery refuses to die! I hope I’m not jumping the gun, but I can safely recommend this Anker Soundcore, which cost just over $50. It’s performance is beautiful, smooth, and overall, can do “battle” with the really big names and come out without bruises or scratches: for me, a hidden treasure waiting to be unleashed. I’m really happy with my purchase.
Comfortable on my ears, does block out a lot of sound, but clicking the NC button doesn't seem to do anything different. Good battery life.

You can't beat the price of the Anker Soundcore Life Q20 headphones and the quality is just outstanding. I have many different pairs of audiophile headphones and these have audio quality to rival my best pair. The noise cancelling isn't as good as the $300 competition, but for about $50 you get noise cancelling that is pretty darn good. Highly recommend!

Got these headphones and they sound great connected to my phone right away worked perfectly. Once in awhile they would cut out or disconnect from my phone. So I started trying to figure out if it was the headphones or my cell phone or the app I was using. Tried different app still did it then noticed that when I was connected to my Bluetooth portable speaker everything worked fine. I contacted customer service (Shelly in customer service) had me try a few things, still did not help, So she replaced them under warranty. The pair I have now work GREAT and the customer service was AWESOME. Thank you Shelly!

review_title: I really think these can take one the big names
review_text: These are now my go to headphones when I want to use them for extended use. The comfort of the earcups are outstanding. There is no pushback coming from the earcups that I find from my other headphone. For the amount these Q20 cost the performance is on par with Beats Sony or JBL all of which I have used. Some of them have triple the msrp costs. Everything seems like its 1st class so far, the sound signature is slight bass heavy but not overwhelming like Skullcandy or Beats by any means. I have no qualms about hearing reference music on this. I bought one and than got another as I find the comfort and sound that good.

review_title: Great price for what it offers
review_text: These seem to work great with my desktop PC, for some reason though with my Surface pro 2015 it repeatedly drops out and reconnects. The most annoying thing ever I'm not sure if it is related to it and the Bluetooth on the surface or what so I will not review it too harshly. For the price it is still a stellar purchase for what it is.

review_title: Great product but a little bulky
review_text: I like the headphones good quality sound but a little bulky on my head otherwise great product.

First and foremost, this has got to be one of the best values for Noise Cancelling headphones. You put these bad boys on and your surroundings just fade away. Now, I wouldn’t go as far to say they’re perfect but you get more than what you pay. Sound quality is pretty decent, which means it’s high in bass to mask the deficiencies elsewhere. It’s nothing too bad if you love bass, but if you’re an audiophile you’re not looking at this product most likely. I enjoy listening to my songs on these more than my AirPods and almost as much as my older Bose Quiet Comforts, so when you consider the price these are pretty amazing. Only con to the whole Q20 experience is the quality of life features. These things are a bit bulky and big, and they take a relatively long time to turn on and connect and to turn off. The buttons are big and easy to use, but that’s about the only convenience of the headset. They’re also very comfortable (weight aside) and easy to wear for a few hours without your head getting uncomfortable. The sound isolation is also near ideal for a close-back headphone as well. All-in-all, I love these cheap guys and I will probably use them the most out of all my other headphones. EDIT: Buttons stopped working after 6 months of use.

review_title: Awesome headphones, especially for the price! Gimmicky features.
review_text: Pros: I'm no audiophile, but the sound comes through crisp and clear—much better, in fact, than my wife's Skullcandy headphones that cost her nearly twice as much. They're foldable, adjustable, fit well, and are super comfortable, even for long periods of wearing. The bluetooth has an amazing range. I can leave my phone charging, go anywhere in my house or even a bit out into the yard, and these headphones stay connected. The option to use the included audio cable is great too. I tend to use the cable for my PC and bluetooth for my phone. Cons: The noise cancellation and BassUp features are kinda gimmicky. That's okay by me, as I didn't buy these for those features. But if they're why you want to buy them, you might reconsider. Noise cancellation works, but only a little. It really just kind of dims the external sound a bit, but it's very far from silent—and that's including the steady droning kind of sounds that noise cancellation is really intended to overcome. Don't get me wrong, the noise level is better with cancellation on than off, and since you have it, you might as well use it. But if you really need noise cancellation, you should probably get some pricier headphones more specifically designed for that. As for the bass boost, honestly, I can't hear any difference at all. Maybe it's just me. My wife tried it and said she thought the bass boost was amazing, so who knows. But it didn't do anything for me. Summary: Honestly, I'd just ignore the fact that this features BassUp and noise cancellation, because without them, this would still be an amazing pair of headphones for an amazing price! Buy them for that reason. If you need good noise cancellation or really heavy bass, probably look elsewhere.

I've been a big Anker product fan for quite some time and when I saw they were making wireless noise canceling over ear headphones I was pretty stoked. I ordered a pair for my wife to replace the Cowin E7 Pros that were falling apart. Upon receipt we were so impressed with them I immediately ordered another pair myself. We've owned them for about 2.5 months now and I am just as impressed. A co-worker has a pair of Beats we compared them to and as far as size, comfort, style, and quality they are absolutely on par. I would re-purchase these in a heartbeat and look forward to improvements in future models!

Great sound, very long battery life, good range too. Noise cancelling is acceptable, but it does have a hissing or sea breeze or wind tone to it. Uses AAC codec which can be used with my phone, tablet and even Linux with pulseaudio-modules-bt. I'm overall happy, but still find the windy sound with noise cancel a bit strange.

I bought these headphones a wile ago, they have great sound and good bass and the noise isolation is an interesting feature that works pretty good. It also comes with a aux cable that let's someone use them as wired headphones for when the battery runs out. And speaking about the battery, it last for a VERY long time, it last the 40hr of playtime advertised on the product. The original ones that I bought were, unfortunately, a little defective but the company very quickly responded and sent me a new pair. They work great, I haven't had any issues with them. Highly recommend the company, I've bought multiple product from them and have never been disappointed.

I am blown away of how amazing these headphones are! As my first noise cancellation headphones, it’s incredible! I couldn’t hear my car running or the freezers and refrigerators running at the grocery store. I tried it on the plane and I’m blown away how good the noise cancellation is. I could barely hear the engine roaring in the background during take off, in the air and landing. I was able to enjoy my movie and music more. The sound quality is great! It has better bass than my skullcandy Hesh 2. Once I turn on the bassup on, the bass blew me away! The best I’ve ever heard. It does make a difference when the noise cancellation is off or on. It is so comfortable too! One thing I noticed it doesn’t have a mic on the auxiliary cord, which I use for my Xbox. But no big deal, I can get a third party aux cord with a mic specifically for my Xbox. Other then that, I love the headphones. I hope it’ll last as long as my skullcandy Hesh 2, which still works perfectly after 2 years. Worth the upgrade! As for gym use, it’s not bad. Just expect a bit of sweat on the headphones, depends on how much you sweat. Other than that, I highly recommend this! No regrets!

review_title: Great pair of very comfortable, audiofile grade headphones at an affordable price
review_text: I absolutely love this pair of headphones. Having had a pair of bose qc3 headphones several years ago, these rank on par with, and in my own personal opinion are better than, those headphones. I've read a few reviews that say the noise canceling are average, if that, but I personally and politely disagree. You don't really need the noise canceling on to shut out the world almost completely, when you put them on, even when turned off, the world is sht out, instantly. Some sounds, particularly loud, low frequency sounds, like air conditioners or washers or dryers can get through, but most other sounds don't. Turn on the noise canceling and even those sounds fade. The sound quality is fanfastic as well, deep rumbling base, clear mids and clear, resonant highs. I am not an audiofile, that is, I don't have a studio job or wear thousand dollar studio grade headphones but in my own personal opinion these sound just as good as those, although I have never worn such headphones. The bass up is the only part I'm not 100 percent happy with these headphones. The bass does increase when the bass up function is turned on, but the rest of the audio tends to fade a bit and become a little indistinct, suggesting that they might want to improve that algorithm a bit, but other than that these headphones are flawless. The build construction is stirdy and well thought out, although for 60 dollar headphones I was hoping for some metal construction, in the main user parts, the earcups and hinges, instead of plastic, but the memory foam earcups and headband enfold and cratle your head the minute you put them on. The battery life is also outstanding, lasting nearly three full days with nearly three full days of solid listening, I had to slep for nearly 16 hours after staying up that long but I did stay up that long to test. I would have liked a better quality case, in other words a nice leather hard shell case instead of the pleather bag they come with, but that's a minor quibble. If you're looking for a fantastic pair of headphones with equally fantastic noise canceling circuits, these can't be beat.
Great for the airplane!

review_title: Anker came thru on long flight!!!!
review_text: Bought these for an 8 hr round trip to Hawaii and well worth the trip.......didnt want to spend the money on Bose for a single trip so with all the great Anker products i have and use, figured i'd give these a try. Noise-canceling worked great. Also used to watch movies....didn't have to charge for the whole flight.....The only small complaint is that i think the sound could be a little louder or go louder, whichever way to say it......Otherwise, awesome product and will continue to buy Anker products.

review_title: Perfect NC headphones for a great price.
review_text: These are my first over-ear noise cancelling headphones, and like pretty much all of Anker's products, I love them. The noise cancellation is great, and the sound quality it great. I love the "bass boost" option, but I do wish it would remember the setting when turned off and on, same with the noise cancelling setting, you have to set both to on each use. Other than that, I have no complains at all. They are comfortable, sound good, and last forever.

I wanted a bluetooth-enabled set of noise cancelling headphones that I could use with my phone or laptop while at the office or on a plane. These have worked wonderfully to help me concentrate and block out external noises. Do they cancel noise as well as my wired, $250 pair that I own? No, but since these arrived for less than $50 and are 95%+ as good, I have no complaints!

review_title: Best bang for buck BT headset
review_text: Superb battery life and sq for the price.

review_title: Anker....It’s all you need to know!
review_text: Was given to my father as a gift to watch TV with. He lives the noise canceling feature and the long long battery life. Another fine product by Anker!
Item not working properly they have something inside sound not clear...
They drown out most sounds. But not the one sound that I needed drawn out. And that's my wife snoring.
A very comfortable and effective pair for the price.

I bought these headphones because I like the brand, but the headphones that amazon sent were defective. Luckily for me the soundcore support team is on point with their customer service so the sent a replacement right away. 10/10 would buy again
I like this Headphones.

If there is a loud noise nearby and noise canceling is enabled, the headphones get staticky. Other than that, there no problems so far with the headphones. They sound good and pair to my phone in under 2 seconds.
