review_title: Work well and good value for the price
review_text: Good quality and realistic price
I love this headset. What more can I say?
Great noise cancelling headphones!

the sound quality is great. however do not buy these headphones for the noise isolation. as mentioned in other comments, there is a LOUD poping sound during jerky movements which i terribly unpleasant. Due to that, during bus rides\using stairs etc.. I turn off the noise cancellation thus making these terrible $ for value headphones (due to active noise cancellation being unusable when needed most). I hope Anker might be able to fix this with a software update, other products by the brand are great which is what lead me to buy these headphones.
I really like the sound quality, I end up turning off the noise cancellation bc I don’t like the sound as much with it on

I used them on a flight to and from Paris. I’ve never had noise cancelling earphones so I have no basis for comparison but these did an excellent job and were comfortable on my ears. I took off a star because apparently I have a small head and I couldn’t make the earphones small enough to fit as they should.
Noise cancellation is amazingly good; can't wait to try them on my next plane trip. Sound quality is excellent and battery life is fine. Overall, I am very happy with this purchase.

review_title: Don’t hesitate to get for plane travel
review_text: I am happy to give these headphones 5 stars on price alone. The value you get out of these headphones is great. They could be louder, they could have slightly better noise cancellation, but in the end the price compared to a leading brand (Bose) makes them a no brainer.

review_title: Good cans minus some quality issues that were quickly resolved
review_text: A bit too heavy on the bass but overall very good sound quality. Had an issue with my first pair having a failed speaker after a week but Anker replaced them very expeditiously. Overall, I am very happy with them!
bueno

The headphones are very comfortable, if you have big ears i think you have to search for a bigger choice. Earpads are comfortable and squishy for long time use. In terms of sound quality, it is really good when ANC is on, i wish the bass is a bit better and the sound is a bit louder. ANC is perfect, you won't hear anything around you when music is on. Connectivity is easy and fast, you might face some problem, all you have is restart it and connect the headphones again.

It is a comfortable pair of headphones. But there is no easy way to change ear pads easily. Headphone pads are glued directly to the frame. I also found the noise cancellation was not that good. I also own a pair of Sony MDR-100ABN. They are bulky headphones, but their noise cancellation is excellent. The sound quilty is unique, picks up the highs and lows. My only issue is that there is no bass at all. Oh, and after two hours, the headphones started burning my ears. For me, they are excellent for casual use.

The audio quality of these headphones is good to excellent. The durability is terrible. One month after purchasing them and using them entirely in the home, one day the left headphone just stopped working completely. 5 weeks of use. Strongly recommend against buying this item.

review_title: They are great - can't do better for the price!
review_text: They are great - can't do better for the price! Only complaint is that the ear cups to make your ears/face sweat. I read about this in the other reviews and it's accurate.
I love this!
A very good sound quality, very confy and pretty light, if you want to disconnect from the city noise or airplane noise, these are good choice

review_title: Much more than you can expect for this price
review_text: Extreme quality, much more than you can expect for this price. Even better than very expensive headphones.

review_title: Great noise cancelling and good quality sound.
review_text: I bought these to wear on a few plane trips. I did not use the bluetooth function but when I can say when they are hard wired the sound is really good for the price, they sound almost as good as my Sennheiser headphones that cost twice as much as these. And the noise cancelling works perfectly, when I turned that on I could not hear any of the plane noise around me.
They are heavy and cause neck pain when reading. Probably only use if standing straight up or lying down.
Very pleased with this purchase and the value for money. Thank you!0

review_title: If the noise cancelling feature is important, do not buy these headphones.
review_text: The sound quality of these headphones is pretty good for the money, the battery life is really great, but the noise cancelling is really, really bad. I bought these headphones to use them mainly while traveling with the bus or as a passenger in a carpool. While in motion, with ANC turned on, these headphones are producing some popping sounds at every road bump or any kind of shake. Same thing when walking. This is not happening when the ANC is turned off. I tested two identical headphones because first I asked for a replacement thinking that maybe only the item that I got was defective. Then, while filtering 1* and 2* reviews only, I found out that some other people had the same issue. Somehow, the large number of 5* and 4* reviews, tricked me... Lesson learned. Another bad thing is the customer support from this vendor, for what I would give 0 stars if I could. I wrote them a message and explained all these things and they replied this: " From your description, it appears the issue is with the design or how the headphones work. Regarding the noise, it sounds like the wind/outside noise is hitting the external microphones and overpowering them causing them to make a popping noise through the ear speakers. So I'm afraid a replacement wouldn't solve the issue. In this case, we will be glad to help you with a refund if you returned them back to us. We will send you a prepaid shipping label for the returning. " In the cars and the buses that I ride is NO WIND at all. About the noise from the road, yes, there is noise of course, but that's what the ANC feature of these headphones is supposed to cancel, isn't it!?! ... and, more important, this noise is the main reason why I bought them. Of course, I will return them for a refund.

I like these headphones, I really do, the sound quality on them is quite nice, the battery life is beautiful, and the noise cancelling actually works. The only issue I have is that they have to but shut down manually, as in if I fall asleep with them on or forget to turn them off at some point they'll just stay on wasting battery power. I guess you can blame it on human error for just not turning them off, but considering i got a $20 pair of wireless earbuds that automatically shut down, there's no excuse why these shouldn't have it for more than double the price.
Did not find anything wrong

review_title: Ok, I'm a believer. These work pretty darn well.
review_text: Note: Not a paid review, just a satisfied customer. I refuse to spend $350+ on a pair of wireless noise cancelling headphones that I don't plan on using every day of my life for the next 5 years. I'd seen the Anker's online many times when doing research for a recent international trip. I wanted to get a newer pair of over-the-ear noise cancelling headphones to update my 20 yr-old on-ear Aiwas (that still work!). I saw a $10 coupon and jumped. I was skeptical though, would a $50-$60 pair be able to do the job at least half as well as a $350 pair of headphones? Well that paid off because these headphones do the job and they do it well, at least on an airplane. I haven't tried wearing them out on the street to see how well they filter traffic and ambient noise. But on an airplane, 5 stars. Battery life seems to be as advertised. They stayed on for over 24 hours of round trip flight time as well as a couple of additional hours in a hotel room with plenty of juice to spare. Didn't need to be recharged at all. The automated battery life indicator says, "medium" when I turn them on after the trip. Color me impressed. Very happy with this purchase and would recommend to anyone looking for a good set of wireless noise cancelling headphones for any plane ride. I will say, I'm not an audiophile so I can't speak to the sound quality, but everything sounded good to me while watching movies and TV and listening to a little bit of music. If you're a major audiophile though, I guess you wouldn't be looking at these headphones to begin with, right?

Over ear headphones are hit or miss with comfort for me, mostly because I've got piercings in my upper ears and many headphones don't consider this when making their headphones. So far (after an hour of wearing them both on both ears and only on one) they're very comfortable over my piercings. They also act as good ear warmers for blustery Ohio winters. Sound is good, ANC is nice; overall a good quality for the price.

review_title: Awesome headphones, but active noise cancellation SUCKS
review_text: Edit: previous review below is for the Q20s. I did not like them. However, after rating them at 3/5 stars, AnkerDirect contacted me about sending me a free replacement. I was pretty surprised they actually cared! I asked them to send me a Q10 instead. I love it! I would suggest going with the Q10 if you don't like noise cancellation or if you're unsure you'll use it a lot. I love these headphones - the sound is awesome, the battery lasts a while, they're comfortable to wear, easy to connect to Bluetooth but they have one critical flaw: the active noise cancellation just flat out sucks. If you're walking around with it on, and you step off a curb you get a terrible high pitch noise. You can turn this off, but the headphones ALWAYS default to having noise cancellation on... so you always have to shut it off if you don't like it. One other annoying thing - the buttons to turn the headphones on often get hit when you fold them up, so you have to carefully fold them up and hope they don't accidentally turn themselves on. This isn't a big deal with how long the battery lasts, but it just seems like another oversight on Anker/Soundcore. How hard is it to place the buttons somewhere where they don't get activated when you use one of the best features of these headphones (compact size if folded for carrying when not in use). I would recommend looking at Soundcore Q10 instead. It's slightly cheaper, and doesn't have noise cancellation so you avoid the annoyance of it always activating. I almost want to return these and get the Q10s instead, but I already opened the box and used them for a week or two. Next time I'll avoid noise cancellation.
Use in open office. NC helps a lot when next desk is talking. Medium usage and battery last 4 days. Sound quality is good except base sometime too much, so I hope a button to reduce the base.
Noise cancellation is not good.

I purchased one but I couldn't tell the difference even when the NC is off, so I had returned it. I had been an Anker customer for a long time and have several of their products and regularly recommend their battery banks, cables, dash cams, flashlights etc. But this headphone was defective out of the box. After I returned it, Anker contacted me to give them another chance and sent a product replacement for me to try ( it's a loan). I have not received it yet but the fact that they followed up on it was amazing. I think every company in the USA should be held to these standards, and I will keep using their products knowing that their satisfaction guarantee is not just a line, but it is in fact their philosophy. Thank you, ANKER!
Breaks super easy at the hint point.

Love it. !

Only used for a week but am thoroughly impressed. I'm able to connect to my computer and my phone simultaneously. I can be watching a show and answer a call without having to sync with different devices individually.

review_title: Great battery life and good noise cancelling
review_text: I got this based off the Wirecutter's review - I used it on a couple long flights, was very impressed by the battery life and it was good noise cancelling and easy to use. I absolutely recommend, especially for the reasonable price point!

You have to use the volume controls of the headphones. The headphones' volume control overrides the connected device's volume control. I do not like the volume control override. I want to use the volume control of the connected device. I only use the headphones at home/work.

review_title: Good noise cancellation for the price.

Buen sonido, cancelación decente por el precio que estás pagando, súper recomendable, llego todo perfecto.

review_title: I was expecting a better ANC
review_text: ANC is not good enough in moderate noisy environments.

review_title: An inexpensive yet excellent wireless headfset
review_text: I have owned Bose and other quality brands that cost hundreds of dollars. The Soundcore Bluetooth headphones are almost a good for hundreds less. I highly recommend them.

review_title: Great sound for $, with a few downsides
review_text: Excellent sound with good bass, great battery life and bluetooth range. Solid build. Hard to beat for the money. Not sure how well noise cancellation works and they are a bit on the heavy side. Cushions are nice and soft but tend to get warm after some use.
Very nice for the price. I will definitely buy again when it dies (only if they last at least a year).
THESE ARE SOME OF THE BEST HEADPHONE OUT THERE FOR THE MONEY
My office is very loud so I use these to drown out people around me. They are very comfortable and when they are playing podcasts or songs work really well .

I loved them for a little bit but ended up having to return them. The headphones were comfortable enough to wear for long periods of time, but I just wish the opening you put your ears in was just a slight bit wider. I do have bigger ears then most so it's probably a "just me" thing. Build quality is actually pretty decent, now you're not gonna mistake these for higher end headphones but they are certainly nice headphones. Sound quality is "fine" in that Soundcore went with a more neutral sound, so if you like bass these won't be for you. Speaking of bass the "bass up" feature kinda just made everything sound muddy and wasent really worth it. As for the noise cancellation, well it's good in it of itself meaning that it does block out a lot of noise but it does have a lot of cabin pressure so I didn't feel nice to my ears. And trying to play music WHILE the noise cancellation was on was a mixed bag. For some odd reason I needed the headphones to have a "perfect" seal around my ear and if I didn't have this seal when ever the bass on any song kicked in there's was a feed back. Honestly this is why I had to return them, because if I say TILTED MY HEAD DOWN this would affect the seal on my ears and cause this reverb sound, it also didn't help that I have glasses. Such a shame because I had a pair of their "Vortex" headphones and tried their "Space NC" headphones and thought they were awesome but these only sounded "meh" to me and that constant issue with the reverb made these a no go for me. Update: Anker reached out to me concerned over the review and offered to give me a free pair of earbuds, so while my review of the headphones remain a 3/5 I'm giving it an extra star for their excellent customer service

review_title: You get a lot for your money!
review_text: These have way more value than the cost to own them. When you use them wired they are hi res capable, and they sound good for this at this price point. The area where they really shine is with the wireless noise canceling. It is AAC capable so the quality via wireless sounds great and while I was traveling the plane sound was just gone. The music came thru crystal clear and I must say I am impressed. These sound like $100.00 + headphones to me.
These are really good headphones. The sound quality is great and noise cancelling is good for the price. I'm completely happy with this purchase!

Best bang for your buck$ - These headphones provide great sound and deep base. The battery life is crazy, still haven't charged my headphones out of the box. Perfect for the office environment with the true NC feature. Also, they work with BT calls.

I finally found it! I'm glad that in the world where everyone has several phone/tables/laptops some headset manufacturers finally got some brains to realize how important Multi-point feature is. Finally I can listen music on my laptop and at the same time pick up calls from my phone when they come without changing headset. Even though it's not more than 2 devices at a time. Sound quality is good. ANC is ok. The only bummer that keeps is way from becoming the best bluetooth headset is micro USB instead of USB-C.

review_text: Initially, I was completely dissatisfied, but respectable customer service made up for me, but I'm happy now and I hope to buy again one day. Greetings

review_title: Shockingly good for the price Anker soundcore life Q20
review_text: I'm a big Sony Believer when it comes to both the noise cancelling headsets and their regular non cancelling headphones. I found that I was wearing my headphones for chores more than anything - and my pair took a beating- and I broke them finally 3 weeks ago. I just bought this pair-and man for the price- they are great - and I'll feel a whole lot less guilty about getting paint and other chores residue on them and if I break em- no big deal. Most surprisingly is how comfortable they are. I was prepared for them to be just okay for $40-

Update: After trying to deal with various eqs all morning, these are going back. They compress the bass in the music to point you hear "pumping" when the ANC is on. Despite what the reviews say, they sound OK (read flat) with the ANC off. Extremely annoying to listen toIf you like the extremely exaggerated bass of beats, you'll be fine with these headphones. If you want accuracy, these are not for you. Now, they sound great except the extremely loud bass for how cheap they are. I dropped the 60hz range by 7db and the 100hz range by 4 dB and they sound OK. I'm glad Jetaudio has an eq, otherwise the heavy bass would get annoying. Oh and there's also a mode for EVEN MORE BASS. Seriously? Who needs that?

review_title: A1/8" audio in, Bluetooth and USB Audio makes them unusually versatile.
review_text: 1/7 the price of premium brands. Bass Boost is unnecessary. Surprisingly well made. Cables and case are included. Sound quality is average and tends toward the bassy. You can get better, but at many multiples of the Q20 price.

These are great headphones. They are over the ear which I prefer over on ear and ear buds. The Noise Cancellation is good. I can lay in bed listening to a podcast while my husband watches a tv show right next to me. My first pair was defective and would not charge. All it took was one call to Anker and they immediately sent out a replacement! It happens and it was handled expertly and courteously.
I own two Bose NC headphones (QC15 & QC25) and these are excellent. The active noise cancelling is amazing for the price. I would definitely recommend them over the Bose for flights for the price.

review_title: Good quality and price, airplane approved
review_text: Great battery life, very comfortable and used on an airplane! I have sensitive hearing so I was very surprised when the noise cancelling worked so well on my flights . This was an upgrade from a wired sony noise cancelling headset I had bought. Definitely worth the purchase!

I am very happy with these headphones. I have read good reviews and bad reviews but I have had good results with Anker products. They do exactly what I need. I am very happy with these headphones. They block out the noise I do not want to hear.

I'm no audiophile, but these headphones are AMAZING. A couple years ago my in-laws gifted me a pair of BOSE QC headphones and these Anker Soundcore headphones are every bit as good at a 4th of the cost. And the battery life is far greater than the BOSE headphones boast. SOLID!
Was very happy with the purchase intially until I experienced some glitch sounds in Skype calls and phone calls.It automatically disconnects from calls.Returning back this product.
The active noise cancelation is great. The price is phenomenal and I would recommend them to anyone and everybody.

These sound remarkably good for the money. I've tried a few others in the same price range from Mpow and other Anker models, but these have the best sound for an under $100 Bluetooth on-ear headset. At the $40 price I paid, they are a steal. ANC is on by default when you power these on, but it is simple to turn off. I prefer the sound with ANC off. The sound change is subtle with ANC, but there is something just a little off or unnatural to most ANC systems, and this is no different. I wear these when working on my PC and I look forward to trying the ANC when I mow the lawn. However, if you are in a quieter environment, leave ANC off for slightly better sound and longer battery life.
Great headphones for my son who uses them all the time. Great battery life.

review_title: Good sound, build, and noise suppression at a great price
review_text: Bargain at this price point. Well-built, decent sound. Excellent for making phone calls, too - the microphone works better than most bluetooth sound devices. Just wore these on a long flight, US West coast to Paris, sat by the big 777’s engines. The rumble was effectively cancelled- I could listen to classical music & podcasts at good fidelity. Recommended.
The ear pieces are a tad small

For the price, these headphones are a great value in terms of noise cancelation and sound quality. Where they fall down is that the adjustable band is made for very large heads. I wear an adult small bicycle and ski helmet. Unless you have a much larger head, the band on this headphone will be too large to rest on your head even when adjusted down to the smallest size.

review_title: Decent quality noise cancelling headphones at a low price
review_text: This is an excellent entry level noise cancelling headphone set. The sound quality is pretty good, better than most people are likely used to if they use ear/airpods or other low quality earbuds or headsets, but not audiophile quality. Music and podcasts generally sound rich and full, if a bit bass heavy and with slightly muddy low end. If you've never used a high quality pair of headphones, you will probably be quite happy with this level of sound quality. They are noticeably closed in in terms of soundstage, though you still get directional differences clearly coming through. The build quality is fine, nothing to write home about. The plastic hinges are slightly creaky and don't feel extremely solid, but neither does it feel like the headphones will break unexpectedly or snap in my hands. If treated well I would not be surprised if they lasted several years or more. The band and earcups are comfortably padded. I find the earcups to be a bit small, but my ears are somewhat large. This can cause pain and soreness in my ears with extended wear (more than 2 hours without much break). However, this pair is better than others I've tried, and the problem is not unique to these. The earcups can get a bit hot and insulative, especially in higher ambient temperatures, but taking breaks once in a while mitigates this almost completely. As others have noted, these headphones create a sharp "crack" or "pop" in certain circumstances. I have noticed that they can produce this crack with every step on a hard surface if I walk with a very heavy step, but that they do not do this if I walk with a moderate or light step. They also seem not to do it on carpeted or otherwise soft surfaces. The effect can be replicated by closing a car door while wearing the headphones, so it seems to have something to do with rapid air movement around the noise cancelling microphones. Bottom line on the crack/pop issue: These are not going to work for running or people who walk on hard surfaces regularly with a heavy step (do you "stab the floor" with your feet? don't buy these). If you don't do that, it should be fine. If your use case is mostly sitting at a desk or couch or table and listening to music or podcasts or TV, these will work very well. The noise cancelling is not top of the line by any means, but it is effective in significantly reducing lower to medium frequency constant noise. Wearing these inside a Chipotle restaurant made the auditory experience significantly more pleasant. Further, these headphones cover the sound of high speed laptop fans very effectively. Listening to music while driving a car with these eliminates over 90% of perceived external noise for me, including your own engine and tire noise. These are not Bose QuietComforts, but they get the job done decently. In conclusion: these are excellent headphones for a $60 price point (the price I paid) and the current $40 deal makes them an absolute steal. If you want to try out noise cancelling headphones, or want a cheap but decent pair for travel or some other purpose where you don't want to risk high price headphones, these are a great choice. If you have particularly large ears, I would find another option with larger earcups. If you want to run or you're the kind of person to stab the floor with your feet, find another option.

I tried a pair, because at $40 they looked like a pretty good deal. I also wanted to try them in my garage wood shop. I'm always running a loud dust collector and woodworking machinery. They've been fantastic. I also have a pair of ISOtunes Pro ear buds and a pair of 3M Worktunes Wireless headphones. These sound better than either, and they seem to perform equally as good as either in reducing shop noise. And, they are wayyyy cheaper. Besides, my wife listened to my pair, and I had to immediately order her a pair. Good job Anker.

review_title: These are an incredible headphones for it's price!
review_text: I bought these headphones to help me stay focused when studying for long 8+ hour study sessions. Right off the bat I thought that they were really really comfortable headphones. They do warm up after an hour or so, but take them off and put them back on and they are good to go. The headphones are really nice and light weight. I really like how it tells you the battery level when you turn it on. The noise canceling is not the greatest thing in the world, but it's pretty good. I use it in a house with 3 kids and it does a pretty good job of drowning out some of their noises. The battery life seems really good so far. I find myself never having to think if I charged the headphones or not because they don't require a charge every single day. My old pair of study headphones needed a charge everyday that I wore them. I can wear these for a couple days and they are fine.

First, as comfortable the headphones may seem, my head must be shaped weird or small, as they seemed a tad too large putting pressure on the top of my ears. Second, while the sound was decent, bass was too boomy for my liking and we're not well balanced. They favored the lows more than the highs. Just not for me. Finally, noise cancelling wasn't the best, but did the job around the home and office. The sound quality however was affected slightly for the worse when enabled. Battery life was excellent, especially with noice cancelling off, and for the price, these seemed like a great deal. Again, as a big Anker fan and owner of many of their products, I truly had high hopes for these. Unfortunately, I ended up returning them due to the several issues I encountered.

review_title: Problem fixed by excellent customer support
review_text: I bought these headphones in October, used them for approximately four hours, and stored them safely. Two months later, I took them out and tried to use them--the left speaker failed. No sound. I contacted Amazon support via online chat and quickly received excellent support from Jonathan. After a few tests confirming that the problem could not be fixed by me, Jonathan called my phone and connected us both to Anker support. There I was assisted by Stephen (Soundcore Customer Support), who quickly arranged a replacement. I received a prepaid USPS priority shipping label, and as soon as I had proof of mailing, the replacement headphones were despatched from Anker. They arrived in 4 days. So the problem had a very easy solution, and I received excellent service from both Amazon and Anker.

On 12.31.19 After testing it for 2 weeks I found some cons but very minimal and everything good. The good The sound quality gets better the more you use it the better it gets so they require certain amount of burn ins. As far as noise cancelling it is doing what it suppose to I mean I paid like $40 for the amount of perks I got on these the high resolution audio codec is enough for me to like these headphones lot. The bad It's a small price to pay but it only happens when ANC is turned on so while I have the headphones on my head and I tried to close the door on the car I hear a static noise o don't know if it's a hardware issue or software it's just happens for that second but you definitely hear it and also when your adjusting the headband for headphones than you will hear it too again it doesn't bother me maybe it will bother some people. Also I really haven't tested the headphones while walking or in the wind haven't had that situation yet so once I test them while it's windy and or when j walk I'll write it down. Again for $40 this doesn't bother me I'll use this while sitting down if I have to I'll use my bose for walking and windy situation, but I really like the headphones. Updated!!!!!! !1.13.2020 I spoke to anker about the popping noise when I adjust the headband it only happens when ANC is active and you also hear the noise when you close the car door and also happens if their is a bump on the road so anyway I emailed anker and they stated that the updated version doesn't make that noise and that we as anker will send new headphones and return the defective one back so that's what I did and if anyone has the same problem just contact anker and they will send a prepaid postage and once they know the headphones is reroute they will send tracking number for a new headphones and yes I received it today and yes the popping noise is their no more yesss!!! Anker goes above and beyond to take care of their customers and now they have a long life customer and will continue to buy anker products and of their is any issues with it just a email will resolve the problem that your having. Thank you anker.
Great sound and noice canceling but the battery life and no case was disappointing. I returned them after a week.

review_title: Not 'perfect' noise cancellation, but close enough
review_text: After reading a number of negative reviews, I wasn't sure if I was making the right decision. A decent noise cancelling product well under $100?? I used the headphones at my local rollerskating rink on a Sunday afternoon. The objective was to be able to comfortably listen to my own music on the floor. A far challenging scenario than the simple drone of an aeroplane engine. Boy was I surprised. The headphones were able to reduce the rink's music down to a whisper.... and reduce the ambient sounds of a very busy crowd! I was able to quietly immerse myself in my own music on the floor, and I'd call that a success! I didn't need to turn the volume all the way up either. I do not mind that the noise reduction is not 100%. Personally I like the ability to hear the outside world faintly. The sound quality does feel a little heavy on the bass, but the midrange and high end is decent enough. If I was picky, I can correct that with an equalizer. The headphone's over the ear padding is very comfortable, and admittedly adds a lot to the noise reduction. They do heat you up after about an hour strenuous activity, but remember, you're sealing off your ears. To be expected. I did hear occasional clicking when the headphones were jostled putting them on, but not while rollerskating or normal user. I don't recommend them for running or sweaty activities. I'd call this one a winner.
I love the price, the sound, and the long battery life. Plus, even though the noise canceling wasn’t a 10, it still helped and was effective while traveling at 35K feet in an airplane.
Good quality with affordable price.

review_title: Best in the business at a fraction of the price
review_text: Great product. Super comfortable. Insane battery life. Amazing noise cancelation. No need to get higher priced bigger brand headphones any more.

I was expecting more than what I got. They make aloud CRACK-SKIRRT noise sometimes and it extremely hurt my ear, I even got a headache from the loud noise. Noise cancellation was not that great, sound was ok (6/10). I’m sorry but they were not as well as the description depicts.

I'm no audiophile, but volume is adequate, with no trace of clipping. !! Connects BOTH with Bluetooth and direct audio cable. It also folds in two dimensions to a compact shape.

review_title: Bluetooth lag & buzzing sound when plugged in w/ ANC
review_text: Serious issues, but the best I’ve tried at this price point. Pros: - sound quality is nice, even better when ANC is on I think. - ANC works pretty well. Need music to completely drown out noises. - build quality is pretty decent, wish they could tighten more though. They hang and it’s not comfortable as much. - good battery life - people can’t hear your music. - fits me nicely. Cons: - Bluetooth lag. - ANC issues when in wired mode (buzzing). - the speakers bang the headset and make an unpleasant sound in a FEW songs. Base-Up not useable for some songs. (Ok with most tho) it happens worse if you tilt your head. Bluetooth has Very noticeable lag. Completely unusable for gaming and makes watching movies really annoying. Static buzzing sound when plugged in and ANC turned on, turn off ANC, it’s gone.

review_title: Best headphone at this price tag
review_text: This is a great pair of headphones. Noise cancelling is pretty good --- no complaints so far --- and the sound quality is great. I've tested other similar headphones in the past and this is for sure the best. It gets a little warm after many hours of use though, but nothing that bothers me. Strongly recommended if you want a budget pair of noise-cancelling headphones for travelling or commuting.

review_title: Great for the price! But don't expect $200 headphone quality
review_text: I recently got these for $40 and I'm amazed. First off I'll say that the build quality on these feel cheap yet durable. They don't feel premium but won't break easily on you either. However they're very comfortable, they feel great on my ears/head with no pain tension from wearing too long. The noise cancellation is decent, for the price don't expect too much. The sound quality is a little too bassy and overall decent, not amazing, but again for the price they're good. Battery life is also great at 40 hours. So bottom line these are $40-60 headphones, so keep your expectations grounded and you'll be amazed at what you get for the price.

In line with plenty of other reviews, for the amount you pay, these are exceptional. Regardless of price, these are the very light and comfortable (soft-lined pillowy pads, with a good seal), and the battery life is second to none. Sound quality is good, but great when factoring in price. Nothing muddled but compared to a high-end set of cans you'll pick up on differences. Not enough, in my opinion, to justify the prices of those when I have these. Call quality, based on what my wife has said from her side of the line, isn't too great. She said I sounded far away. But that wasn't even a consideration for myself when buying.

review_title: Comfort is key, even when sweaty! Tough to hear voices with them on (unlike Bose).
review_text: Pros: - I love how light and comfortable they are, i could exercise, or even sleep with them on. - Sound quality is great, with a nice deep bass. - Bluetooth connectivity is flawless. -n it works ll talking on the phone when connected via Bluetooth. Cons: - Even with nothing playing, I find I need to take at least one ear off to conduct a conversation with someone nearby, which a friend with the $350 Bose noise-cancelling headphones tells me is not an issu/en for him. i have-not done a comparison myself, though.

good quality for price but does not compare to my old denon

review_title: Great battery life. Good noise cancelling.
review_text: These do a great job for the price. They mostly block low rumbling type noise, and they don't really touch the higher "white" noise. If you spend a lot of time riding as a passenger in cars, they do an amazing job blocking road noise. I haven't yet had a chance to use them on a plane, but I imagine they'll do a fine job cancelling most of the sound. The only thing to look out for is if they make a loud popping/crackling sound when you tap the top of the headband or get jostled. This only happens with the ANC on. One pair I got did this at first, but it stopped after a day. I ordered a replacement fearing that it would come back, but it didn't. Unfortunately, the replacement pair is much worse than my first pair. So it seems that the quality control is a bit lacking. I'll be returning the replacement and keeping the original pair.

Sure it's not a Bose, and it's not a Sony, but the noise cancellation performance of this headphone was good enough to block out the surrounding sound during my flight to Asia, and I was able to comfortably sleep through while wearing it.

review_title: Great headphones—if the bluetooth connection works for you
review_text: These headphones sound awesome, fit well, and have a great control scheme. (I've tried several others in the price range.) The problem is, on my setup the bluetooth is very unreliable: skips or glitches several times per song. The other headphones I've tried—all of which had significant other flaws—did not have this problem on the same setup. I actually ordered a second pair in hopes that the first was a defective unit, but they had the same problem.
I love them
Made for jumbo heads. It’s adjustable but does not Rest on my head. Had to tape foam to the top to take the pressure off my ears. Otherwise great device for the money. I have a small but adult sized.

review_title: Ok for the price, nice sound, weak ANC, too much bass
review_text: The sound quality is nice, it would be better if less bass, still too much bass even the bass boosting is off. The ANC is work to lower some noise. But it cannot filter all the noise. eg. The noise from dehumidifier, bus engine and people chatting nearby. The battery life is surprisingly good which can last for a week or longer (around 3hrs usage per day). By the way, I could hear some noise from the joints when I turning the head, it is very annoying. The overall performance is ok. To be honest don’t expect too much in this price point. Weak ANC isn’t a big deal when you listening music. But you could notice the noise surrounding when you are watching videos. So far it is acceptable.

I think these are great for casual listening but if you like to listen to music while working out, these are not the ones. The headband is not tight enough to stay on your head while doing any dynamic sporting activity.
As a former Bose employee and loyalist of their products, these Anker SoundCore products come extremely close to the sound quality while costing $300 less.
Really good product for this price

I’ve seen some reviews where it’s said noise canceling is ok but in my opinion it’s great had the tv on and when I got them I said let me try them out connect to my iPhone XS Max and I couldn’t hear the tv turned of noise canceling and heard the tv switch it back on no sound from tv I had to turn the tv up to hear it now the tv is extra loud plus the sound is great also they feel premium I love them so far I also have the new Sony wh-1000Xm3 and beats studio 3 and there is little difference between them maybe the Sony just a little but for the price I say get them was to be a Xmas gift but I’m keeping them will get another one. Bluetooth is excellent also. An update to my review i love these now that i've spent a couple of days with them i use them more than my sony or beats studio 3 or bose they have a good sound profile ill buy anothe one in a different color.
Seriously, these are the greatest! Great quality sound, awesome fit and easy to connect to my phone. After I bought my pair, my wife wanted a pair too. I approve.
Very good!

Man do these things work for 60 bucks. Sound is great, ANC is above par for the price and they feel just as premium as my grandpa’s QC35ii. The battery life is also amazing.

review_title: Great battery life and noise canceling!
review_text: I use these at work in an office environment, and they're fantastic! Great battery life and great noise canceling for the price. Can't be beat!

review_title: You get what you pay for!
review_text: I bought these headphones instead of spending hundreds of dollars on ones that I thought would do essentially the same thing. Well, I was wrong. The noise cancelling feature on these is subpar at best when compared to Bose or Sony. The buttons fell very cheap and for some reason every time I go down stairs, step a little hard or barley bump the earcup whilst wearing them I get a weird interruption like there is a lose connection inside... very irritating if you like working out in these. I do own other Anker products and they're great, but I think these headphones are a dud.

review_title: Comfort, endurance, sound quality, and price.
review_text: The ANC is not impressive, BUT even it's passive one really able to muffle the general noise.sound quality is very good, as expected from Anker. Bass sound is well defined and not overpowering, clear mids, and crispy highs. I can really hear the fingernails picking the bass strings, while that sticks hitting the hi-hats. Well maybe not that clear, but hey, for sub $50 headphones, this is a real steal! Comfort and long battery life is the big plus-plus here..
I like the sound and noise cancellation from this headphone. I also like the feature to answer the phone. It is a well designed headphone for a great price. Thanks

These headphones are awful. I use them for playing video games linked to a Bluetooth television. The audio has consistent cracks and pops. Sometimes drops out. The headphones are basically unusable whether noise cancelling is turned on or off. Extremely disappointed with this product.
The only thing lacking with this headset is the charging cable itself doesn’t seem like it’s made by Anker. Everything else is great!

review_title: Wonderful Product! Plus a question about noise-canceling...
review_text: Long-winded build-up followed by a question: First off, these headphones (just like my Soundcore Liberty Neo earbuds) are of truly impressive quality especially for the price point... I'm new to noise canceling technology; I've noticed that when the headphones are on but I'm not playing any media and there's no loud exterior sounds, the nc causes discomfort in my ears, an ambient sound similar to when you're on a plane and need to 'pop' your ears (and turning off the green-lit "NC" button doesn't really alleviate the sensation) -> Is this common and I'll just have to grow accustomed to it or is it possible that there's an issue with the device?

review_title: Comfortable, long battery, good sound, amazing price
review_text: These are not the best noise cancelling headphones on the market. But for a fraction of the price of a similar pair from Bose, Sony, Jabra, Beats, etc., they are a solid choice. I was really just looking for wireless headphones to use in the office, I wasn't really concerned about the noise cancelling aspect. These were a pretty great mix of good bluetooth connectivity, good sound, and excellent battery life. I also found them very comfortable to wear for a long time. Cons for me are charging via micro-USB instead of USB-C, and the fact you can't pair to multiple devices and switch between them. If I want to go from using my laptop to my phone, I have to go to the pairing process. However the pairing process is pretty easy.
I've bought numerous products from anker and I'm always amazed by the quality and the price. These headphones work great, I haven't had any issues with them and I've had them for about 3 or 4 months

review_title: Comfy, light, simple to use, awesome sound, great value
review_text: I'm wearing my brand new Life Q20 as I write this. Listening to some old favorites by the Doors, songs I know really well so I can really check out the sound quality. And it's impressive. Clear, good imaging, the BassUp works well in bringing out the kick drum and bass playing without being boomy. Solid midrange, but the highs are lacking, especially with the BassUp EQ, there's no sizzle in the cymbals. The highs are somewhat better with Normal EQ. The overall sound quality is very listenable. UPDATE: I took them to the gym (very noisy) and the Active Noise Cancellation was AMAZING! It was almost spooky the way my world became so quiet when I put them on. The sound quality is excellent, and I really think the bass in rock-solid and the overall sound is better when you don't use the BassUp feature. I was very reluctant to wear over-the-ear headphones rather than my ear buds at the gym. I'm glad I changed my mind. Surprisingly simple set up, charged in about an hour, paired effortlessly, easy buttons that are quite finger friendly. Good quality build and look. Don't really have a sense of how well the Noise Cancellation works, but I'll take these to the gym (where nobody is listening to the canned music but it's real loud anyway).
Cómodos, relación costo/beneficio insuperable.
These headphones are really nice. The battery life is amazing. I like the Bass.

Bought these for my wife, apparently a lot of husbands buying these for their wives here. she loved them. They’re comfortable and with great battery life, great sound, and for the price you can’t go wrong!
Noise cancel flutters horribly when earphones covered by hood hat pillow etc on off is weird they are too big for small heads etc nothing g special cheaper ones are actually better.

review_title: Sound quality on par with Bose at a low cost. NC is average though but great for the price.

The NC feature is average but better than the competition at this price. I have a Airpods Pro and the NC on that is much better than this but Airpods Pro is 4x costlier. The build quality is on par with Bose and the customer service is as good as Bose and better than Apple. Overall I recommend this for anyone looking for a headset at this price point over other brands. I have tried few other brands sold in amazon at this price point including highly rated and reviewed ones. The other brands I tried fall behind this because of fit, build or sound quality. NC quality on all of them are either same as this or worse.

I have to take them off to hear anyone talking to me, even a few feet away. I've even used them snowblowing, and they work nearly as well as my legit ear protectors. I have yet to hear anything other than, "Battery is high." when I turn them on, even after 6+ hours of playback. The only drawback is that the mic doesn't pic up really well, but it is still good enough for a phone call, just not long term multi-user gaming type sessions. But I didn't buy these for that, so it is just a nit-pik. These are consumption headphones, and they are great for that.

review_title: Excellent relationship between price and quality

I've been looking for comfortable noise cancelling headphones without breaking the wallet and finally found it! I bought these on a sale for <$40. I have to say, one of the best investments. Even if the noise cancellation isn't that great, I can't complain but I got more than I bargained for. Cancellation is unbelievable and sound quality is crisp. Trebles are high and the bass rocks. Buttons to on both sides work as expected and responsible. The padding is soft but if you leave them on for too long in warm weather, it's expected you may be a little sweaty. Battery life has been tested for 10 hours without any problems with noise cancellation while sleeping or needed to tune out sound. I have yet to run out of battery nor get an alert that I'm low. Would've bought another as a gift if I knew...next time.

review_title: Very nice for such a low price!
review_text: Big Anker fan here. First try with their headphones. I bought them for the tween nephew who insists he needs $350 Beats because he's going to be a DJ. Turns out, he loved them and so did I! I did a quick check on them because I'm in the market for a new set myself. Not only do they fit his little head, but my adult head too. Very comfy, controls are easy, connects easy, no complaints at all. I'll be buying myself a set before long!

I have had some issues with them disconnecting a few minutes after they auto connect to devices, which I noticed with every set of headphones I've had of this brand. But connecting manually seems to fix this issue.
Good sound quality, better ANC compared to Taotronics and Mpow. Little less Not comfortable compared TaoTronics Bh060. For me, the first 2 advantages compensates little less comfort.

The only thing that didn’t work for me is that the headphones fit snuggly and gave me a headache after a while but I assume this will lessen the more I use them.
Anker does not dissapoint...great over the earphone for its price range. Easy to operate...NC is quite effective...could not hear the noise around me. Worth every cent...Thanks to Anker

review_title: Great headphones. Even better customer service
review_text: I bought a pair of these headphones during a Black Friday/Cyber Monday sale. When they arrived I noticed some unexpected noise coming from the headphones when ANC was on. I contacted customer service to try and understand if this was normal since these were my first pair of noise cancelling headphones. Shelly from customer service got in contact with me the next day and we quickly confirmed that the headphones were not working correctly. There was a low hum when ANC was on which wasn't out of the ordinary, but there was a high pitched noise coming from the right cup that was. I had a return label the next day to send it back to their engineers and a new pair before Christmas! Highly recommend these headphones and Anker products in general.
You can't beat the price for very decent headphones.

review_title: Can’t beat the price/performance ratio, but the quality isn't great
review_text: Update 4.27.2020 Adding a star because Anker Customer Service reached out to me and sent me a replacement pair of phones for free. I will use the new ones and reply back after i have had them for a little while. Only time will tell how well they hold up. Update 3.30.2020 Updated review: 2 Stars I still stand by the original review in terms of sound quality, noise cancellation, and battery life. Those continue to be exactly as they were. However: After just three short months, the once plush ear cups are just a flat lumpy mess. The foam inside does not stand up to daily use at all. The leather covers are also starting to dry out; its only a matter of time before they crack and peel. And lastly, the plastic body now creaks and groans every time i put them on, turn my head, or take them off. I honestly wonder whats going to happen first: The plastic is going to crack, or the ear cups are going to rip. Only time will tell. Original Review: 4 Stars Overall, I would say these are a solid buy for $60. Anker soundcore products continue to improve with each iteration, but they still have some room to grow. They aren’t *quite* up to par with Bose, but are probably up there with Sony or Sennheiser. Obviously, this is subjective to personal tastes, but I think these headphones actually have a pretty wide sound stage. The treble is clear without being shrill, mids sound good and in their own space and they don’t get left behind or crowded out by the bass, which is solid (and honestly better) without the bass boost (which is really more of an EQ change instead of a real change in amplified bass frequencies. I leave it off). Bass is punchy without feeling ridiculously warm or overpowering; Beats these are not. Ive also used these to listen to some tv and movies, and I feel like the dialogue is clear and present, while leaving enough room for the effects, background noise and music to all fit in together. But they aren’t without their drawbacks. They ear cups are super comfy, and I have actually fallen asleep with them on a few times, but the faux leather liner leaves no air in or out, so they don’t breathe at all and become a sweaty mess, even now in the winter. The band is nice and wide, so it fits my stupidly large head well enough, but the weight balance on your head feels a little top heavy, and I find myself adjusting them even when I’m not moving around. And the ANC actually kind of sucks. It works well enough to drown out light background noises, like typing on a keyboard, or even walking around an office building, but it isn’t strong enough to nullify a train ride or a plane engine, and the headphones don’t seem smart enough to figure out how remove constant white noise like a fan or heavy rain; that kind of noise actually seems to get drawn in by the mic, and I find that I actually get better passive noise control from the ear cups with the ANC off for noises like that. Again, these aren’t perfect, and they don’t have a fancy app with tons of bells and whistles to fine tune the experience, but they sound incredible and they were only $60. You also can’t find a better customer service experience anywhere else, Anker has literally never let anyone down. Ever. For that, I can live with their shortcomings.
Great product. Big fan of Anker.. great quality.. I am a flight attendand and take my headsets and earbuds around with me.. no problems...great price for the products

review_title: Good quality but made be queasy

However, the cups make such an effective seal that they upset my equilibrium for some reason. After listening for an hour--mostly without the noise cancellation turned on--I felt queasy and a little seasick. I plan on returning them.

So I bought my headphones through Amazon. When I received them, the right earmuff was making this weird vibration like too much pressure. This only happened when I used the NC button. I was hoping this wouldn't be what noise canceling is supposed to be cause its annoying. I contacted Anker directly and explained the situation. They emailed me pretty quick despite it being close to the holiday. They emailed me a prepaid label to return and as soon as I shipped through system they mailed out the replacement. Apparently mine was defective. They were very efficient about it and very nice. I received my replacement like 3 days ago and so far so good. I've charged no problem and connected to my laptop and have used the NC button and so far so good. I don't give it 5 stars because I don't have it long enough to really know about the battery life and sound quality after a few uses etc. But overall Im satisfied.

review_title: Technical flaw in my Soundcore Life Q20 pair (NC noise).
review_text: I bought these for $39.99. It is a cheap price for the quality of sound these earphones provide. BUT.... I am still debating whether I should return these. My pair of the Soundcore Life Q20 earphones has a technical defect. You will hear unbearable screeching noise (your ears will burst) each time you try to go for a run wearing these earphones with NC on. The same thing happens if you ride in the car or a bus and the vehicle hits the rough surface. when you have NC on... I took a long ride and was not able to use these earphones in the NC mode as I was getting so much static noise that made the whole user experience super annoying. These earphones work great if you want to use those to listen to the music sitting on the couch or in the office chair. Do not move or run or you will get static screeching noises. So disappointing. If you do not move, the sound is excellent though. Alternatively, you need to turn the NC off, if you expect a lot of movement / vibration -- so the NC feature is very limited in these earphones even though Anker advertises this pair as having NC... Again this review is about the Soundcore Life Q20 pair that I purchased. You might or might not experience the same.
Worked very well on my last flight. Would highly recommend the headphones.

These are actually pretty nice, and luckily I didn't buy them specifically for noise cancellation. My only real gripes are two: 1 - noise cancellation really sucks. There are a bunch of noises that cause loud poppings. I'm pretty sure the noise cancellation's input is being clipped, causing the resulting output to sound horrible. Things like making popping noises with your mouth or touching near the noise cancelation microphones causes this. I keep noise cancellation off because these pops are significantly louder than the music I'm listening to and actually hurt 2 - noise cancellation turns itself on every time you turn the headphones on. This would be fine if noise cancellation worked better, but as it is, it's kinda a pain to turn the headphones on and have to also disable NC every time. Bottom line: They're well worth the price. Noise cancellation may work great for you, or you may hate it, either way you're getting at least your money's worth. You get what you pay for, and you're not paying much for these. Update: this happens several times a day, without disconnecting bluetooth, my computer stops actually producing audio. It still says it's connected, and windows says it's playing music, or whatever through them, but nothing. 5 times a day, I have to reconnect bluetooth. this is almost as bad as having a cable. This was pissing me off so much, I tried the cable. Just by plugging the cable in, I get a strong 60hz hum, and the sound quality is trashed. I'm getting clipping and sound cuts out. These are trash. With this, I would no longer buy them again. Downgrading to 2 stars. 2nd update: I've determined these are causing migraines. I'm done... 1 star, they're trash.

These have no right to be this good at this price. I am a novice to noise cancelling, but from what I understand these do a pretty great job blocking out consistent low-frequency sounds. Meaning, the insanely loud HVAC at my job gets removed entirely, but the vocals from the crappy music being played still gets through. I'm coming from the ATH M50x and the sound quality on these is definitely not as good, but these are less than half the cost and are wireless. The sound quality is plenty good enough as long as you're not an audio snob. Pros: -Battery life -Comfort -Build quality -Bluetooth range -Controls on device -Comfortable even with glasses on Cons: -Noise cancelling isn't perfect (but you really shouldn't expect it to be at this price) -Ear cups are a little small for my huge head -Fatigue set in after about 6 or 7 straight hours of wear (the squeezing on my head wore me out)

I got these as a Christmas gift for my husband and Sony ones for my daughter. Comparing them side by side, these were much less expensive and I like the sound better and the noise canceling was also more impressive than the Sony ones.

review_title: The only thing I liked is battery life
review_text: I always loved Anker but in this case I'm dissapointed. It easily drops from head beside that Noise Cancellation is not good, simply it doesn't have noise cancellation. The only thing I liked is battery life, I dont use it everyday but battery looks good.

Great

review_title: bass bass and very balanced sound. burn-in
review_text: if you want them to sound great, do not turn the volume all the way up when out of the box. make sure you burn them in first(40 hours recommended at half volume, mix music genres every other day(let them rest) and use jlab app for burn-in headphones maybe every 10hrs)

review_title: Sound problems with 4 months of use on the first pair, second pair working well!
review_text: Bought them for my fiancé who fell in love with them immediately. Wore them for gym workouts, practicing (he plays bass), and work calls. He couldn’t believe the quality for the price. Unfortunately over the past couple days, the left side has be cutting in and out. This is the first time I’ve had any trouble with an Anker product, so that much more surprising that it happened after 4 months of use. To add to it, he didn’t register his Headphones so we couldn’t take advtage of the 18 month warranty. I’m hoping that it was jut a glitch with the product we received and not the product overall. Also... make sure you register your product! Edit 2.2.2020: not only did Anker reached out to us to help trouble shoot, they sent us a completely new pair (like, looked in the mailbox and was super surprised!). I will always love Anker products, and their customer service is top notch. Hoping this new pair lasts for more than 4 months and will review then. But 5 stars for their faith in their products and customer service alone.
Great for the price

review_title: Lots of weird quirks, but they work
review_text: PSA: You can't have NC on and charge them at the same time If you use the aux cord and NC at the same time you get ground noise interference (static) You can't make calls with the aux cable in But: noise cancellation works surprisingly well, bluetooth sound latency hell of a lot better than it used to be, pretty much do the job, other than a few quirks. Pretty good for the price. And they still work well in aux mode even if the battery is dead.

review_title: Two units and both were defective.
review_text: I received the first unit, based upon a recommendation by the CNet site specifically the Cheapskate column, and was immediately dismayed that after charging the unit completely it would not turn on nor would the noise cancelling aspect turn on either. I immediately looked in the user guide and found no answer that would cause this unit to become operable. I then requested to return the unit and receive a refund. As I have purchased Anker devices previously with great success, I re-ordered the exact same unit fully confident that my issue was an aberration. Unfortunately the second unit was exceedingly difficult to turn on and off, but it would eventually operate satisfactorily except when it didn't. I elected to put up with the problem as I did not desire to return another set. Then after a week of using the headphone while on vacation over the holidays, the headphones started repeatedly reporting that the noise cancelling was on, then about ten seconds later it would report that the noise cancelling was off. This would repeatedly occur every 10 to 15 seconds until I would have to hold both buttons down for a while to shut the headphones completely off. I gently laid them down, to keep from throwing them through the wall of my home and I then requested another return for my replacement headphones. As I stated previously, I have purchased several Anker products in the past and I have been well pleased. Perhaps I received two defective products in short order but I will not take that chance again, at least for a while. Thank you.
Great value, sound as good or better then the 350 dollar Bose headphones that I had purchased earlier.

review_title: Replacement solved audio connection problems, now fully recommend
review_text: Update 2/4/2020, original review below Anker customer service reached out and sent me a replacement pair. I've now been using the replacements for about 1.5 weeks, and I can happily report that my issues with connection dropping are completely gone. Since that was my only real con with these phones, I'm updating to 5 star for both the value and for Anker's apparent dedication to customer satisfaction. -------------------------------------------------------------- I was pretty impressed with these headphones immediately after receiving them, but I've since come to the conclusion that they've got to go back. The short and sweet: Pros - sound quality is good when the bass boost is off; ear pads are comfortable; pairing process with Win10 laptop was easy; can have multiple sources connection; good price for the feature set; build quality is good; battery life is good. Cons - really just one, but it's a doozie. I have the headphones connected via Bluetooth to my Dell XPS 13 laptop, pretty much all day every day. They drop audio connection about every 3-5 minutes for several seconds at a time, occasionally dropping connection completely and then reconnecting, during which time the audio output defaults back to the built-in speakers, and switches back to the headphones once they reconnect. If this happened much more rarely, I could probably live with it, but as it is, it's enough of an annoyance that I'm going to ditch them and get something better. Prior to these headphones, I had a pair of Cowin E7's that never once dropped connection, and I only got rid of those due to the battery going kaput.

review_title: Bought these as an Xmas gift

review_title: Buy them...Just Do It! They’re the best!
review_text: I literally can’t say enough good things about these Bluetooth headphones! I was unsure of the quality I would be getting for set of NC Bluetooth headphones under $100, but the moment I opened these up I knew I had made the right choice. Turning these headphones on and placing them on my ears LITERALLY MADE MY JAW DROP HARD! I’m serious I was drooling! And knowing I didn’t have to spend $200 bucks to get some bangers had me in tears! There is no competition that I’ve found for the price! COMFORT: The comfort level is unbelievable IMO. The ear pads are very cushiony, soft and comfortable, very cool so they never really heat up or cause ear fatigue, and they have great swiveling ability. Hands-down the most comfortable over ear headphones I’ve ever owned; more comfy than most of the top models of leading brands. SOUND QUALITY: Very decent low-end, smooth and balanced mids with a slight swoop in the mids (preferred), and IMO I really like the high-end response! No shrillness to the highs nor is there a lack of clarity. These headphones are balanced well enough that you Can add or take away EQ if you’d like but they don’t necessarily need it. Some people have complained about these being too “bassy” but I did not find that to be true at all. I am a full-time Musician with a lot of experience and I know what I’m looking for personally. I could use just a tad more low end response but that’s basically negligible when looking at these as a whole. BATTERY LIFE: Shoot, the battery life will make you wanna slap yo’ grandma’s dentures out! Seriously the battery life on these is no joke and the fact that you can get around two hours of play time from just 5 minutes of charging...slap yo’ granddaddy’s toupee clean off his cue ball. Jk love on your grandparents! But ya the battery life is stupid goooooood! All right this review is getting a little long-winded and silly but whatever. As I said I do not have enough good things to say about these headphones. If you’re looking for high-quality Over Ear Bluetooth headphones that won’t break the bank, I can’t see how it gets any better than these!

Comparing to a pair of Bose noise cancelling I own.. I can honestly say I see almost no difference... the on /off and the volume I would prefer to be on opposite sides of where they are but that's something very small and insignificant. Otherwise I really see no difference between the Bose and these. There is an enormous price difference,however definitely a fabulous Buy.
It cancels enough noise that it works on my anxiety when I'm out in public, however it is VERY sensitive to movement and clicks often. If you walk often, or run, this headset is not for you.

review_title: Comfortable, good-sounding, but useless for noise cancellation
review_text: - Build quality is good in general, excellent for the price. - Comfort is excellent, regardless of price. - Audio quality is good in general, excellent for the price. - Noise cancellation is shockingly useless. I tested it in my bathroom, with the fan running, and it cut it down by maybe half. Fan sounds should be easy to cancel out. This is the reason I’m not giving it a higher score overall. I bought them specifically for this feature, and it just doesn’t measure up. Update: 1/24/20 I've been using these for a few weeks, now, mostly in an office with light talking in the background and constant HVAC fan noise. I don't expect the ANC to do anything for the talking, but I do expect it to improve the fan noise. It doesn't reduce the fan sound; it just changes it slightly. The marketing materials for these claim that they "instantly block" up to "90% of low and mid-range frequency noises." Don't believe it. They would be totally acceptable headphones if they didn't market the ANC feature at all, because it's useless to the point that I don't even bother turning it on. Update: 1/30/20 Anker reached out and took care of the problem with a refund. I have a lot of respect for this company. Don't hesitate to buy from them. Back up to four stars.
