This headset didn't work out of the box. I can't tell if it's just a bad product, or I got a bad item. The sound quality is terrible, the sound cuts in and out. It sounds hollow. We tried troubleshooting it by looking up problems with the noise cancellation, but we didn't find any solutions. I have several other bluetooth headsets and the way this headset "wobbles" or cuts out is different than my others. The bluetooth was terrible. It randomly disconnected, and if you were more than maybe five feet from the computer (we tried on two computers) then it wouldn't work. (My other bluetooth headsets, even the earbuds, let us move across our apartment with no issues.) Also, the battery life wasn't as advertised. After charging, with the sound issues and only listening to youtube, my wife only got about 3-4 hours before the voice would come on and alert her to charge. We gave the product about two weeks (Christmas gift) to see if we could figure it out or were doing something wrong. My wife decided that even if it didn't have the technical or quality problems she wouldn't want it. She said it was extremely uncomfortable, and the headset didn't adjust enough to fit well. She said it was more comfortable to wear the headset over a beanie as that was more comfortable. In the end it is a product that has both quality concerns and a bad design that doesn't meet our needs. Sorry, Anker, usually I like your products, just not this one.
Great product. Definitely as good as "name brands." Sure to be a competitor to those soon -- just as good.
I bought this for a gift. Son loves them. Noise canceling seems to work really well. He can't hear me at all.

review_title: Good for the price, but ANC was a bit disappointing
review_text: Purchased these for air travel primarily. Have owned Bose wired ANC headphones previously. Pros: The battery life is excellent. Used both wired and wirelessly, they persisted for over 30+ hours of travel on a charge. Battery was only midway depleted by destination and was easily topped up before return leg. Ear cups are comfy, albeit, after several hours, I did have some discomfort where apparently one of my ears must be a bit larger since there was a bit of an ache around the cartilage. A bit of shifting the headphones and it was ok. The headphones are light, so several hours of continuous wearing was pretty comfy (more comfortable than my prior Bose over the ears) and the wireless aspect was a great improvement. Sound was really nice - I'm no audiophile, but I was able to watch movies and listen to music quite nicely, even turning on the extra bass. Cons: ANC is a bit fickle. I suspect the microphones used to cancel out noise had something to do with things, but engine noise would be cancelled when facing certain directions and would then be more audible when I looked straight ahead. Somewhat annoying considering the engines are to my sides and I should be looking forward, for the most part. Part of what makes the headphones light and affordable also make it a bit cheap - as most of the body and the pivot joints appear to be made of plastic also. The plastic makes me feel that the joints will break. When you pull them out of the bag and spin the ear cups into position, you'll know what I mean as soon as you stretch them out to go over your head. The position of the power switch seems to invite unintentional/accidental power on. Twice found the unit powered on in the storage bag from accidental enablement. I'm pretty sure I powered them off before storing. But you never know. Since it happened more than once, I don't think it was a coincidence. That said, even powered on unintentionally, the battery life is such that an unintentional powering on was not an issue for the duration of a transcontinental flight. Painful static feedback was heard during takeoff. I have no idea why, but it also happened on more than one flight. Not a huge issue, but also somewhat annoying. For the price, you simply don't need to turn them on until after you've taken off, but just saying... The ANC wasn't fantastic, but good enough, especially given the price. I haven't decided whether or not to keep them, but at this price point, I think the "good enough" adds more weight to the value of these.
Great headphones for the money. Really comfortable and I wear glasses, so on other over ear headphones they press in too much. These are quite lightweight compared to my ancient Sony's
Had an issue after a few weeks with it not charging correctly, opened a case on Anker website and they exchanged it with no hassle and very quickly. Great customer service.

I purchased these headphones to workout in without having wires getting in the way. I rated it 4 out of 5 for its Great battery life, sound quality, and the fact that it stays in place while I jog. However, a loud bang can be heard coming from the headphones approximately every 7-9 minutes which catches me off guard every time so I took off two stars for that reason. Other than that, I am very happy with them!

review_title: Perfect for an open office with the worlds loudest co-worker.
review_text: I purchased these to work with a new phone and to knock down the noise level of an open office. I am happy to report that these headphones are pretty damn good. The sound quality is clear and precise. They are comfortable to wear. The battery life is very good. I have to charge them once a week with daily office usage. The price point is stellar compared to the more well known brands. But the kicker is that these puppies knock down the sound of the world's loudest most annoying co-worker. Closed office walls and sound absorbing cubicles cannot contain the sound this harpy emits. There are dogs two counties over that wonder what that constant shrill is that spreads through the country side. This co-worker leaves no thought, no opinion, no gripe, no comment unspoken. We speculate that they are physically incapable of an internal monologue. In addition to this poor soul's inability to not comment on the office temperature or to announce that they are going to lunch, they also have what we call Spinal Tap Volume Syndrome. Meaning that when they say something, the volume is always at eleven. Long story short, where walls, sound dampening panels, and common courtesy have failed, these headphones have come to the rescue and have mitigated the constant threat of hearing damage and insanity. I fully endorse these headphones and have already recommended them to many friends.

I ordered the Q20's to replace a set of stolen Sony XM3s. Didn't feel like dropping another three bills so my hope was that these would get me 80% of the way there. Unfortunately, these didn't meet my expectations. First, the sound quality was only so-so. The quality of the drivers was actually pretty good, but the EQ tuning is poor. I appreciate a flat frequency response and found the bass over exaggerated and mids and highs too recessed and muddy, even without the bass boost. They probably did this with some assumption of a target demographic, but I'd prefer Anker default to a more level EQ and let bass heads adjust from there. Second, the noise cancelling was also a bit disappointing. Granted, I was coming from the XM3 which are the best NC on the market. But I found these only marginally better than my old Sony MDR-ZX770's. I was still able to hear my Vornado fan and some ambient music wheras the XM3 cancelled those out completely. These will likely do great with airplane noise, but fall short on anything above a low rumble. Anker does win in some areas. I thought the headphones were quite comfortable if not a bit on the small side. Battery life was also on par with the rating. It was also a nice touch to add AAC codec support over Bluetooth instead of the more standard SBC. I can live with the noise-cancelling, but the EQ tuning was a bit too much for me. I ended up going with a pair of Mpow H12s which were more balanced and quite frankly a more quality pair of headphones for about the same price or less. These are 1 star headphones that get a 2nd due to the low price.
This are good. They are definitely not the best at noise cancellation as i can still hear my coworkers clanging their metal forks on their glass dishes but at least it takes away some of it

Anker products never disappoint. I will never spend more than this for over-ear headphones ever again, because why would I? I listen to all kinds of music, and these gems do not disappoint with any genre. The battery life is wonderful. The Noise cancellation is phenomenal as well. The worst thing I can say about them is after about two hours, they started feeling heavy, and I guess maybe I would prefer a hard case over the bag it comes with. Waah....

review_title: Great if used for audio only
review_text: Music wise they are a good headphone to purchase. Good base and loud enough to give decent sound when you have them turned away from your ear. Not a fan of the noise cancelation though. It makes a popping sound. The sound quality for phone calls is horrible, unless you a fan of yelling so the receiving party can here you, and everyone else around you.
Great Buy! I’m a Sony guy, but so far I keep using these more often than my Sony WH-CH 700. Knowing these were from Anker made me purchase. Going on 3 months now and running strong.

They’re great got mine In today. Bass is amazing. Noise canceling affects the bass a bit but works could b better. Pretty comfortable. Great sound quality if u don’t like strong bass then this isn’t for u.

I guess you can say I'm kind of an Anker fanboy because they're my go to company when it comes to buying accessories, so I decided to buy these headphones. There's mostly positives when it comes to these headphones, but there are a few negatives. They sound good and the noise cancelling is great. I couldn't hear my neighbors playing their annoying Pop music and lighting off their fireworks after midnight on New Year's with the noise cancelling on while watching Avengers: Endgame. I was impressed. The battery life is excellent as well with the noise cancelling on. If you're low on battery, it doesn't take long to charge them fully. And now, a few negatives. I don't know if I have a small head or something, but the headphones seem to slide off easily if you bend down or move your head quickly. I wouldn't recommend these headphones if you like listening to music while working out. Also, wheb the ANC is on, you'll get a slight popping noise if you close a door or walk down a flight of stairs. It's kind of annoying. Overall, the headphones are good, not great. If you're looking for ANC headphones at a decent price, these headphones are the way to go.

Good headphones. I had to return them because I couldn't adjust them small enough to wear comfortably, and, because they were too loose even when adjusted as small as they would go, I wouldn't have been able to wear them working out as I wanted.

Purchased these when they popped up in "Lightning Deals". We live in an apartment so I "play" on my laptop at the kitchen island while my wife watches TV a few feet away. The "noise cancelling" works great, so I don't have to jack the volume up too loud on the headphones. The sound quality is very good and the headphones are comfortable enough to wear for extended periods of time. Couldn't really ask for much more at the price (especially if you catch them on sale). Recommend.

review_title: No need to spend $200+ on sony or bose
review_text: Truly impressed for the value here. With these your getting the NC, Good bass and overall sound quality that contends with rival Sony and Bose. For the price couldn’t complain about much of anything. Maybe alil bulky, but hey I can deal if it’s saving me over $200 buying song or Bose. Of course those are better but not by much.

review_title: Looks and sounds good to me !
review_text: I use Q20 all the time every day in and out. I just can not stop it. Comfortable, sound is good, battery life good, looks good, price good, quality good …. just buy it for yourself and you will agree with me. Period.
the fit is not perfect but it works great

WOW! These are Really GOOD Sounding Headphones for the Price. Build Quality is very Good also. The Hi-Res Audio Quality and Noise Cancelling is Really Excellent! I am Very Pleased with the Sound of Music in Anker Soundcore Headphones. I Highly Recommend the Headphones.

review_title: Best ANC headphones for the price range
review_text: Sound quality is Better than average Active Noise Cancellation is quite good providing an adequate reduction in ambient noise But the build quality is excellant

review_title: Best silenced bang for my buck
review_text: I really like my new Anker Soundcore Life Q20 hybrid active noise cancelling headphones. I work in an open office. My colleagues are great, but sometimes their chatter distracts me. It’s frustrating. Then, I bought the headphones based on an article recommendation. From the first time I tried them in the office, it was instant quiet. I can't imagine not having them now. Four stars for noise cancellation because it didn't eliminate ALL noise, but it was more than enough to cut office distractions. Four stars for sound quality because the sound is bass heavy, to me, even without the BassUp engaged. Five stars for battery life because I can go a couple of days before needing to recharge.
Good battery Good soundquality Good ANC

review_title: Great sound at a great price
review_text: Full and rich sound. The noise canceling is good but not great. Very comfortable to wear for long periods of time.

bluetooth works flawlessly from at least 25'. sound quality is good, very comfortable, noise cancellation works well muffling my wife's vacuum cleaner. Haven't tried them on a plane yet. battery life seems remarkable - I charged them once and used 16+ hours over a two week period with NC on and they are still working.
These headphone sound great, light weight, long battery life, the noise canceling could be better but works for what it is.

review_title: worth the low price for the quality
review_text: So far so good. The audio quality is good. The battery last a long time. This doesn't give a thumping base but I was looking for an above average bluetooth headset so I'd stop accidentally choking myself on wires and this is it. I've never tried fancy headsets like Bose or Beats so I can't say how those compare. I don't have the money and I don't think they're worth it. This sounds better than my previous wired earbuds, blocks out noise, allows me to walk away from my device, and has a great battery life. The functions on the headset are easy to control so that's also a plus. It serves me well. Worth the price for sure.
Very nice
Great product, easy to pair to any device we tried.
Just used them on my 3hrs flight... what a pleasure - no noises of plane's engines,nor people, just good quality music.
couldnt be happier with them. they are solid, feel very well made, loud enough, comfortable. definitely not high end, but worth 50 bucks? Oh yes. Excellent headphones for the money 4 stars

review_title: Good value for price, big cans great battery life
review_text: The battery life on these is unbelievable. I typically use them a couple hours in the office; they last a week in that use case scenario. Nice big, hinged cans to cover my fat head and big ears. Audio quality not bad; noise cancelation serviceable. Great value for price. Recommend.

I've owned MPOW and Beats. These Anker Q20 outperforms the $45 MPOW and $300 Beats in every category. The Q20 battery life exceeds its advertised battery life. I've watched Netflix over a two day period before the battery died. The MPOW would lose battery power after about 4 hours. The noise cancelation on the Q20 far exceeds the MPOW. I could hear traffic noise outside while losing the MPOW. I cannot hear any noise inside the house when using the Q20; even with my wife watching TV, I can barely hear the TV.

review_title: Great product for the price but, a little big.
review_text: These are the best Bluetooth head phones (for the price) I have heard. The sound cancelling works good. The head phones fit comfortably. The only concern is that they are a little big. I have an average size dome but, evenat the smallest size they are a little big.

review_title: Battery life is awesome moneys worth
review_text: Battery life is awesome moneys worth

I'm flying from LAX to Auckland, NZ. It's a 13-hour trip. About 2/3 of the way now. The engine noise is deafening. I can't hear the airplane movies through the disposible headphones they gave us. BUT, I have a secret weapon! I've been enjoying listening to the airplane movies and my podcasts with these noise cancelation headphones. The only hiccup is my dear husband keeps wanting my attention and I havent found a button or command on the headphones to pause the audio input. I've figured out how to how to pause the noise cancelling, though. These headphones are super comfortable and the battery lasts a really long time.Compared to really high-end NC headphones, these probably have good sound quality but not the best you can buy. I don't care about that. I have avoided the horrible migraine and exhaustion that strikes me down on any flight over 2 hours. And the Anker Soundcore are priced to fit in my budget. All my money is going into travel plans and souvenirs. I'm very pleased with my purchase!

I'm not sure why people are saying these aren't as good as Bose. I'd have to think they probably work for Bose, and are embarrassed to admit these $60 headphones are just as good. I own a pair of Bose, and these headphones are definitely just as good, in all categories. I just got back from a trip, and the noise cancelling was great on the plane. I was even sitting right behind the wing, which is probably the noisiest part of the plane. Don't hesitate to buy these over the Bose.

review_title: Noise cancellation glitch is a no go
review_text: Noise cancelling has a glitch where if a percussive noise (in my case someone was clapping) it will produce full volume popping. Additionally sudden movements (walking down stairs was enough to trigger it) will also cause the headphones to produce the popping. After a few minutes of popping my ears had enough and I stopped using them. These headphones are fine for people who will be sitting or not moving too much. Outside of the noise cancelling issue the audio quality was ok. Felt comfortable for the hour leading up to discovering the issue.
Amazing product.Best support on Amazon.Sound is great,battery 30-40hr,noise cancellation great.I recommended this product
Excellent headset. Great noise cancellation. Far better than what I had expected for this price. Definitely highly recommended.

No, they're not Bose. Nor are they Beats. They are simple, affordable, and comfortable budget-oriented headphones. I've owned a couple Bose headphones, and the Anker's don't really come close to a new set of Bose. But, even Bose headphones will wear out with time and use (and sometimes even without use). Comes down to how much you want to spend, and what you're using them for. Do you need a $300 pair of headphones to listen to audiobooks or cancel out the noise of the neighbor's kids playing in their driveway? I didn't.
Great value
Fiancée loves them.

review_title: Great sound and noise cancellation, Ear cups a bit small
review_text: I bought these to replace my Sony MDR-XB905BTs that broke (after four years of cramming them into a bag without a case). The sound is very good. I’m not nearly as fond of the enhanced bass as I was with the Sony’s, but at a quarter of the price, I’m not complaining. The noise cancellation is not perfect, but is still great. A couple times I’ve noticed varying sound in the environment messing with my music sound levels, but it was minor and didn’t persist too long. I didn’t even buy these for noise canceling, but the first time I turned them on, I immediately pulled them off because the ambient noise ( which I was apparently accustomed to) suddenly and completely disappeared! Once I remembered the ANC, I put them back on and just enjoyed the quiet before turning on the music. My only real complaint is that I wish the ear cups were larger. These are just a tad too small, and I have to fool with them to get them situated just right or they bother me after a while, where the pair these replaced was a little bigger. The cups are soft and ready to wear for hours once I get them settled, though. Update after a month: the noise cancelling is really nice at work. I don’t fly, so can’t speak to how it works be on a plane. If you tap them, say reaching to take them off or change volume, the ANC sometimes reacts with quite a loud click. I’ve finally given up strictly due to the small ear cups. The left one is fine, the right drives me insane pinching the lowe earlobe, and I can’t stand to use them any longer. Otherwise, still happy with the sound quality (not an audiophile, but do like decent phones), just wish I had smaller ear(s).
The headphones did not have enough squeeze to stay positioned on my head. They repeatedly fell off my head when sitting back in a chair. This was very disappointing and had to return them.

I am really enjoying these headphones! I travel quite a bit so I use them to listen to music and watch movies during the flight. It does a great job blocking out the engine and background noises. The battery life is excellent and the sound quality is crisp and clear. The ear pads are comfortable and I have no issues with wearing them for a coast to coast trip. I also use them for conference calls on my phone and my laptop. The bluetooth connects to my laptop and I can use our conference calling software (Bluejeans, WebEx, etc.) to join the call and not be disturbed by background noises. I liked these so much I bought a pair for my wife. I also told my two brothers about them over Christmas and after listening to mine they ordered their own. I am considering buying a 2nd pair to leave at work. Definitely recommend them!
Love theses headphones! They work great!

Headphones have completely lived up to their description. Great for planes and for working in an open office plan and comfortable enough to sleep with them on if your environment is uncontrollably noisy
Bought my son these headphones for Christmas. He loves them. The noise cancellation function definitely works; he often claims he cannot here me when he is wearing them.

The quality is not same as a Bose headphone, however price-value rate is pretty good. Noise cancellation was pretty good during my latest transatlantic flight. The battery life looks good it was around 30 hours with high usage and active noise cancellation.

review_title: Does its job: Play music and noise cancellation! Could have used the Anker Life V2 hard case
review_text: GOOD: - Good 3-in-1: listen to music, noise cancellation and microphone - Good brand name - Solid build quality - Portable BAD: - Microphone does work, but not meant for that use in a noisy environment - Could have bee sold with the Life v2 hard case. The included soft case is flimsy

Since I changed my phone to one w/o the 3.5 jack I've been wanting to get a new pair of headphones (I have some older bose on-ear wired ones w/o NC) but since I have small children who want to use all my stuff all the time, I did not wanted to risk getting the new really expensive ones and have them broken. This pair works as described, they sound as good as my previous pair and both the over ear and NC do a good job of blocking outside noise reasonably well. I've only had them for a couple weeks but they seem well constructed and feel very comfortable. I would've liked a case instead of a bag though even if it meant 10 or 15 dollars more.
Headset arrived right on schedule and worked just as expected. good sound quality and the ANC seems to be very effective. Good price as well.
I’ve only had these headphones for a few hours. From what I can tell they are well built, the sound is great and the noise cancelling is phenomenal. I really enjoy them so far!
A FANTASTIC set of headphones - - at a super price!! Purchase well made!

review_title: Poor Build Quality in My Pair
review_text: I bought these and am impressed by them. The good: Comfort - These fit well and I've been able to wear them for periods over 5 hours without a problem. Noise suppression - I wear these while walking in a busy gym, on a treadmill. These work well suppressing the mechanical noises in this environment. They also reduce surrounding conversations that I have no interest in hearing. Sound quality - I am not an audiophile and usually listen to audiobooks. That said I have been very happy with what I hear using these. The bad. Build quality - This is where I have my problem. On the 2nd use, I noticed that if I handle these in a certain way, if there were any sort of impact to them (inadvertently bumping them, jumping during exercise or just putting them on and letting the ear cups "hit" my head) they produce a loud pop noise. Initially, it was am infrequent irritant but is now to the point where I cannot use these. The sound is loud enough to be painful. I suspect there is something loose/improperly soldered inside. If it weren't for this I would highly recommend these.
For the price you can't beat these NC headphones I take these with me when I travel or just need to escape from my environment. Highly recommended!

review_title: Good Sound Quality and Noise Cancelling
review_text: The first set I receive was defective; however, soon after I returned the defective unit, Anker Customer Service sent me a replacement right away. The replacement unit worked great! Anker's Customer Service is Superb and won me over as a customer. I already own several other products from them.
Outstanding device, it exceeded my expectations.
My very first on-ear headphone and I am fascinated!

Like so many have commented, I was blow away by the sound quality and noise cancelling at this price point. They are well constructed and very comfortable. They also look great with a matte black finish and some gloss accents. They paired easily with bluetooth enabled devices - iphone, ipod touch, ipad, marantz receiver - and have great range. They do not come with the case but I wanted to show an example of a hardshell case specifically made for these headphones that is now available (Geekria). I am really pleased with these headphones and will add more when I have a better sense of whether the 40 hour playtime is accurate.
Great product. ANC excellent. Compares favorably to my Bose.
Battery lasts a long time. The ear piece vibrates when using listening to electronic music and using noise cancellation. The headset over the head feels flimsy. Sound quality is fantastic.
Perfect price

review_title: Best wireless/sound canceling headphones under $100 on the market
review_text: For the price 5star for every categor
Good quality and do the job
So far, a good value for the price. Reasonable sound deadening and very good sound quality.
Mostly good sound although a little bassy.

Over the last several years, I have bought many Anker Bluetooth products. In nearly each instance, I have found Anker sound products to be very lacking compared to their other products. I have to say the same for this Anker Soundcore LQ20 Bluetooth headset. The quality of the sound is very "cheap." Now I get these are $50 headsets. But, the sound is more like the $20 headsets you can find in WalMart. The best thing: the NC is excellent. Quality of construction is also excellent. Sorry to be so harsh as I am (and remain) a huge Anker fan. I have spent probably over $1,000 on their products over the past several years. I love them all EXCEPT for the sound products.
Great sound. Comfortable headphones with easy access to controls. Only negative is that they don't get as loud as other headphones. Great price!
overall it's not a bad product seems well built. it is quite comfy as well, battery life is amazing. my only gripe is the rattling of the speakers when they're turned up.

review_title: Best Noise Cancelling Headphones (especially for the price)
review_text: My wife and I recently took a trip to Africa--about 20 hours in planes. We purchased a $300+ pair of Sony headphones (WH1000XM3). I did a lot of research and those were the best on the market. I was about to purchase a second pair, and found these Anker Soundcore's on Amazon. I bought them with plenty of time to test them out before our trip, just to see if there really is a difference. To my surprise (and relief to my bank account), the $50+ Anker's were almost exactly as good as the $300+ Sony's. There was an extremely small difference in noise cancelling, and the sound of both were equal. In fact, the less expensive Anker's have a longer battery life. Save $300 and buy the Anker Soundcore's.
These worked great on my international flight!! Did not even have to charge 10 days apart!! !

When using the sound canceling my hood rubs the mic which then makes scratching sound through the headphones, I never use active sound canceling mode , honestly these are loud and clean enough not to have too .

review_title: Decent quality. Anker fan, but no 'auto power off'.
review_text: Would have given these more stars, but can't figure out why they wouldn't add 'auto power down' to save battery life. Turn them off manually or battery will drain away.

review_title: Wont connect to some devices, loud poping sounds during use
review_text: Loud poping noises occur randomly during use and they they shut off ever time I try connecting with my laptop, they work with my phone, my liberty 2 pro's work just fine with my laptop but these shut off soon as they connect... I wasnt expecting much for $60 and love all my other anker and soundcore products but this one was a total fail in my book...

review_title: ANC popping noise, QC issue or bad design?!
review_text: Like similar reviews, when i tap on the headband or cups lightly with ANC on, these have a harsh popping sound. Enough to hurt my ears! Otherwise they sound decent.
Comfortable for hours. Easy BT pairing. Sometimes the active noise canceling is too loud, but just turn it off if it annoys you. Battery life is as described
Great price! Great sound! REAL comfortable for travel.
I do not regret my choice.

review_title: Good option for big headed people... Me, not so much.
review_text: I really do like these headphones for doing the job they're supposed to do. What I don't like about them is they seem to be made for someone with a much larger head. I'm a 5'10" woman of average build and these are constantly sliding. There is no way to adjust them smaller, only larger.

These little guys really perform well for the price point. They paired quickly out of the box, no problems losing connectivity, and strong battery life. They aren’t the best performing noise cancelling, but I use these at home over my airpod pros because they are way more comfortable.
Battery life is better than ones I have that were double the price

My wife needed noise cancelling headphones for our plane trip home and she is quite frugal so she wouldn't let me get her the Bose headphones. These don't come with all the bells and whistles, but they work great. Sound and noise cancelling work really well.
Literally zero complaints. Wouldn't change a thing. The sound quality is awsome. The noise canceling is so good I have to turn it off in an overly quiet room or it gets creepy.
The speakers rattle and pop from the bass which is the opposite of what they advertised
Son is amazed at how well this perform
Love it so far! Easy to pair, great sound, and long lasting battery life.

review_title: Good for the price, but far from premium.
review_text: For the price, these are great. Sound quality, comfort, and noise cancellation all punch above their weight. With that said, here are my qualms. Design – the ear cups swivel and fold, but the consolidated form factor feels unintentional and clumsy. The buttons feel cheap, like they belong on $10 headphones. UX – I have to press and hold the power button for 5 seconds, I believe, to power these off. This is very nitpicky, but when I’m packing these up, this feels like a chore. More importantly, the volume level on my MacBook Pro essentially becomes disabled when connected via Bluetooth to these headphones. I’d much rather use the OS volume controls rather than fumbling with the volume buttons on the side of the headphones. I know I’m being critical. I think overall I’m disappointed in these because I’ve come to expect great things from Anker, and these headphones fell short of that expectation.

review_title: Anker Soundcore Life Q20 calidad por un bajo precio
review_text: Muy buenos audífonos, su calidad respecto a su precio son justas. La cancelación de ruido es la mejor pero es funcional, lo único que confunde es la activación de los bajos, sin embargo son aceptables.

review_title: Very cost effective active noise cancellation
review_text: I work in a busy office area, and the ANC cancels out buses, traffic, dims people yelling, etc. Works great to really lower my ambient noise significantly. The earpieces are really soft, which I actually like. I actually wore these for almost 10 hours straight once because they were just plain comfortable and effective. Battery life really does last a long time, I only charge every few weeks. Sound quality is solid, but not as clear as some more dedicated headphones. Overall, extremely cost effective for the price.

review_title: The gateway drug into wireless noise cancelling headphones.
review_text: If you've never tried noise cancelling before, you'll be amazed. If you just want some decent Bluetooth headphones, you'll be satisfied. For the price, though, the battery life is great and the feature set and comfort are icing on the cake. The build is plastic but doesn't feel alarmingly brittle. Real buttons rather than touch interfaces mean you can actually use the controls while walking or without wondering if you hit the right button. Are there better sounding headphones for the same money? Yes, but there aren't any with better battery life, or with noise cancelation. Every incremental improvement in sound, noise cancelling, quality and battery life commands an exponential increase in price. These cans are probably best described as the gateway drug into noise cancelling wireless headphones.

review_title: Super solid alternative to Bose for the price
review_text: All around great and inexpensive headphones Only thing holding them back is an loud crackle you occasionally get if you shake your head or otherwise rattle them with them on.

review_title: I really wanted to like & to keep these headphones because they looked so good but unfortunately...
review_text: I really wanted to like & to keep these headphones because they looked so good but unfortunately, they had some issues that made them not worth keeping. The things that I really liked about them: 1) I really liked the construction of the headphones; the felt like they were very well made, very close to premium quality. 2) I loved the design of them and they look really great on my head. They are beautiful looking headphones! 3) They were really comfortable; my girlfriend has BOSE QC35ii and I couldn't sense ANY comfort differences. 4) Some of the frequency range sounded really good, mostly in the mids and highs area. 5) The buttons were very responsive and they didn't feel cheap at all—on other headphones I tried, they did. The things that I didn't like so much: 1) These things have way way way too much bass and this is just in the normal bass mode. And the bass sounds kind of loose and not well defined. And when you turn on the BassUp feature, well, I really don't know how anyone could listen to music like that in that mode—they become super muddy sounding! Anyway, they have so much bass that I would say that the regular BassUp "OFF" mode should be the "ON" mode and the "OFF" mode should have considerably less bass. I had to go into my Macbook's EQ settings to pick some preset EQ modes to show just how much the bass needed to be turned down (and this is just in the normal BassUp "OFF" mode) to get them to sound better. ...SEE PICTURES of needed EQ settings. ***NOTE: iPods and iPhones are NOT easy to access the EQ settings as they are in: Setting>Music>EQ>Then select the EQ Preset you want—no Manual mode on iOS portables. *** 2) Other problems I was having were when I had them connected to my 2011 iPod. They would cause the music to skip or interrupt 1 to 3 times (almost every time) when I would scan through a track to a another section in a song (it would happen after the scanning) or when I would skip forward or backward to another track. I have other Bluetooth devices that this iPod does NOT do that with, including 3 Anker SoundCore Motion Plus speakers—which I really really LOVE, by the way—so the problem isn't my iPod. ***NOTE: I don't know if I just got a faulty headset regarding this issue but I was too afraid to try another headset. *** 3) The other issue I was having is: I was getting this noticeable volume up & down pumping or oscillations in the music whenever the A.N,C. (active noise cancellation) was "ON"—it would not do this with the A.N.C. in the "OFF" position. Anyway, these volume oscillations would occur with nearly every device I would try them with: a 2011 iPod, a 2012 MacBook, a 2016 iPod, and a 2019 iPhone—it would be more noticeable with some songs than with others and also in some sections of songs rather than in other sections. It did not seem to do this with my Android LG phone but I don't use this for music—I very much dislike the Mp3 format due to the smaller files and the lack of any integrated seamless playback feature. Maybe these Anker QC20s work better with Mp3 formats rather than the Apple ACC formats, but who knows. ***NOTE: I don't know if I just got a bad headset regarding this issue but I was too afraid to try another headset. *** 4) The other thing that I didn't not care for was when the fan was blowing on me I could clearly hear amplified wind noise coming through the A.N.C. microphones which are suppose to help the A.N.C cancel out noice, but in this case they were actually accentuating it through headphone speakers. ***NOTE: this issue wasn't completely a deal breaker for me like all the other issues were but I could see how this would be a problem if I was outside using the A.N.C. on a windy day or if I was hot and I needed a fan directly on me. *** I really like most Anker products that I buy: the power banks, portable backup battery chargers for phones, their Bluetooth speakers (several models)...etc. Unfortunately though, these headphones just weren't able to do it for me this time. :-(

review_title: Great quality set for the price
review_text: Great value for the money!

review_title: Fantastic Headphones, Particularly for the Price
review_text: I had pretty low expectations for these given the price but thought I'd give them a shot. I am beyond pleasantly surprised. The noise cancellation is excellent based on using them on a recent flight, the sound quality is fantastic, battery life is great, and I love that they're rechargeable as opposed to using standard batteries. Throw in the fact that they're super comfortable and I'm really blown away.

review_title: Great headphones, especially for the price!
review_text: I’ve been using these as my work headphones as a video editor for the past 4 months (usually plugged in, so not using bluetooth too much), and they have been great. Very comfortable, I can wear them for hours with no pain. The noise cancellation works fine, but it isn't that powerful. No complaints on the sound quality, though like I said, I use them for video editing, not music, so I cant speak to how they are for listening to music. Overall, I definitely recommend, especially for the price!

review_title: Much better than others in class - but have a flaw you may not be able to live with.
review_text: Build quality is much better than expected at this price point. The soft matte black finish is very nice. Ear cups are extremely soft and comfortable. I have a larger head (wear XL motorcycle helmet) and only had to extend the headband a little for the right fit. These prolly won't stay on small brained folks. The sound even in the non bass boosted mode is bass heavy. The sound is acceptable for their price range. Music gets plenty loud, but when paired to my FireStik and watching video, I could have used another couple notches up. The noise cancellation works much better than expected. My kids have the Cowin E7's and the NC actually works on these. The E7's I can barely hear any difference between NC and non-NC. As others stated, lower tones get filtered out much better than higher tones. The popping that others have reported is present. I tried making this happen when I received them and could not. After 2 days, I noticed the popping when I put them on with the power already on. If I quickly unseat and reseat the earcups I can recreate the pop. If I jump up and down really hard it also happens. So these are probably not the best for exercise or heavy activity. I had to REALLY try to make it happen so for my purposes of sitting in the office, working with moderate activity in a noisy area with lots of fans and A/C units running, the occasional flight, they should perform fine. I agree there should be no popping whatsoever, and this is a serious flaw. For me I don't plan to return them as I like them very much except for this and I don't think it will be an issue for me. Should they become more sensitive and the popping increase, I will contact Anker. I've owned many Anker products and all have exceeded my expectations. This is the first time I have experienced any issue with one of their products.

review_title: Can't get much better at this price point
review_text: Does all what promise, obviously you can't expect Bose performance at this price, but that's the point: do you really need to go that far... considering this already is doing a great job? I used it traveling on a plane and helped a lot, in office too...For a fraction of the price of any other premium headphone...Plus battery is amazing

These headphones came at a surprise. They are a great set of headphones for the low price. I use them at work for the noise cancellation and at times I have to take them off to check if coworker are still there.

review_title: Sound quality and volume was not that great
review_text: Sound and volume, on the top was very low (as compared to the phones). I tried it in working out, but could not maintain the rhythm of the exercise.

Great pair of ANC headphones. I use them for podcasts, music, workouts, reading and phone calls. In my opinion, they are very similar to Sony ANC headphones, at a fraction of the cost. My only complaint is the occasional popping sound caused by lightly tapping the frame of the headphones. Update: Decreasing to a 4 star review due to the annoying vibration sound, which is most noticeable when your still.
Works great on cell and laptop Need to figure out why it cuts out so early while talking.
Liked price, so far has lasted, it does what it says. Perfect starter pair, not cheap quality!

So they are comfortable, and light weight, work wireless or wired. I have read you can't charge and use them but I have not tested that. I had borrowed a friends Bose QC25 for a day to test out noise cancelling vs my dog/kid. I didn't test those with these but the Bose noise cancelling were dead silent with nothing else going on these have like a low wind rustling sound to me, or like a highway far away. So I will be returning them. If you listen to music (and not have a book read to you like what I doing for school) they would be great. I will not be able to use these though. I do like the comfort, I did not test the blutooth because I don't have that function on the laptop which the books are on. I did not care for the sound quality of reading though in comparison.

The sound quality is superb. Noise Canceling is acceptable for this price - does not cancel all the noise though during my train rides. Connection to my phone drops on its own and the headphone (kind-of) restarts itself and goes in pairing mode. I noticed the connection drop issue with my Fire TV Stick connection too so it is not limited to my phone alone. After few more days with the headphone, the connection issues has not recurred. However, there was loud (very loud and uncomfortable) popping twice when walking 3 blocks on my way to work. Perhaps- it is not to be used when you are moving and exercising! I increased number of stars to 5 because noise canceling works even in AUX mode. A big help when using my laptops which do not have Bluetooth.

I wanted to like these for the price/performance ratio, but after a few hours on a red eye flight their small ear ups started hurting my ears like crazy. ive never had another pair of over-ear headphones cause this amount of pain. Ultimately I had to return them, which is a shame because I really liked them and won’t be able to find a pair this good at the same price point.
Only bad thing is it doesn’t shut off on its own

Great headphones for the price. The noise cancelling is on par with other headphones in this price range. They are comfortable, flexible and lightweight on top of the head. Would have preferred a case instead of a bag for storage but not a deal breaker. Overall very satisfied with this product.

Works really well. The sound quality was good too. Wished it comes with a case. The only issue I have noticed so far is I heard a loud pop sound each time I have hit a bump or pothole while noise cancellation mode is activated.

❤️ sound quality with clear treble, awesome base and volume could crank up loud. ANC actually worked. Long lasting battery 40+ hours per charge. It’s very comfortable to wear, overall well designed. Reasonable priced at $40. Highly recommended 👍

totally impressed with these headphones. not really a single complaint so far. super good battery life, solid noise cancellation, comfortable fit. after 2 hours or so, wearing over the ear headphones does get a bit annoying, but that with any brand (I'd say).
My kid love it
Ordered as a replacement for the wife’s wired Sony ANC headphones. She said these are much more comfortable to wear on long flights and the noise cancellation works just as well as her previous set.

I have an average-sized head, and even on the smallest setting the headband is much too big — the headphones fall off easily if I tilt my head or even just walk around. The sound is fine and the cups are comfortable, but the size makes it impossible to use them.
Very impressed so far. Bought it for air travel but have been using it on the treadmill. Very impressed with how well the noise cancellation works

These headphones are a marvel. They do pretty much everything you would expect a pair of ANC headphones to do at a very low cost: * Effectively cancel a fair range of frequencies, especially the ones that count like the low drone of everyday equipment / engine noise (e.g. plane engines, road noise, vacuums, air conditioners, fans, etc). * Clean noise cancellation without discernible artifacts (i.e. no hissing, buzzing, etc.) * Bluetooth connectivity * 3.5mm headphone jack mode for older devices / airplane in-flight entertainment systems * Good battery life, they keep on going and going and going * ANC on/off button * On-headset playback controls * Fold easily and compactly * Comfortable (adjustable, padded headband) The trade offs are minor: * These do not effectively cancel all frequencies, notably human speech. That said, the passive isolation is pretty good. I have no issues with these in an office environment. * On-headset controls are a little clicky and a little clumsy, but you eventually get used to where everything is. * Still haven't figured out how to reliably activate Siri from the headphones on an iPhone 8 running iOS 13 -- I get the "listening" Siri chime right away, but then it immediately stops listening. I don't really care about the feature, just thought I'd note it in case others were experiencing similar issues. * Finally, sound quality is definitely acceptable but a little muddied. Totally understandable though, these are budget headphones and something had to give. The fact that the engineering team managed to cram in a four-microphone array, ANC subsystem, Bluetooth, a 3.5mm interface, and a long-lasting battery, and -- oh yeah, drivers -- into a package that can be sold for around $50 is staggering.
Excellent for the price
Great pair of headsets, work good in noise areas.

Got these mostly for wearing in bed listening to meditations as earbuds kill my ears. Was surprised at how comfortable they are and they really muffle out my husbands snoring! Battery is long enough so that if I remove them when half asleep and forget to turn them off I am not needing to charge every day. We have several Anker products and have not been disappointed in any of them. For the price-point, they are great!
Nice sound but heavy on the head. Dont turn volume too loud it draims the battery pretty quickly.

review_title: Everything's better with Noise Cancellation OFF
review_text: I liked my Soundcore Life 2 headphones well enough to purchase the Anker Soundcore Q20. The Q20s are relatively nice headphones, but the noise cancellation seems to deal with background noise by generating a white noise cover. In addition, the music and voices that I want to hear become somewhat boomy and muffled. Get these headphones on sale, if you can, because they're nice headphones, but don't expect to benefit from their "active noise cancelling:" it's just an annoyance. If you can't get the Q20 on sale, pay the extra several dollars for the Soundcore Life 2 -- their sound cancelling works nicely.

My husband wears a hearing aid and some of the headsets make his hearing aid produce feedback while using them together. This one does not do that. He uses them on a daily basis and is happy they work well together.

review_title: Great but BT need to be fixed
review_text: Everything is great except it got disconnected from BT fr time to time.

review_title: UPDATE: Major and reproducable flaw causes potential hearing loss
review_text: Edit: After I wrote this review, Anker support reached out to ask if they could provide another unit at no cost, so this review is being updated to reflect that... and unfortunately it led me to lower my rating. Practically as soon as I started using the replacement unit, the same terrible rattling sound occurred once the bus I was on went over a patch of bumpy road. I believe this model has a fundamental design flaw and cannot recommend it. I'm usually all-in on Anker and I've had plenty of success with their products, but at least the unit I received has flaws that render it essentially unusable. The noise canceling technology is extremely sensitive to vibrations, it would seem; while I have them on walking down the street, if I step just a bit too lively, the headphones make a deafening rattling noise that probably would cause hearing loss. The same thing happens on a bus if it goes over even the slightest bump. Unfortunately I'll be returning these rather harmful headphones and looking to another brand.

I really wanted to like this, but every time I make a sudden movement (take a big step, jump, go down the stairs) there is this extremely loud jolting pop noise. This only happens with Noise Cancelling on, but turning if completely off negates a major reason why I got this. Wish I could return, but this was a gift. Very disappointed.

review_title: Can't beat it for the price
review_text: There is obviously better options if you are really an audiophile, but for the average person these are the best value for the price. The one gripe I have is volume control location is a bit awkward at least for me. I would definitely recommend for anyone looking for a budget set of headphones. The noise cancelling works great.
Bought as a gift, awesome sound and fit especially for the cost.

review_title: Band too big/loose and ear cups had a poor seal
review_text: I wanted to love these, but unfortunately even on the smallest band setting these headphones were still too big and did not fit tight enough. I'm a female with an average-sized noggin and these slid off my head with the slightest movement. They would not stay on at the gym or even while simply walking. It seems that these are more so meant for men. The sound quality was alright for the price, and bluetooth worked great even while at quite some distance from the Samsung Galaxy S10 the headphones were synced to. I found that the right ear cup in my headphones did not have as good of a seal as the left, however. This bothered me as it made it sound like the left side was louder and blocked more noise out than the right side. This was very annoying and threw me off. I have since returned these headphones and will be looking elsewhere. I love Anker products and think that though it may have been a fluke with the ear cup issue, it's a shame Anker wouldn't consider their customers that have a smaller head.

I initially bought these for a trip I took last December. The last time I charged these was on xmas day. Since then I use them on my lunch break at work to listen to podcasts ( 30 mins a day mon - fri) As of last friday 1/31 the battery life is still at 80%.
Great value! Very pleased with purchase.

review_title: Great Hybrid ANC Headset (Wired or Wireless) Perfect for Air Traveling
review_text: This is my first Boise cancelation headphone set, so I do not have other headset to compare to. I purchased this headset primarily for air traveling. It made a huge difference in the loud airplane cabin. I was able to enjoy the inflight entertainment much better with the active noise cancelation feature. This headset works wired or wireless which actually is essential for me since I need a wired headset to plug in to watch movies on the plane. It is comfortable to wear, and it did not bother my head or ears after taking a couple of 4-hour flights back to back. My wife has a hard time resting or relaxing on the plane in general, but this headphone set helped her feel much less anxious during the flights thanks to its noise canceling feature.

Great sound, awesome bass, the multi-connection features allows me to use them however I need. Great for canceling outside noise for listening experience, however, their not there yet for cancelling the noise for people on the other side. Still their great for the price!

review_title: Good value overall, but glitchy ANC
review_text: Overall, these are very strong headphones at their price point. Sound quality is impressive. The bass is very heavy (even in the "normal" equalizer mode), which is great for bass-heavy genres but a bit funny for Stravinsky. The Bluetooth is strong--I can listen clearly from my phone one or two rooms over--and the headphones are very comfortable. I am quite happy with the battery performance; the battery lasts longer and charges faster than the battery on my phone. The buttons on the headphones are fine: they lack the control features and the tactile solidity that you will find on headphones at higher price points, but at this price point the button controls are perfectly satisfactory. This brings me to the active noise cancelling feature. On the positive side, the ANC creates a pleasant sound stage and produces none of the uncomfortable pressure sensation that I have often experienced with other ANC devices. The ANC is quite effective for low to mid frequencies. It doesn't much attenuate higher frequencies, but high frequencies are somewhat passively attenuated by the headphones themselves. All in all, the ANC is not effective for things like chatter and crying babies, but it is effective at removing lower frequency noises like trucks and fans. However, the ANC has a serious problem. When activated, the ANC occasionally produces a very sharp cracking noise that is loud enough to be moderately painful. This glitch seems to be correlated to pressure fronts (like closing an airlock door), and to movement. Even walking can trigger this glitch; stairs and the gym are out of the question. I am quite disappointed in this problem; it is a sharp drawback to what would otherwise be an excellent pair of headphones meriting a five star rating. The bottom line is that these are excellent headphones for sedentary use only.

review_title: Anker does it again! another great headset
review_text: I’ve had several of the higher tiers headphones And I have to say that the Q2’s 🎧 brings a little something to the competition in the wireless gear battle. The price you can’t beat, the sound quality is awesome and the noise canceling does a great job. My only flaw is the sound output. If it go 2DB to 5DB higher then these would be perfect and the battle would be over... Maybe just maybe Anker will do a Q30 True Wireless full size head set based of o there Liberty 2 Pro True Wireless earbuds.. cmon Anker please!!! !

review_title: Good choice except at the gym
review_text: The fit was fair, not great, for workouts lying down. Constant adjustment required. Sound quality was ok, but the Noise Cancellation caused a lot of warble in the music at the gym, suppressed bass, and often injected loud bursts of static into the earphones when they were physically touched or adjusted. Overall, disappointing for gym use.
The battery life mixed with simple controls and great sound make for a great pair of affordable headphones.

The headphones are a bit heavy and slip if your doing something active while wearing (washing the dishes). The sound quality is superb, the materials are top notch, and the build is 2nd to none. I thought I was wearing a $300 unit. Anker did a great job again!

They feel great and sound great the problem I have is when I use them with my tv the voice and lips of the program are not in sync. I didn't have this problem with my other head phones but these are more comfortable.

review_title: Don't buy Anker Soundcore Life Q20 if you like your ears!
review_text: 1 star rating due to the noise cancelling feature resulting is a high-pitch and loud screech when adjusted the headphones with noise cancelling on. I sent them back for a replacement thinking it was due to a manufacturing defect. Apparently that is not the case for the second pair exhibited the same painful noise when touching the headphones for any reason with noise canceling was enabled. Hunted product review here, Amazon, and found others reporting the same issue. Too bad. Seemed like a nice headphone for $50 ($10 off coupon). Noise cancelling cannot be disabled without turning it off every time you turn on the headphone. If it could, I would have kept the headphones for non-critical listening at home. For example watching television or Netflix on my laptop or tablet. Advise not buying these and wait for the next generation which hopefully will not have the same issue. I bought the Sony WH-1000MX3 headphones. Love them even if a bit bassy. Noise cancelling on them is a totally different experience even when ignoring the problems with the Anker's noise cancelling.

review_title: Good Sound Quality and Comfortable Padding
review_text: I use this for watching TV at night when others sleep and I love it better than my other headsets because it feels very comfortable on the head, the sound is great, and the built quality is much better than expected form a headphone of this price. I highly recommend it!

I had an old pair of Bose over the ear noise-canceling headphones that were starting to sputter- didn't want to blow big bucks on a replacement pair and got these - wonderful! I hear instruments in the music I never heard before- comfortable and being that they are wireless is a great plus over the bose- I am sure for more money there are others that are indeed better but get them and they won't disappoint!

Great buy .. surprised by the quality and comfort... but then I shouldn't have its made by Anker ! This company make many great reliable products. Great customer service when needed. I needed them in the past on on other products.

Good units. Connect easy to bluetooth, Biggest miss was the spring which holds the headphones to your head, which was too loose. Fine for Airplane, but could not workout in them since any quick move or inversion would cause them to come off of my head. My wife's Sony's are comfortable and much tighter. Very good purchase and quality for the price, in fact, hits over its head.

review_title: Bad pair first time, Anker Customer Service Awesome. Enjoying new pair!
review_text: UPDATE: Anker's customer service was amazing. They reached out and sent me a new pair. I got a damaged pair the first time. These ones have no issues and the noise cancelling and sound quality is great. These work liked I hoped and excepted. I updated my review to 4 stars. The inconvenience of all this and also the below average sound quality when connected with the aux cable make it lose a star, but overall, impressed with the new pair!

I love the fact that are so comfortable that I can wear them for many hours at a time and even forget that I am wearing them. Battery life and charge speed is awesome. I use them for watching TV at night so I don't disturb my Apartment neighbors. Once paired to the TV, I just turn them on, they immediately shake hands and all Audio goes to the headphones. I use a NetDot magnetic Micro USB adapter and charge cable so charging them is just a matter of waving the cable next to the port an bang...charging. No fumbling with plugs.
Ive had these for a while now, amazing for the price, highly recommended. Light too and wife loves them

comfortable, excellent noise cancellation, good sound quality, great value. But doesn't matter if you intend to use them where there is a lot of other RF traffic from wi-fi, celluar, etc. like a large office. I tried 2 sets and made sure the surface book I am using has the latest bluetooth updates, nothing in the troubleshooting guide fixed the dropping connection. I really liked these and wanted so badly for them to work but . I have several other older bluetooth headsets that do not have this issue.

The noise canceling is very impressive , causing me not to hear the door for a UPS Amazon delivery. They are extremely easy to pair with my iPhone. Build quality is good for this price point... they put the cost into the performance of the product. I consider this product a “Best Value”.

review_title: Great value - ideal for affordable quality
review_text: I purchased another off-brand headphone, and the magnet came loose after only using them s few times, so I did more research to avoid another mistake. These are exactly what I wanted, ~$50, well constructed (strong), battery way more than many other brands, Noise cancel mostly needed for flights so I don't care about not working as well in voice frequencies etc.. Given that I will use these as I am outside where other external noises are occurring, the need for $300 set is not of any value. Friends have the Bose and Sony, honestly, this sounds just as good (to me) I did find the bass too "boomy" easily adjusted with the equalizer on my phone.

These a definite step down in sound quality from the $100 silver Anker headphones. They look nicer though. The anc has a lot of clicking sounds in a car and it has connection issues from even a few feet away.
My daughter, who is often on an airplane, loves them

I love these I wish they came in white though. I have beats...they didn’t hold up well for me so I got these while the beats are being fixed. These are actually really decent headphones. I’m very happy with them. Great sound and mostly comfortable. The top of the headband could be softer but honestly I’m super impressed. They really hold the charge too!
Good quality. Durable.

I use these daily, as a sound source in a cube environment at work. I can't say enough how much I LOVE these headphones. You can easily spend upwards of $300 for a similar product. You don't have too with these!!. The Soundcore Life Q220 are comfortable to wear, pack easily and connect to my devices easily. I cannot recommend these enough. Obviously, there are differences between these and the expensive sets. However, if you don't care about labels, these are an obvious choice.

review_title: Noise cancelation makes loud noises with any vibration.
review_text: These are fine for sitting, battery lasts and comfortable. If you move around quickly or cause any vibrations (even walking), the headphones make sharp noises when noise cancellation is on.

review_title: Just buy, you won't be sorry
review_text: Best headphones I have ever owned, on par with Beats for far less and sturdier build too.

review_title: updated: Great headphones, occasional popping sound effect
review_text: UPDATED: These headphones are comfy, sound fine, and have decent battery so far. If in NoiseCancellation (NC) mode, if the headphones are in-motion, jostled, or have weak-connection, they may make a popping sound. I wrote this feedback a few weeks ago, and the excellent customer service sent me a replacement. The replacement pair exhibits this problem much, much less. The first unit probably has something wrong with it. With that said, the new unit has made popping noises, but much less frequently, and much quieter. I now give these headphones two thumbs up! NC mode is pretty effective. All in all, these are a good value.
for this price the noise cancellation is great and is pretty comfortable

I think anker makes excellent products. I also have a plantronics backbeat pro 2 as well and this one has almost the same sound quality as that of the plantronics I love the fact that it has a good sounstage, crispy highs and punchy bass. The build quality is also very good. The headphones fold down and it's easy to carry. Loving it
Noise control is great

review_title: Great buy at $39...great sound for wireless headphones!
review_text: Surprisingly good earphones for $39. Very pleased with the sound performance. Yes they are plastic and yes the earcups are inexpensively built but very comfortable. Knocks exterior sound down about 50% with radio playing loud next to me. On the plane/train very good. Volume is fine and music doesn’t break up at full throttle. Overall, the compromises made to keep the price level are acceptable. Get em when the go on sale! Don’t think I would spend $60 for them.....

Noise canceling is a little subpar but for the price it works very good. Sound quality is definatly good. They are very comfortable on the ears and the controls are easy to locate blindly . Overall great buy!
Best quality headphones
Great headphones! Sound good and the noise cancelling works great! Light weight and don't feel too uncomfortable for traveling.

First, I’m no audiophile. Second, this is my first pair of ANC earphones. That said, I’m very impressed and think this is an amazing set of earphones for the price. The first thing I did when I got them (after pairing them) was try out the noise cancellation feature. I happened to have a lot of laundry running so I went in my laundry room (closet, really), closed the door, and tried them out. The noise in the room when from a loud rumble to an almost imperceptible hum. Really amazing. I turned off the ANC just to make sure it wasn’t just noise isolation and it wasn’t, though the noise isolation is good, the ANC is what really does the magic. I’ve tried these on plane trips as well, and they do a very good job; sitting at a window seat (where it’s loudest) the din of the plane went from a loud, low ruble to a higher pitched soft rumble - not quite a hiss but perhaps what one might get from a white noise maker. Not bad for noise cancellation alone, but when listening to or viewing media, the difference is amazing. Finally, I can hear the full efffects of a movie without turning the volume all the way up. Honestly, after using these earphones I don’t think I can ever go back to being without ear protection on a plane, for me or my family. That said, I won’t say the audio quality is outstanding. It’s good enough, with good range, adequate volume and decent base, but it’s not at audiophile level. But because they have ANC it’s actually possible to hear music or other audio in situations where normally you wouldn’t barely hear anything, and that’s the big difference. Does Bose do a better job of noise cancellation and audio quality? Probably. But I’d never spend $200-$300 on a pair of headphones just to use on the plane, especially since paying that much for for every member of my family would break the bank. But at the price of these Ankers it’s a no brainer to get a set for everyone.

I have bought several brands of noice cancelling headphones in different price ranges to no avail. The Anker Soundcore Life Q20 is the best by far! Very Long Battery Life! Best noise canceling of all I have purchased! Very Comfortable! All for only $59.00. If you are looking for a great noice canceling headphones that checks all the boxes and won't break the bank then purchase the Anker Soundcore Life Q20. I highly recommend them!

Great for tuning out the misogynistic a**hat at my work. Noise canceling is so great that I can't even tell I'm clicking my mouse or typing on the keyboard. Noises such as yelling and sirens are only muffled but still greatly reduced. Sound quality is great. Bluetooth connection great. Appearance great. Amazing deal at 50 bucks!

I work in a very high white noise area some areas are a constant 100+db of just white noise. I had a set of Philips SHB8750NC/27 that I have been using nearly daily for 2 years. The Philips were ANC and BT and they did a decent enough job at blocking out a lot of noise while also sounding pretty decent for the $15 I paid for them on a Walmart clearance sale(originally $100). Now I have never used a set of high end ANC headphones from Sony or Bose, but I think the Q20s do a great job at blocking the white noise out. They seem to do better than the Philips I was using previously. I have noticed that I have to have the Q20s sitting on my ears just the right way to take full advantage of the ANC. If you are wanting to use these while doing some sort of active activity they might not seal as well while moving around. For people who travel or have a job that is primarily sitting these are perfect. They also sound pretty decent for the cost. Bass is pretty forward even with the BassUP/Boost set to off, but it isn't unbearable. I would like maybe a little more mids, but I guess that's what EQ is for. All in all I'm pleased with what Anker/Soundcore has put out. I just hope they will hold up and last like my Philips, which are still working 100%.
The construction was pretty flimsy it got very loose after only a few wears
for the price this is an excellent set of headphones

I honestly expected more from these headphones. I wasn’t too focused on the Noise Cancelling feature (which isn’t too bad) but the sound quality is very poor. I get better quality from the wired pair of Sony headphones that cost $14.99
Wow is what I say to these headphones. Best set of "cheap" headphones I have ever heard. Buy, buy, buy.....

review_title: These came today and I am loving them!
review_text: Only comparison I can make is against my TaoTronics Soundsurge 60s. Review is not finding fault with the TaoTronics, I've been enjoying them for around two months. Thing is, in every aspect, the Anker Soundcore Life Q20s are better! Better sound, tighter bass, lighter, more comfortable. I am happy!! Play on John Maus, play on!! !

Very nice looking headphone. This will make an excellent mother's day gift. I see that according to Amazon this model is #1 in sales of under $100 headphones here at Amazon. Almost forgot to say that this headphone also has the very best sound you can get for under $100.. The highs and lows are smooth and chrystal clear. I especially love the design of the play and volume buttons... Very easy to feel whar you are doing with them.. very comfortable to wear . Would guys again
Pretty good especially I got it for only $39.99.

My Bose QC25s have aged quite a bit since I bought them, and I wanted a wireless alternative without breaking my bank for the upgraded Bose QC35s. Anker has been pretty solid from my experiences and I had read good reviews, so I went ahead and bought these. And I've gotta say, they have left a great first impression on me. In the package is: - A sleek pair of headphones - A microUSB cable - A 3.5mm to 3.5mm cable - Headphone storage bag I wear glasses and have had several negative experiences with headphone comfort, so I was anxious until these arrived. I'm pleased to say there aren't any issues at all. The headphones don't squeeze my glasses into my face or ears. In fact, these headphones are surprisingly comfortable; the ear cushions are soft and feel amazing. The headband comfort isn't as impressive, but it's not an issue either. I'm not an audiophile but the sound quality is better than what I expected for the price. It's comparable to my Bose QC25s, and I've even found myself using these instead sometimes. I'm not an expert though. The bass boost is a nice bonus feature, but can be enabled or disabled easily. The noise cancelling is great. It's not as good as the QC25's, as I can sometimes hear small crackling when walking. It's quiet enough to ignore though, especially with music playing over it. However, the transition from off to on is incredibly smooth. For contrast, the QC25's noise cancelling has a "pop" when turned on, which definitely took getting used to. At times, I would find myself taking off those headphones before turning on the noise cancelling feature. With these, the noise cancelling is almost seamless. There's not much to say about the buttons, they're great. They're easily reachable, they're easily pressable, they're very intuitive, and they're not an issue. The bass feature can be toggled on or off by double-pressing the play button. Overall, these headphones are looking quite strong. They look and feel like premium quality headphones, something I'd expect to pay double the price for. I only wish I could have bought these instead of the QC25s, since these are a fraction of the price and are easily comparable. I've been impressed with everything so far, so hopefully I'll be impressed by the durability as well. Of course, only time will tell.

The first pair I bought worked great. Noise cancelling worked - even if the volume was a little on the low side. It did it's job. However, I bought a subsequent pair and the noise cancelling is nonexistent. The NC button turns on as soon as the headset is turned on - and whether turned on or off - there is no discernible difference. It's a let down. Hoping customer service can address - have only heard good things about their CS. However, it's an unwanted inconvenience. Good luck with the pair you get - if you decide to buy.

Didn't notice much of a difference when I put these on for noise cancellation. The bluetooth feature doesn't connect very well and will cut out intermittently throughout games and music videos. The aux cable works best if you want smooth audio.
