I love these headphones!

review_title: Best ANC and Sound in it's price range!
review_text: First off, this is not a comparison between the Anker Soundcore Q20s and any product from Bose or Sony.. That is an unfair comparison as they are not even in the same ball park.. I know that most people want to get an understanding of how comparable they are to those but if you aren't willing to spend the money on those, you aren't going to get near what they offer.. That being said, for this price range these are the best hands down.. One hit KO.. I'll list all the features separately so they are easy to find and read about. Active Noise Cancellation: Let me get some things out of the way, I work at a gas plant in a landfill as IT and Data Reporting.. My job is noisy sometimes.. I hear a constant hum from the motors in the plant right outside my door all day long.. I also travel a lot from the various plants we run.. While ANC is on these headphones won't block out immediate talking next to me or sudden loud noises, but they do block out the noise from the plant.. That is without the music.. I do need to point out that the talking is trying to talk over motors so it's louder than your average office space. When the music is on and running, it adds a whole separate layer to the cancellation as I can no longer hear anything else.. Sound: I don't typically have music up loud, most I've turned them up to is 50% because I've been rough on my ear drums since I was a kid playing drums at a young age.. As I've gotten older I've been more prone to try and protect my ears.. That being said, the sound quality is very nice with or without ANC engaged.. I find it's way more enjoyable with ANC on due to everything else being tuned out.. Some headphones will warp the sound when ANC is turned on, these do not.. The sound is as impressive with the feature on as it is off.. This is incredible.. I listen to a range of music from Rap and Hip-Hop to Metal and Hard Rock and they all sound clear and precise in these headphones.. They do have a bass-up feature that increases the bass a little more.. This works well without muddying the sound quality too much.. I imagine if you increase the volume too much it might diminish but from my listening around the 50% max it's been outstanding.. Bass gains can be a real hit and miss for me as some lose sound quality.. With these that's not the case.. Quality: The headphones feel amazing.. They have a nice weight to them (which is not for everyone). I personally like a little weight to my equipment.. It is sturdy and feels solid.. I was afraid of it feeling a little too plastic like but they really don't.. Now they aren't as nice as your $200-$300 headphone, but again, their price range they are amazing quality.. The ear cups are very comfortable and soft memory foam.. I was actually surprised that my ears don't get as hot as normal.. They will overtime due to the design.. It's impossible to get around since it traps heat, but these seem like they don't get as warm as fast.. Also the ear cups feel amazing.. I've literally worn them all day yesterday and felt no ear fatigue or strain.. This is a solid! Functionality: A feature that isn't talked about a lot with these is the awesome ability to connect to not just one but two devices simultaneously.. Now a note on that: You cannot listen to two devices at the same time.. What is going on is I'm able to connect to my computer and listen to music on it while being connect to my phone at the same time.. When someone calls me and I answer, it swaps input to my iPhone and stops playing the music in my ears.. Once the call is finished, it swaps back to my computer and I resume listening.. This is an amazing feature that I use daily! Battery: The battery is very nice.. When I received my unit the first thing I did was pair it to my devices (of course) and started checking it out.. I received them with 60% battery.. I used them the rest of that day at work for a couple of hours.. then when I left, used them a little more at the house and watched half of a movie on them before going to bed.. They were still at 60%.. The box says that they last 40 hours and that is accurate.. If you don't use the Bass-Up technology you can squeeze even more.. and to not use the ANC it goes up higher.. 40 hours for battery life though is incredible for this price range.. I cannot complain! Packaging: The packaging was very nice and well put together.. It came with a charge cable and 3.5mm aux cable (which is great for my Nintendo Switch when I fly).. While I would have loved to seen a USB-C type adapter (as would many others) that is still an expensive change to make and would probably bump the price up out of the $60 range.. I understand from a manufacturing point the reasoning to possibly go with a micro-USB.. It would be nice for C, but it is what it is.. That doesn't change how well this thing is made and works.. The only gripe I have and it's a minor thing is the case they come with.. Well, you can't call it a case cause it's just a bag.. Now, it's a very nice bag, but I throws these buys in a backpack with a laptop and iPad and Switch (in a hardcase) and so a bag doesn't really protect your headphones.. Luckily I had a nice hard case from a cheap pair of headphone I received a few years ago (the case was the nicest part) and they fit perfectly.. So if you don't have one buy a hard case for them.. Overall: Overall, for the price these are the best hands down.. You really cannot beat their ANC and sound quality for this price.. I will definitely buy these again and probably buy my wife some so she'll stop stealing mine.. If it was out of 10, I'd give this product a 9/10 simply due to no hard shell case..

I am not a specialist of headphones or sound quality so specialists should look at other reviews. My ranking is based entirely from the standpoint of a user who wanted low-cost noise cancelling headphones for work and travel for a better sound quality for playing music than ear buds. I've had these for about a month now and they have far surpassed my expectations because of the low price/comfort/functionality. The battery charge seems to last forever and it's a nice feature to be able to use the wired feature without (seemingly) draining the battery. The Bluetooth range extends quite far (I haven't tested scientifically), which makes them ideal if one is wandering around the house/office. The ear cups are comfortable, but I can imagine that they might be sweaty (as another user mentioned) in warm temperatures. I personally would not use them at the gym. All in all, I've been really pleased with these and have bought a second pair. I just hope they'll hold up for a long time!

review_title: Surprisingly good sound and build quality for the price! Well worth the purchase
review_text: I bought these to listen to music while I work. I wanted something more comfortable than ear buds, over the ear and with either active or passive noise cancelling. Honestly, I didn't expect quite so much for the money! These are great anyway, but especially at the price. You really can't go wrong. No, they're not Bose or Harman Karden or anything like $300 headphones ... and no the noise cancellation isn't as good either .... but still, its pretty good! That said, f you come with realistic expectations you'll be pleased. If I had a criticism ... and its small ... its that the 'phones try too hard on the bass. After listening to music on the very natural sounding Apple HomePod, which is tuned NOT to sound artificial, these sound a little inflated in the bass, a little synthetic. I get that 's the preference of most people and fits the sound that so many listen to ... but to me it's just a little bit too much 'whooomp whoomp' when compared to the easy-going HomePod. You can literally wear them for hours they are so comfortable. Time will tell if that super comfy padding will last without wearing out - I have some doubts but we'll see. But you should still spring for them! They're great!

review_title: Excellent support helped fix bluetooth static issue
review_text: Ordered these headphones in early February, 2020. Soon after receiving the product, discovered an annoying issue: a loud static burst that seemed to be triggered by any slight jarring - generated, for example, by stepping off a curb or firmly shutting a truck door while in the cab. Contacted AnkerDirect via email. * [See 'P.S.' below] Received a prompt reply with suggestions about how to correct the problem. I was skeptical, but tried the "Troubleshooting Tips" anyway. To my surprise, the procedures worked! In about 5 minutes, I was able to eliminate this bluetooth-related problem. No more irritating static bursts! In case it might help someone else who encounters a similar problem, the troubleshooting tips I got from Anker: 1. "Forget" the headphones in your device's Bluetooth history. {"Unpair" on my Android phone} 2. Reset the headphones by holding down the Power button and Volume+ button together for 5 seconds while the headphones are charging. {Suspect this procedure is what "did the trick"} 3. Try pairing it with another device. 4. Try the headphones in bluetooth mode and wired mode and see any difference. 5. Try the headphones with NC on and off and see any difference. If troubleshooting does not fix the problem, we're more than glad to help you out per our warranty. Of course it's possible that this problem could come back. However, the problem is so completely gone now that I'm pretty sure it could be fixed by simply repeating one or more of these procedures. One remaining minor issue for me: can't get the play/pause & volume controls to consistently work while listening to audio books. Will update this review later if I'm able to solve this. Hope this is useful. *P.S. Description of the problem that I sent to AnkerDirect support in mid-February, 2020: "This product is *mostly* acceptable for my needs. However, there's one intermittent problem that makes me think this particular unit might be DEFECTIVE -- a very loud burst of static sound that occurs every time I close the door of a truck while in the cab. (Note: I regularly drive several different trucks during my volunteer work, and this annoying phenomenon has occurred on each truck I've driven so far.) This same brief static blast (like a small explosion) also consistently occurs when I do a particular qigong exercise - one of the 8 pieces of brocade - the one where one rises on one's toes for a few seconds then drops to the floor... even when the floor is carpeted. "Is this a design flaw or defective product?"

Good price/performance. I own a lot of good Anker things, so I went with this and am pleased, so is my wife. Initially there was a low frequency throbbing sound in the right earphone, only when noise cancelling was on. Anker on-line support was great, suggested the following, which seems to have resolved the issue: - "Forget" the headphones in your device's Bluetooth history. - Reset the headphones by holding down the Power button and Volume+ button together for 5 seconds while the headphones are charging. - Try pairing it with another device. I think it might have been an interaction with the phone system, as it only affected the right earphone. It was barely audible, could only hear it between songs or if there was a very quiet passage.
Returned the item. Seemed cheap and refurbished.
Noise cancelation outdoors has some wind noise and cars can be heard while walking.

review_title: Being able to use it as I wanted to
review_text: I was not able to turn it of. I had trouble trying to reach any one to get some help. The instructions in the book did not work. i have not used it since I orginally tried it upon receiving it

I got this head phone specifically to reduce the sound of the planes engine and background noise while flying and watching shows on my phone. It does a great job! Now if your an audiophile and need deep base and other ranges this headphone falls short in this area. I would definitely buy this again.
Great quality sound for the price. Would purchase again.
Excellent product

The price was great and I didn't really expect much for the low price. I have tried numerous NC headsets and earbuds over the last many years including Bose products and often used them flying international flights. Bottom line is the over the ear headset is best no doubt, however they must be comfortable if used for hours or you want to fall asleep while using. I suppose the actual noise cancelling of the high end expensive products are somewhat better at NC, but the difference was very difficult for me to detect - certainly not worth even discussing. The Anker Soundcore Life Q20 works flawlessly for me, BT has great range. Easy to use and pair with devices or use with wire. The long battery life is great, I haven't got close to running out of battery yet. Even acceptable to use as phone headset for calls. I'm quite happy with the purchase and I'm not going to let my girlfriend talk me out of the Q20 and take it like she did the other ones. lol I waited almost 2 months and used the Q20 a lot before doing this review.

Totally happy with this purchase. I use these Anker Soundcore Life Q20 over ear active noise cancelling headphones when working out at the fitness center. Works good and easily connects with my iPhone.

I was really surprised at the effectiveness and quality of these especially for the price. Keep in mind they don’t totally eliminate noise but do noticeably reduce it. Sound quality and quality of construction both really good. Very happy with the purchase.

review_title: Hard to believe these things only cost around 50-60$
review_text: Simply put, these are great headphones. The sound is great. I am pushing music from tidal in master quality and it sounds great. With the noise-canceling enabled, the bass is dialed back a bit (quite noticeable between off and on). However, they have a bass booster that is almost a bit much with the noise-canceling disabled, but really help restore the lows when you have the noise-canceling enabled. That being said, for 55$ shipped, it's hard to justify not grabbing these. I had been considering the bose or the sony's for months now but I just didn't want to drop that much money on cans right now. I am really impressed with these cans and would definitely buy it again. The bose and sony might be better on some fronts, but to me, they are not 150-250$ better. I bought these to replace my AirPods. Sure AirPods are convenient, especially with Apple products. However, in many situations, the volume was always an issue and the sound was just eh. I'd need to have them at 80-100% in my office and just got tired of putting that much stress on my eardrums. I comfortably have these cans on at around 50% volume and have a much more enjoyable listening experience. I did read that some people found these hot on their ears. There is some truth to that. However, one of the core points of noise cancelation is as airtight of a seal around the ear to prevent noise pollution into the can, at the expense of ventilation. I won't argue that these don't get warm on your ear, but it is one of the tradeoffs. Just some food for thought.

review_title: Sound is great. Very large fit..
review_text: Work fantasticly. Way to big..
Great for the price. I use these for an open office environment, so it’s never incredibly noisy, but the noise cancellation seems to work well.

review_title: Muy buenos pero tienen un detalle
review_text: Hay algo raro, cuando los audífonos están cargados al máximo y la cancelación de ruido está activa si se produce un sonido fuerte en el exterior los audífonos hacen como un "pop" muy molesto. Esto no pasa cuando la batería empieza a bajar.
Ordered these for my son. He loves them. They are comfortable, sound and noise cancellation are great. He hardly takes them off, much to my dismay when I try to communicate with him.

My girlfriend bought me a pair for Valentines Day and was so bummed I bought her a pair and we LOVE these head phones. Sound canceling is awesome, the base and overall comfort is AMAZING!! Would definitely recommend these to anyone. 1 drawback is the sound canceling acts up a little bit if say your driving on a bumpy surface then they do glitch a little bit but still would not let that disqualify the product.
Can still hear noise outside

review_title: Good for use in one location
review_text: For the price, the sound quality of these headphones is quite good. If you're just going to use them in one place, then they are probably a reasonable choice. Unfortunately, if you plan to travel with them they do not come with a hard case. For travel, the ear pieces fold up and they go into a soft bag. In my experience, they also turn themselves on while folded up in that bag. I use these headphones connected to either my computer or my smartphone. Making the initial connection is easy, however it seems to drop the connection randomly from both devices, even though the devices are within a few feet of each other and in line of sight. On the plus side the battery life seems good and so is the comfort level while wearing them.

review_title: Comfortable, Lightweight, Great Value -- and ANC!
review_text: This was a great value -- a wonderful price point, very lightweight and comfortable, great sound quality. I have wanted ANC earphones for years, and these fit the bill. I will post an update as I use them in more situations, try out the Bluetooth, and see how many hours I get on a charge. As it is, these were a great value that I am enjoying, and will get a lot of use out of them.

review_title: Great sound. Great Features. Great Price.
review_text: These headphones are fantastic for the price. Fit/Build: The fit on them is very comfortable. The ear muffs are super soft and you can wear for long stretches without discomfort. The build is great. They don't feel flimsy at all. They fold easily, the included carrying case has plenty of room for them to fit, and the drawstring makes sure they stay inside. The hinges seem durable as well. I take these everyday in a backpack and have not had any issues or concern. Battery Life/ Bluetooth: The battery is incredible. I listen to these at a high volume, i don't always have ANC on. After all that these lasted well over 30 hours. Typical of Anker and Soundcore they knocked it out of the park in this department. The connection is very strong and clear. I have walked through a room with them on and had no issues at all. Haven't had a dropped connection or anything like that. Sound: Let me start off by saying I am not an Audiophile. These sound exceptional at this price point. The BassUp technology is great if you want that bass bumping. With it off the bass is still very good. The highs come through very well, as long with vocals. The mids are very crisp and clear. The ANC works, when i first turned it on it was like being sucked out of the room. Obviously very loud noises can still be heard, but i definitely think the difference is very clear. Gaming: I originally bought these for gaming. This is my only complaint, and the only place these fall short. With that start the only problems i have had is when trying to use them wireless. When attached to my computer through the 3.mm aux cord the sound is amazing for gaming. If you try to use these wireless through bluetooth, the sounds and profiles are way off. I mainly play FPS. In these kind of games footsteps are important to hear, as well as gunshots. These both come through awful. The footsteps are really hard to hear, the gunshots sound muffled and you cant tell what direction they are coming from. The explosions and voice lines from characters are a little overbearing. I tried to install an Equalizer, i couldn't get the sounds to come through well. I just stuck with wired. Overall these are just fantastic headphones. I would rate them 9/10. I would recommend them to anyone.
Knowing that this is not comparable to high-end Bose headsets, it is surprisingly nice and fulfill the purpose. Everything is great except noice cancelling where it didn't meet the expectations.

review_title: Lived up to expectations and more
review_text: I bought this for traveling as I was looking for an option that wouldn't make me cry if it got broken, lost, or stolen. So I wasn't expecting a lot. Noise cancelling without music: constant low pitched noise, think air handlers and white noise makers, silenced. Vacuum sweeper significantly reduced. Voices, clapping, etc quieter but still there Noise cancelling with music - classical piano: white noise gone, vacuum just a hum, voices depend on the notes of the song Noise cancelling with music - rock and roll: white noise gone, vacuum just a hum, voices gone I did not have the volume high, I had it at comfortable listening, I did not have the bass boost on. I could still hear and appreciate the music and individual instruments. Would I recommend and or buy them again, yes.

Pros: - Comfort is great. You can actually keep these on your head for a couple oh hours, and not have any issues what so ever. - Absolutely great sound out of box especially when it's in Bluetooth Mode and BassUp turned on. Was blown away by deep bass on these cans. - Battery life is really good at around 30 hours which is great. - Can fold these headphones in a put in the supplied pouch for easy carrying. Cons: ANC doesn't deliver total immersion like they advertise. I would get a "flutter" with sound in and out on these headphones. Seal is tight on ears so that's not the issue. - Sound is muddy when in wired mode, and lack of bass is noticbly present. This might not apply to everyone, but it does raise an eyebrow for those like bass in headphones. Overall, a decwnt pair of headphones to use with music and call quality is decent as well, but your results may vary for phone model. For the bang for buck on Bluetooth quality on a budget, you can't go wrong on these set of cans!

I LOVE these! I had Beats and after 7 years they just quit so, after much research and deliberation I decided on Bang and Olufsen headphones. They cost $200 and they sucked. The volume was quite low even when turned to max. I returned those and bought these. I can hardly believe how good they sound and cancel noise. These are comfortable and sound incredible. Don't pay more for something that probably isn't worth the money.
Good sound quality. Only negative feedback is they fit a little loose.

These q20 soundcore life anc phones are way overrated - period. I compared them directly to my Tribit xfree tune Bluetooth headphones and the ankers lose in every category. The tribits were on sale for $26 when I bought them around Xmas and the Anker q20 phones were on sale for $40 earlier this month, so both bargain priced. The tribit xfree phones lack anc, so were a bit cheaper than the ankers from the start. First, the ankers are heavier and have all kinds of movement in the ear cups that I find prevents them from staying put on my head or fitting comfortably. The automatic noise canceling on the Anker q20 phones is garbage, literally doesn’t work at all, it actually mutes the bass somewhat, but doesn’t block outside noise at all. The bass up feature on the Anker phone is also terrible, it makes all types of music sound like a 17 year old punk’s car with the bass overwhelming and ruining the music. I left the anc and bass up off features off and the sound from the q20 phones is decent, but not as crisp and clean as it is on the cheaper tribits. The tribits are much lighter, fit more comfortably, and overall sound much more clear and balanced, with deep bass present but not overwhelming like the Anker q20 phones (even with the bass up feature off). Overall, I thought $40 was a great price for anc Bluetooth phones, but the ankers were an utter disappointment even on sale. They just don’t sound that good, bass up button is useless unless you want a headache and the anc button does nothing to block outside noises. Overall I would not recommend the ankers over other cheaper Bluetooth phones.
Very suprised With the excelent quality
Great battery life, incredible noise cancelling and great sound.

review_title: Does what its supposed to do for a reasonable price
review_text: Title says it all.
Muy buen artículo, excelente calidad de sonido y muy buen precio
It got amazing cushion and volume control and the noise cancelling it sounds so amazing even with bass!!! !
My wife loved them
Great value for the money.
Pleased with the order.

the noise cancelation is definitely audible, and the sound quality is ok. A little muddy, with lots of base. But for the price I paid ($40) it's a fantastic deal. The only question is whether saving my pennies for a nicer one would have been better in the long run. Note: says over ear but it's closer to on-ear for me.

review_title: Excellent sound at a bargain price
review_text: Comfortable, very good noise canceling properties though haven’t got use them on an airplane flight yet. Excellent sound for a bargain price. You can boost the bass if you like that booming but the normal is quite sufficient. Only issue I have is the controls for menu and volume. They are very close together and it’s easy to press the wrong button. Are you kidding $60 too good to be true but it IS! !
Poor noise cancelling but good sound quality.
Great headphones. Slight latency delay when watching videos, but nothing that is really much of an issue. Noise cancellation is pretty solid for being $60 dollars. Very happy with this purchase.
Perfect for the price

review_title: Great bargain dive into over ear noise canceling phones
review_text: Excellent headphones for the price, my only gripe is while the noise canceling is toggled on, if you we to take a hard step, jump, even move suddenly, a loud crack comes through the speakers. Issue doesn’t happen when noise canceling is off. You wouldn’t want to work out with them on as they do slip a bit on my head, but for what I use them for they are tremendous.

First off I really like Anker products. These headphones were awesome at first or so I thought. Pros: - The sound quality is great. - ANC is really good you can hear people but airplane and train is drastically reduced, best thing on this set in my opinion. - Battery life is very very good. - They are comfortable for long periods of time Cons: - This the killer and the sole reason for 2 stars. They cannot keep a stable connection, after 30 min of use you start to get garbled popping and static noises. Even after a phone reboot and headset power off and power on it still continues. At first I thought, maybe it was my phone but it's not, there's something about these that after 30 minutes or so they crap out and lose connection. - another thing that's bad as you can't use the ANC without connecting to Bluetooth it only works if it's a Bluetooth connection and not a wired connection. Maybe there's a way but it wasn't working for me. - bass booster is too much and overdoes it. I cannot recommend these, and I wish I could.

review_title: Works great for a low price
review_text: Got these at a big discount through Woot or a daily deal or something (can't remember). They worked extremely well on an airplane to cancel the engine noise. They work well for noise around the house, too. It does allow some voices through. Sound quality is pretty good. Not as good as my Bose over-ears, but those aren't noise canceling. Battery life is good. Happy with the purchase.
Great value headphone. Little disturbance when you use Bluetooth while walking or running. Rest all good.
Right ear speaker died after less than 2 months of use.

review_title: Good for music, noise canceling, comfort, but not calls
review_text: The unit provides clear sound and decent noise cancellation functionality. If you just leave the set on with just the noise canceling turned on, you will get an overall dampening of the surrounding noise, but it was not completely cancel it out. This is good in office environments where there is often a lot of ambient noise. In louder settings, like airplanes or traffic noise, a set amount of that still penetrates the headphones. If you turn on music, that tends to overpower whatever outside noise may come through. As for the quality of sound, it is best when the NC function is turned on. At this level, music is clear with a decent level of bass. The overall sound quality is equivalent to sets easily costing three times as much as these and you would need to try a $200+ model for better sound. Overall the headset is comfortable to wear for extended periods of times, but your ears can get warm after about 30-40 minutes. It also seems that if you have a smaller head, that these may be too large; so the model is not recommended for children because it will keep sliding on their head. The same may be said for some women. The only feature that does not seem to work well is the microphone. It does not matter if you use the unit wired or as Bluetooth, the microphone does not capture your voice well. I have tried it with my phone and with digital conference calls through the computer, and in both situations, users complained that they could not hear me well. This was even after trying to adjust the sensitivity levels to capture more sound. Thankfully, I do not plan on using this set for calls, just music and sound blocking.
A good buy
Use it when I am vacuuming, it really cuts down on the noise in the house and out in the shop.
Best wireless headphones I’ve had for the price!

I love the long battery life of these headphones. They are reasonably compact (for over the ear headphones) and the sound quality is good. Easy to pair, and they remember the paired devices better than others. A great value.
For the price, and even generally, these are fantastic. I love Anker.
Everything just fine
Excellent, especially for the price

For the price, these are fantastic headphones. I have no complaints about the sound quality. Has a very full range sound (without bass boost on), but the sound quality “dims” with abc on (which is when the bass boost helps). The headphones are comfortable, and I don’t mind wearing them for long periods of time (2+ hours). I even wear them with my glasses on with no discomfort. I have compared these in stores to the sony (some letters)900 model and the top end Bose headphones. I would say these are very comparable to the Sony’s on noise cancelling (eliminates low droning sounds, but let’s through voices), but the Bose are on another level (eliminates nearly everything). But, in my opinion the sound quality beats the Sony and matches the Bose. The fact that these $40-60 headphones even compare to these headphones that cost $100-$300 more shows what a ridiculous deal these are. I think my only knocks on these are that the headband sits a little wider than some more stylish headphones, and the use of micro usb instead of usb-c.

review_title: Good for the price, but annoying creak is very distracting
review_text: These are great for the price, but have a couple flaws that drive me crazy while I’m listening. Pros- noise canceling is impressive for a $50 headphone. Sound is pretty good (I’m no audiophile), not as good as the Audio Technica M40x’s these replaced, but I assumed that would be the case when moving to cheaper Bluetooth headphones. They’re very comfortable and I can wear them for hours without issue, though they do slide if I look down too far. The battery life is crazy. Took them on a week long trip and never had to charge them. Cons - maybe this is common with noise canceling headphones, but when listening to music the volume would go up and down during any loud song, enough to make it distracting. Turning on “Sound Check” in my iPhone settings fixed the issue, but I’d prefer to listen to the music as intended. The BIGGEST con though, is an extremely annoying, distracting creak on the left side. Especially when listening to podcasts or something quiet, it is very prominent. I think I will try some kind of dry lubricant such as graphite to see if it helps
Incredible product at an incredible price well worth it
fantastic

Really like the headphones. Sound quality is great especially for the price. Clear, good bass and strong Bluetooth connectivity. Had a problem with my first pair (left headphone would not work) but after some troubleshooting to no avail, Anker quickly sent me a replacement set. Simply amazing customer service. Will continue to be an Anker customer.
Excellent for the price

review_title: Noise cancelling off, and needs eq settings
review_text: Q20’s are well reasonable for their price Audio is not crystal clear but no noticeable static except on bass heavy songs but pretty good quality. Eq option could probably fix this though, if they added it. Sound is not as controlled as Sony but those are also higher priced. There’s a problem when Noise cancelling is on and you move really fast, theres a loud pop which is super annoying and audio becomes slightly muddy when NC is on, so you have to choose between clearer quality or noise canceling, but you can leave it off always because even though grip is not tight, it still blocks out most of the sound. I would prefer more anc so I will wait for thier next new version of their “space anc” or vortex which hopefully they fix the muddy and static on this when NC is on and fix the static bop noise when moving fast with NC on (such as turning head fast) . Also when laying on side with NC on, it thumps or purrs like a cat for some reason, it is built into it. It has 40 hour battery, so less worry about having to charge it, and it’s mostly on my head. I also like how it goes super low sound and still plays like background music with NC off. Lastly, good build quality, feels durable, a little plasticy and doesn’t feel premium but I’ll take that for better sound/durability in this Price range. I would prefer a lower price with no NC on this model (passive) so maybe q10s atm until the new model of space anc or vortex comes out which should be comparable to the taotronics bh055 based on my speculation even though I’ve never tried any those mentioned headphones here at the end

These headphones work great on my phone or even when connecting to my Macbook but I cannot get them to connect to my HP laptop without having some sort of radio station feedback in the background and they don’t even play audio from my HP computer when hooked up to the audio cord. Another issue I have is that when you lean on them or put slight pressure on the sides they have a weird pulsing sound that is kind of annoying but other than that they’re pretty good headphones for the price and the battery lasts a while too
Sound great for price NC is good. Charging is a little wonky with some usb cables

review_title: Excellent noise cancellation and sound quality
review_text: I use this product for listening to soccer matches and basketball games on our TV. It certainly has great noise cancellation and sound quality. Another big plus for the product is that it is so affordable.

review_title: A new flight necessity. Great value.
review_text: Bought a pair of these for our long flights after growing tired of noisy EarPods and plug ins that I had to stick into my ear. I will never go back! First, these are very comfortable over the ear. Second, turning the noise canceling on makes you realize just how loud an airplane is (very). Finally, the battery on these lasted for a very long time (made it through 13 hours of flights). I have no idea what the Bose or Sony version are like for an extra $200-300 but I have a hard time believing they are noticeably better for a non-audiophile. These are a great value and my gf thought they looked good on us. So there’s that too.
Great price, comfortable, good noise cancellation and good sound. While wireless bluetooth is fine, also nice to be able to plug in the aux connection.
Great sound and noise cancellation at an affordable price. Ear pads get a little warm in the gym, but not unbearable.

review_title: Not high end or the best sound but Great headphones for the price. highly recommended
review_text: Great headphones for the price. I mainly use them at work to listen to music and podcasts and i love them. Sound quality is pretty good considering the price. They won’t beat some more expensive sennheisers or similar headphones but are perfect for around the house, around the office, or just out and about. I’d highly recommend them.

review_title: Amazing sound, better than you think noise cancelation. Very comfortable
review_text: Sound quality is amazing

I use this at the gym to filter out obnoxious music and this headset is very effective. I also is use them wired to my home computer listening to music and attending Skype meetings. All around good value.

review_title: Very impressed for what you pay for...
review_text: I'm very impressed with these headphones. To be clear, I'm not an audiophile by any stretch of the imagination. That being said, for a non-audiophile, the sound is good and the ANC (Active Noise Cancellation) is great for this price point. The build quality isn't as great as any premium headphones at 3-4 times the price, but for what it does it does, it does well and makes you wonder if a premium is necessary in all . If I were to every compare it to premium brands (as noted by many) it's more on line with the Beats and Bose that cater to heavier base spectrum. That being said, most of music and podcasts sound fantastic. The only issue I have is how it interacts with my Mac as the controls don't control the sound, ffwd, rwd, as expected. They work, but not predictable. It seems to work fine with iPhone and iPad, but took some to get used to it's limitations. Overall, I've paid more for less with other products. As noted by many other reviewers, these do get hot, but it is nothing that I'm uncomfortable with. This is a good alternative to premium headphones on the market, especially if you're looking for something that works well, sounds good, and has a decent build quality. I would recommend.
Awesome quality for the price !! !

review_title: All spec qlready mentioned by the seller
review_text: Nice headphone for its price
Amazing for the price!
Sound is good. Built quality is also not bat at all. I love it. Connects easily and has about 30feet connections before it starts distortion.

review_title: Watching TV surround sound for one!
review_text: Great sound, great price. I use this for my audio TV connected by using a Bluetooth receiver.

I bought this headset for traveling overseas. They are very comfortable and can be worn for a long period of time. I am no audiophile but it does what I need for it to do. The noise cancellation really works....makes me forget the world next to me! And as for the long long battery life....what can I say about it? You can go around the world and back and not have to worry about charging it!

These headphones are great for this price range. I bought three sets for myself and my kids for Christmas. The sound quality is really good. I use my headphones in the office and the noise canceling is great in eliminating the small background noise like HVAC hum and simple office noises (Keyboard clicking, etc.). Doesn't totalling eliminate the sound of your coworkers talking, but it dulls it down. Battery life is fantastic, I charge them once every two weeks and I use them 2-3 hours a day listening to podcast as I work. The frame is a solid construction and the ear cushion is comfortable. My only complaint is that you have to sync it to bluetooth every time you use it. My other headphones all link up the moment you turn them on, these do not.

Love the sound quality. Good noise cancellation. Even if noise cancellation is turned off it is still able to block some of the sounds. Delivery service is excellent - arrived 1 week ahead of schedule (Shipped from Charlotte, NC, US delivered to Perak Malaysia)
High quality, esp for the price. Noise cancellation is great along with sound quality.

review_title: Buy these headphone; worth every penny
review_text: Very nice headphones. Very light and comfortable. Great sound and good noise cancellation. What a great deal for the price! Buy these!
5 stars across the board.

Got these a few weeks ago and can't rave enough about them. They're extremely comfortable to wear, both at work and at the gym. I listen to music for roughly 5 hours a day at work and these are able to last the entire week on a single charge. The audio quality isn't the best I've heard but it's certainly up there with the more high-end headphones I've used and are easily the best ones I've heard under $100. The noise cancelling is top notch as well; I've become reliant on it at work to stay focused. Highly recommend this product for anyone looking for a starter set of good headphones.
Excellent product for the price oh so nice.

I'm not an audiophile so I really don't need $400 headphones. These are well made, excellent sound, well featured headphones that definitely meet my needs to listen to TV and music without disturbing my wife.

review_title: Great headphones for a extremely large head, but not so much for big ears as well.
review_text: These sound on par or even greater than the Senheisser HD 4.40BT (reference, these anker cans were about $45, the senheissers were around $100). Everything Ive listened to sounds amazing. The earpads feel great and actually cover my entire ear unlike the 4.40s. Unlike the 4.40s, these visibly drain battery overtime within a day of usage. The 4.40s last weeks over weeks, maybe even months without charging in my experience while these already drained about 10% in the last hour, which is not a good sign. However, it suffers from “on ear” syndrome like the 4.40s. Despite being termed as “over ear”, it feels like they are also on ear. The ear pads itself definitely cover up both of my ears nicely, but my large ears touch the inside of the cups which is not a big problem in itself since the pads make it extremely comfortable as a compensation but if it was like the 4.40s (those ear pads are atrocious...and i tried replacing them, but replacement ear pads are beyond difficult to put on you might as well get these or different headphones. Dont recommend 4.40s for anything except sound and battery life because it lasted weeks over weeks without charging whatsoever).

review_title: Best ANC Headphones for the Money
review_text: These are headphones are amazing for the money. Both these and the TaoTronics TT-BH085 went on sale right around the same time. And despite being slightly less expensive, the Anker Q20 blows the TaoTronics out of the water. The hybrid noise cancellation is better than the TaoTronics noise cancellation, the Q20 is HiRes audio certified, and the build quality is much better. The ear cups on the TaoTronics came wrinkled and were slightly uncomfortable to wear as a result. I will say the bassup is a bit of a gimmick, and the hybrid noise cancellation, when on, emit a bit of white noise. On an airplane, however, I'm willing to bet these will shine. Anker, once again, has exceeded my expectations.

review_title: Falta control para adelantar atrasar canciones
review_text: Es una lástima que no tengan un dial para adelantar o atrasar canciones

While the noise cancellation is helpful, it is understandably not on the level of high quality noise-cancelling headphones. The sound quality is fine as long as the "Bass Up" feature is not engaged. When it is engaged, the bass notes that are "up" overload the headphones and create a loud, crackling noise, nullifying the value of the feature. This behavior is worsened the higher the volume is. The headphones don't get very loud. I don't know if this is common among these types of headphones or not, but I was disappointed with the lack of power. If these problems were fixed, I'd say that for $59.99, these headphones are a good deal, but with these problems present, the low price is not worth the lack of quality in this product. I'd steer away from these and spend the extra money on some quality headphones.

review_title: Great quality and performance for the money!
review_text: Excellent sound for the money. Would buy again if I needed a second set
Good value. Only wish it had USB C. I also own the q10.

review_title: Pretty nice headphones for a really nice price
review_text: I bought these on a whim because I wanted to be able to listen to my stereo and play guitar without bothering my downstairs neighbor, and I'm really glad I did. While I haven't yet figured out how to play from my receiver to these headphones, I use them with my phone and they've performed well beyond my expectations. As a real world example of how well these work, I'm sitting at my home office desk which is well within earshot of both my dishwasher and washing machine, both of which are running as I write this. I'm listening to my phone and I can't hear either of those two appliances with the headphones on, but when I pull them away from my ears I can hear both roaring away. Oddly, I'm not even 100% sure I was aware of the fact that these were noise canceling headphones when I bought them; I just really like Anker products (as I look at three pairs of Anker Soundbuds Slim+ and an Anker Soundcore 2 speaker sitting on my desk in front of me) and for the price I figured I'd pick up a pair of these, too. For what it's worth I got these when they went on sale, but even for $60 I guarantee these are worth the money. Now if I can figure out how to broadcast sound from my home theater receiver to these things then in addition to being happy myself I know my downstairs neighbor will be REALLY happy too. UDPATE: Okay, after living with these headphones for a few weeks now I've got to do a quick follow-up to my initial review to explain a shortcoming I've noticed in the interim, which has reduced my rating from the initial "oh these are awesome" 5-star rating to a more reasonable "these are okay" 3-star rating. Basically, they seem to make a pulsating type of low-pitched thumping noise while trying to cancel certain types of noise. It's not exactly loud per se, but it's definitely noticeable and annoying. I typically put these on when I'm running the dishwasher while working from home, and it gets to the point where I'd rather hear the dishwasher than the thumping noise. I also noticed a pretty noticeable lag when I tried to play guitar on Rocksmith 2014 through my PS4, into my receiver, then out to these using a Bluetooth transmitter, but in all fairness it's hard to know exactly where to place the blame for the lag because there are so many pieces of electronic equipment between the source and my ears in this setup. SECOND UPDATE: As of today, 3/17/20, I'm doing one final revision to my review based on Anker's tenacious approach to customer service. They noticed that I reduced my original rating from five to three start and have since sent me no fewer than three emails offering to do everything from send me a new pair of headphones to allowing me to exchange these headphones for another of their products. While I'm not taking them up on their offer if for no other reason than I'm satisfied with the headphones for the price I paid, their active engagement with me post-sale does say a lot about why I'm so loyal to this brand. By and large they make good products at a great price, and when a customer indicates otherwise they try hard to rectify the issue.

I'll keep this short and simple. These are great. Years ago I received, for free, a pair of Beats Studio Wireless headphones. Flash forward to now, and I am so happy to replace those beats with these Q20s. I was lucky with the beats in that I didn't have to pay for them, but I always realized if I had, I would have regretted that purchase. I never felt they were worth the price. I never felt the sound quality delivered. It's a new era though, and I needed some new headphones. I really like these. I like the price especially. They aren't the best headphones I've ever slapped onto my head, but at this price point I think they're a great deal, worthy of a 5 star review. These will eventually break. they'll degrade. The plastic will crack. I mean, it's the way it goes. The sound quality, the nose reduction, the battery life, and the price. Those aspects all make it worth it though, and when it comes time to replace them, the price point is much more easy to digest. I use my headphones a lot. Every day. And they come off my head, go back on, tons. So they get a lot of use, a lot of stress. I've been frustrated in the past at paying some of the higher price points for headphones, when they break often enough to annoy me when it comes time to foot the bill to replace them. I was spoiled by the quality of sound though. With those Beats, it broke me. I look at what they charge, and what you get. And no. Just... do yourself a favor and shun over priced garbage like that and pick yourself up some of these. If you can afford crappy 300 dollar headphones, then you can afford to try these first.
You can spend much more for high end noise canceling earphones or cool looking pods...but for a lot less, the price is right and the performance is perfect for these.
Works well. Great price.

review_title: Excellent value for the money, just a couple small areas for improvement
review_text: If you are sitting quietly while you use these headphones, they are very good. I'm pleased with them when working at my desk. But if you are moving around much e.g. walking, they make a mechanical noise as they twist slightly- apparently due to the flexing between the headband and the ear pieces as your body moves. Also, it doesn't take too much creativity to figure out a better way to design the controls on the right ear piece. Of course you can't see the controls while you are wearing the headphones - they are behind your right ear. It would have been better to design them so it is easier to feel which control is which. But these are small complaints. I would gladly buy them again.
Sometimes there is “static feedback” if tou touch top. Not always, but sometimes if top if headset is touched/bumped very loud pop and crackly soud
Noise cancellation was fantastic

Only thing I don't like is that when the noise canceling is on and there is a change in pressure such as a door slamming they have a bit of trouble with that and make an unpleasant sound while trying to counter it. Battery life is good.
The noise cancellation and sound quality are great for the price!! I could use a little more volume however.

review_title: Fantastic cans ... as long as the size is ok
review_text: Great, great sound. I’ve had the latest Bose & Sony headphones. These are right there w them. Their noise cancellation might be slightly better ... but barely. Oh ... and their $50! The one caveat: these fit much looser than either the Bose or Sony. I’m a large male so these are perfect for me as the other two brands always felt like they were squeezing my head. BUT if you’ve got a smaller head or you want to wear these while aggressively exercising they won’t be snug enough.

review_title: Competitively priced & well-built ANC headphones with some frustrating usability flaws
review_text: FRUSTRATING - It forgets that you have turned on ANC once you power it off, so have fun pressing & holding that ANC button for 2 seconds each time after you turn it on - Quickly press & release the power button to turn on, but you need to perform an infuriating 4-5 seconds press & hold to turn it off BAD - The maximum volume level is soft, where 100% sounds like 70% of other headphones so it doesn't do well with softer videos - Working multipoint feature: Connects to 2 devices at the same time and plays from 1 device at a time, but it stupidly tries to reconnect to 2nd connected device (which you may have turned off already) and not the last device you used it with (the 1st connected device) - There's a Bluetooth signal pop/dropout once every hour or so of listening - Bad marketing attempt: "Hi-res audio" badge means nothing, especially when it doesn't support Sony's high-res LDAC Bluetooth audio CODEC ACCEPTABLE - ANC is about 70% of market leaders like the Sony 1000X series, which is quite acceptable for the price - The sound signature is decent and tends towards the bassy side, but the highs are present yet they do not sparkle with detail like better headphones do - The sound signature changes quite a bit and becomes recessed once ANC is turned on, though it is still fairly listenable in noisier environments GOOD - Battery life is stellar - Build quality and comfort is great - Button layout and playback control scheme is good - AAC codec support for good quality sound on iOS devices, and newer Android devices
The best thing in this headphone is battery life Sound quality very nice for the price range Noise cancelling not really good

review_title: The way to go when it’s your first go with wireless
review_text: I Bought these for my dad. I helped him set them up and initially I was impressed with what they were able to do and how much they cost. The bass boost was a nice touch and helped even more with the noise cancellation. He loves them and uses them often. Battery life is also quite good.
nice fit over the ears roomates complain that the noise cancellation is to good, have to flash my lights to get my attention
Excellent sound and quality.

Got these because Wirecutter recommended them as a budget pick. They're just meh. The sound quality and noise cancelling is fine. Noise cancelling is actually quite good EXCEPT when you are walking. There must be a loose connection or something in these headphones, because if you try to walk while listening to something with noise cancelling on, they randomly pop or crackle SUPER loud in your ear. Not ideal. If you are just going to listen to them while sitting still, they're perfectly adequate as a budget pick.

So easy to block out the world around you! I use them at work and the noise cancelling is so good that I sometimes don’t hear my phone ring (sorry boss)! But if I turn the volume down, I can hear the phone ringing with the ring volume increased a little. I’ve recommended to many others because they’re also so comfortable!
Love it!!! Great value

EDIT: First pair of these had an issue where jarring or bumping these resulted in a loud static pop. Anker customer service contacted me and replaced them. The new pair does not have the issue. I've never had modern ANC headphones before and it's quite a stunning effect. Sound quality for music is great (although I'm not an audiophile). Comfort is reasonable. I do have some ear pain after wearing them for extended periods but I've had this with other can-style headphones as well.

A little on the quite side but it's okay. When you get into what you are doing you just here the crisp sound. I love the sound core tuning it is a lot like akg but there suttle differences and I like that. If you are on a budget I highly recommend

After going through many MANY pairs of budget ANC headphones. I can say these are my favorites. The sound quality and comfort are above anything in this price range. For reference, my sound preference is balanced with a slight bump in bass.
These are great for sitting in a chair for five hours, three times a week. DaveHW
Great over the ear comfort and sound quality. Noise cancelling works a bit, has made plane travel more bearable.

review_title: Mic and Sound Quality are garbage and extremely muffled.
review_text: Whenever the mic is in use or being listened to by a program, the audio quality instantly goes to trash and sounds incredibly muffled and echo-y. The microphone is absolute trash and no one can understand what I'm saying. This has been consistent between the BT receiver on my desktop, my laptop's build in BT, and 2 phones. Very disappointing as I've always liked Anker products. But this is pretty bad and unusable.

review_title: Great sound at a great price
review_text: For the price these are hard to beat. The noise cancellation works well but is somewhat lacking if compared to higher priced brands. These were comfortable enough to wear on long flights and sleep while wearing.
Great noise cancelling feature. Comfortable too wear. I use them at work to block the chatter. Sometimes I wear them without sound and just let the noise cancelling do it's work.

review_title: Cheap build but great features and anc
review_text: Overall I'm very happy with these headphones. They are definitely cheap build, but have good sound, long battery life, and the ANC is great. I have the wired Bose QC25 for comparison, and the ANC isn't quite as strong, but it's still very good. I was able to listen to a podcast while mowing without any issues, for example. Let a friend try them as well, and he bought a pair too.

These headphones are amazing! Not just for the price just a great product period. Really clean audio and the noise canceling is night and day. It's already quiet but then you turn them on and it's next level cancellation. My only gripe is these aren't the best for working out. If you do any jumping, or running, the headphones make a popping sound. Still, not much of a problem because it goes away eventually and the popping sound isn't too obnoxious. That was just my fault for not fully researching.

review_title: No chinese children made this? Then it’s the best...
review_text: If this product is made without a child involved from china then it’s probably the best noise cancelling headphones in the market for the price
first pair of headsets I've ever had but won't fly without them again
I love these headphones. I have very very loud nieces and nephews and these kept me sane.

Although the sound quality seems to be good on these, the noise cancellation is much less than I thought it would be. I tried this on a lawn mower and using a blower, both of which the noise cancellation did not work well to counteract. The cushions that go over your ears are also hot and become uncomfortable, and I used these in the winter outside. The volume buttons are hard to use as you have to press down for a longer and if not long enough, the button skips to the previous or next song, as these are dual purpose buttons.
Purchased two pairs for me and my wife to use on a recent flight and we will never fly without them!
Buenos por el precio

review_title: Great price but not the greatest quality
review_text: I love these headphones for my commute to work and studying but when I jog with them and have the noise canceling feature turned on they crack like a scratched cd. It hurts my ears so I don’t really use noise canceling unless I’m sitting on the bus. Even heavy steps or trips make this uncomfortable sound happen.
Just got them, but they sound so nice.
Great headphones and noise canceling. Exactly what we wanted for great price
headset is great for in home or travel.

review_title: Quality Sound at a Reasonable Price
review_text: A good, reasonably priced set of headphones that will change your air-travel life.

My first set of soundcore q20 headphones I got were defective and would disconnect randomly from my phone. Contacted customer support and they were very helpful with getting my product returned and a new one sent out. I received my new set today and they are good to go with no issues! !
Love this product so far. Have had it since Sept ‘19. Long battery life and really durable.

review_title: They noise-cancel well for price, but I think mine are defective
review_text: These are really great for the price. I can tell a difference when noise cancelling is enabled and when it isn't, though I've used more expensive models with better noise cancelling. The problem with these for me is that when I walk up steps or even take a step off the sidewalk they make a terrible popping sound. Like a loud pop and crackle. These are likely just defective and it may not be the case with non-faulty headphones.

review_title: Not Bose quality..but much better than expected!
review_text: This is an inexpensive noise cancelling headphone. My daughter owns a pair of Bose QC25 active noise cancelling headphones. These come surprisingly close, but definitely are not Bose quality. If you think a pair of $75.00 or less headphones are remotely going to compare to ones $300+ well, it's not going to happen. But these are surprisingly comfortable, and the noise cancellation works much better than expected for a very inexpensive set of headphones. Sound quality is also pretty darn good for what you pay for. If you buy these because you want a cheap version of high dollar equipment, don't. If you go for these as something to tide you over until you can buy the big ones, knowing these won't come close, you will be pleasantly surprised. Also, the manufacturer has awesome customer service!
Try these once, they have good sound quality for the price. Comfortable, noise cancellation is ok.

review_title: Excellent sound quality and ANC for great price
review_text: The sound quality is superb, best I have heard in budget. ANC is very comparable to Bose or Sony. My only issue is compatibility with MacBook.

review_title: The Absolute Best Customer Service!!! Headphones OK for Price.
review_text: I received these as a gift in 11/2019. I wasn't overwhelmed by noise cancellation -- it didn't help me a lot during air travel, and would never have stood up to waiting for a train on a noisy platform. Still, the balance in the sound was pretty good, and use them for walks and for listening to my own audio to tune out whatever chaos is going on at home! The battery holds a charge for quite a while, but I did reach a point where it was not charging anymore. Customer Service was a breeze. I was offered trouble-shooting ideas, and when they did not work, once I was able to send a copy of the invoice, I had a new pair of headphones, almost immediately. Thank you Shane! The only thing I would like to add is that they are a bit large for my head, which isn't really small at all. I hope that in the future Anker will consider making the smallest setting a little smaller. I always feel good about Anker, because I know from others that they really go out of their way to be pleasant and helpful, both on the phone and via email. And now I know from my own experience.

I needed some decent over the ear headphones for the gym after struggling with terrible in ear ones. These things are great for the price! I wish they were a tad bit tighter, but everything else is good. Sound is pretty good, battery life is decent and they are comfortable. Noise cancelling isn't mind blowing, but for the price these things are brilliant. I use at the gym, so they mostly block out the annoying music and grunters. Super happy with them!

These headphones houldn't even be called "noise cancelling" because they barely cancel anything! Without the noise cancelling on they let so much noise in it's like having them off. Turning the noise cancelling on is like having normal decent quality non noise cancelling headphones on.

I love Anker but ultimately both pairs I received frequently disconnects or partially disconnects from my laptop. This is the only Bluetooth headphone I have that does this, and if you search 'disconnect' in the reviews vs. competitors, you will see that the Q20 has issues. If you don't mind your headphone disconnecting in the middle of conference calls or watching videos, read on. I have the Q20, TT-BH085, and $300 Sony WH-1000XM2. Obviously the Sonys are the best hands down. Noise canceling: If the Sony is a 10, Q20 is a 8, and BH085 is a 4. Pretty amazing value. The Q20 has a low hiss while the BH085 has a high pitched hiss. Comfort: The Q20 has bigger and more comfortable ear cups than the BH085, but the Sony's you don't sweat as much and the cups are way softer. The Q20 is made for bigger heads and the BH085 is not. Sound quality: Sony > Anker > TT. Overall I prefer the Anker over the TT but unfortunately it disconnects a lot. The Sonys are too nice to leave at work.

review_title: Do not buy these is ANC is your priority
review_text: Decent headphones, as are most of my Soundcore headphones, buy my goodness that popping sound with ANC on is ear drum shattering. I bought mostly for the ANC so these will be going back.
Absolutely love these headphones so far...but only have been using 2 days. If anything changes, I’ll update.
Was taking a 16 hour plane trip. These guys saved my sanity. Quiet comfortable easy to use easy to listen to

review_title: Good product for a good price
review_text: This is my first time trying noise-canceling headphones, so I can't compare to more expensive ones, but these do the job for me! They allow me to focus in an otherwise noisy office. I didn't even realize there was a steady hum around me until I took these off! Very comfortable. Would recommend.

Very comfortable. Worn them for a few hours and still wasn't uncomfortable or too warm. The sound is great, bass is surprisingly good. It doesn't have the punch of high end headphones that make you REALLY feel it, but it's definitely not weak. On par with the price
I find the controls difficult to use. The buttons are slightly recessed.

These sound great and do a good job of blocking out noise. They are super comfortable. I had an issue with my first pair, contacted Anker for warranty support and they were absolutely amazing, replace the pair with no questions asked and quickly got another set of headphone into my hands. Top notch customer service.

review_title: Outstanding noise cancelling headphones in a quality build
review_text: Active noise cancelling worked great on a noisy airplane. Volume is easy to adjust the battery life is great. Headphones are very comfortable and I'd recommend them to anyone

review_title: Great headphones for the price, great customer service
review_text: Ordered these as a gift for my spouse--they worked great with good sound quality, and pretty good battery life. The noise cancellation is inferior to Bose, etc., but for the price they are excellent. The first pair stopped working after about a month (wouldn't charge)--BUT the seller was immediately responsive and sent us another pair, which work well. I appreciate the speedy and thoughtful customer service.
The last time I flew I was a row in front of the engine, WOW you would never have known

review_title: Great sound, but too tight on the head
review_text: These headphones sound great, but are WAY TOO TIGHT. Not to mention, they make my head sweat after ten minutes of wearing. I don’t like the fit and I’d like to return them. Again: great sound, fit is terrible

review_title: Excellent value in noise cancelling headphones
review_text: I bought a pair of Soundcore Life Q20's since I work in an extremely noisy test lab full of high-performance computer servers with roaring fans. I considered spending the $300+ for top-of-the-line NC headphones from Sony or Bose to protect my hearing. Before I did that, though, I decided that these $50 (with $10 off coupon) headphones were worth a shot. I already had a pair of Sony XBR950N1's and they worked ok to blunt the fan roar, but the NC always annoyed me because it produced an audible hiss when enabled. I'm glad I gave the Q20's a shot. I'm sure that they can't compete with the top-line models from Sony and Bose, but they are a tiny fraction of the price. They compare very favorably with my XBR950N1's, which cost over $200 when new. The NC on the Q20's is definitely better than my old Sony's, without the nasty hiss, but still quite effective in a very challenging server fan noise environment. I would say that my Sony's are maybe _slightly_ better at reproducing music, as the Q20's are a bit too bassy (even with the bass boost turned off....with the bass boost on they sound ridiculous in most cases). I haven't noticed any "ear suck" with the Q20's, either. Plus, they are pretty light and comfortable. These are definitely a great value at $50, or even the $60 regular price.

These headphones are an outstanding value. While they're certainly not audiophile approved, when paired with an EQ they provide pretty damn good sound. Out of the box, the bass is too punchy and artificial, but a simple EQ app dials everything in quite nicely. The NC works very well for low frequencies and provides for a good soundstage in loud environments (airplane, coffee shop). If you're looking for a truly immersive musical experience go ahead and spend $300+ on a pair of headphones. But, if you're a casual or on-the-go listener that still wants some of the features of a high end set at a reasonable price, you can't beat these.

[UPDATE 1 ] after contacting the customer support , they were very supportive and decided to fully refund as i live outside USA and it's hard and costly to re send it to get the replacement , much appreciated gesture from ANKER , will never forget it . thank you ! -------------------------------------------------------- i was so excited to receive this headphones , but unfortunately it was already defecte , it didn't charge at all , i tried too many diffrente chargers and cables , all the same results . the warranty is a replacment , but i couldn't do that since i dont live in USA and it will be costly to resend it . it's a nice headphones .
Very good for the price.

review_title: Anker made it right! Updated review. I will be using these daily!
review_text: These are not bad for the price but the pair that I received was terribly low in sound. Almost to the point that I thought something had to be wrong with them. I know a popular complaint was that they did not get very loud but I dont think I have ever worn a pair of headphones that even at max volume were so low. I tried adjusting the EQ settings and nothing helped. They are going back Update:Tuesday 03/03/2020 So Anker reached out to me and informed me that they corrected the volume problem that the headphones had and they sent me a new updated pair....and the results are night and day! They get plenty loud, the bass hits nice a deep, highs are crisp and clear, mids are excellent and clear, great depth of sound as well. Its GREAT listening experience. With the volume all the way up it actually tickles my ears and they actually get just a hair too loud to listen to at full blast with most music so I actually have to listen to them a few notches below full volume ! The ANC works really well and I couldnt be happier! This new updated model I think punch way wayyyyyy above their weight class at the price point! I am not sure if this new model is the model that will be sent out from now on but if they are THERES NO REASON WHATSOVER NOT TO GET THEM!

Great price point with excellent sound. I was sceptical for sure especially coming from Beats. It came packaged nicely and it was ready to go out of the box. The battery last a really long time and it easily connects to Bluetooth. Truly lives up the biggest bang for your buck.

I was not expecting much from such a low priced item and I was really impressed by the noise blocking. Not perfect, but the sound is excellent and when you factor in the price this is a great buy for all but the snobbiest audiophile.

review_title: Very Fragile for even day to day use
review_text: I really wanted to like this product. However, my neck just broke it. Its is WAY TOO FRAGILE to be used even for day to day purpose. I don't recommend this product at all.
I have bought many pairs of cheap headphones. These are not cheap headphones and you can tell. Sounds is crisp. Battery stays charged. Very happy.
Long-lasting battery. Comfortable to wear. Excellent product. Fits OVER the ear...just as wanted.
Noise cancellation was not as good as I expected, sound quality is great, charge time is good.

From the opening of the package everything was very well organized had a good feeling UNTIL there was an indication that this was a REFURBISHED item, because a sticker of some sort was peeled off and it can make you wonder. I paid $60 and the REFURBISHED headsets are $50 I'll wait a few days to see if I SHOULD ASK FOR MY $10. As of now the headphones are working and sounding very very good the canceling out noise, the length of the connection is awesome very comfortable over 2hrs and counting and the battery life 2hrs and at 80%.
I bought this as a gift, so I don't know too much about it.

This unit performs well under the harshest conditions (airplane). The sound is terrific and the noise-canceling ability isn't quite that of a pair of Bose, but very good, especially for the price. The earpieces are extremely comfortable and are unnoticeable even after a three-hour flight. Bluetooth set up is almost automatic - very simple. A good, value purchase. Highly recommend.
Excelente a mi esposo le encantó, hermoso regalo de cumpleaños para él
Works great. Fits over my ears perfectly.

I like it too much. I never bought any headphones like this. I did buy this for Walking or Running. I took almost 1 month to figure out which brand is good for me. I did not want to spend much money for it. Finally I found Anker Soundcore life Q20. I did compare it's specifications with all other brands. I really impressed to see Design, Sound quality, comfortableness, handling, etc. Great product.... I would like to thanks to Anker team who made this product with compare of top brands even at reasonable price..... Keep it up......

This was purchased as a gift for someone else. He says it doesn't block all the noises, but he is quite happy with it, especially the Bluetooth feature that lets him listen to whatever he's watching on his computer.
Best Bluetooth headphones I ever got as a gift
Great set of headphones for the price. Music and audiobooks sound great. The noise cancelling is a little lacking but for the price they are great.

In my experience, all Anker products are well made and of good quality. I ordered these headphones because I had previously bought ones from another company that weren't as great as promoted. Anker had the price I was willing to pay, and I trusted my experience with them. They work well.

I consider myself to be a brand name and differentiator in terms of buying products. As a college student, I wanted to buy bose or sony headphones for my travels but the $300 price tag wasn't pretty. I came across these and I found the amazing reviews and I felt confident in these. The sound quality, the noise cancellation, volume control, build quality, and packaging was pretty great. Obviously a budget headphone but honestly, these check off all the boxes for me and blew me away with the quality. Love these headphones.

I needed something to give me sound privacy, a way to block off surrounding noises, and this does the trick. It is affordable, well designed, and easy to use. I put the headset on and ambient sounds seem small and distant, not entirely blocked but easy to ignore. The bluetooth feature for music and movies works just fine. This will be a life-saver for me when it comes to peace of mind. The packaging alone, BTW, is elegant. Am an Anker fan. I give this five stars because it delivers on its promise.
Excelente sonido!
very good headphones. ANC alsi works good. very satisfied with purchase
Worked as advertised

Very comfortable headset. I use it at work where it drowns out the mechanical and pink noise (people talking sounds like they are whispering). It also did a good job of cancelling out jet noise on my last trip where I listed to an audio book the whole flight and it lasted my entire weekend trip without needing to recharge. I'm not an audiophile so I don't feel I can speak to sound quality but it is much better than earbuds and more than satisfied my office and travel needs.

I like these a lot. These are my first noise cancelling headphones, and I attest they cancel out sounds. I listened to a webcast at a noisy Starbucks today with noise cancelling on and off, and the "on" certainly did block out much noise. I gave them five stars given the price-to-value ratio, though only four stars for sound quality. I found them--perhaps differently than many on this board--with too much bass even on the normal setting. That said, I was able to adjust them to my liking using the equalizer function built into to Spotify. But unless you have an equalizer function, you are limited to their normal and high bass settings. A great value though and would recommend, cautioning I have not tried other headphones. Good luck!

Product arrived well, battery does last long yet whos knows within a couple uses/charges. Sound is okay yet once loud it distorts. Im really not happy with this product or their charger but their power banks are great!

Great product. I perpetually lose my earplug style phones and I don’t lose these! Good News is that they’re pretty comfortable, long battery life and a good mic. The only drawback is that they’re not really noise cancelling for the other person on the line but do drown out background noise well
This is a good product. The sound quality Is a little bassy for my taste, but for the price, it is a great deal.

review_title: Better than the famous Cowin E7
review_text: I used a Cowin E7 at least twice a week for almost two years. My job requires frequent air travel (in the back of the plane where it's loud, not up front with the Diamond-Plus-Medallion people). I bought the Ankers to replace the E7s when they broke at the point that allows them to pivot to fit my head. The Ankers have better noise cancelling capabilities. I think they do a better job of passive noise cancellation and active noise cancellation as I can turn the active part off and on with a button. The Cowin E7s changed how they sounded when you activated the noise cancellation, the Ankers hardly (if at all) change. Also, while both are comfortable, the Ankers feel lighter on my head due to the softer padding.
Perfect sound, outstanding nose canceling function. Very comfortable.

Mine wouldn't charge after my first 2 trips. I called Ankor using the customer service card in the box and after a couple of simple questions Nicole assured me a new pair would be delivered in 5 days no charge or shipping. I am impressed and satisfied to say the least. A great product especially for the price and great customer service.

review_title: Best wireless ANC headphones for the money
review_text: I've been using these the last few weeks while traveling for work. They sound amazing with ANC turned off. With ANC turned on they sound slightly worse but still really good. There's an audible white noise with ANC on but you can only hear it when no music is playing. ANC works well but not as good as Bose or Sony. The Bass Up feature provides a crazy amount of bass. I love bass but can't listen to music with this enabled for very long. The headphones have plenty of bass with the feature disabled. I compared these to the TaoTronics SoundSurge 85 and the Anker sound way better. I returned the TaoTronics. I wish these had USB type C and they would be perfect. For Bluetooth ANC headphones these are the best you can get for the money.

After seeing these at Costco I looked them up here on Amazon and they came with a discount, so they were less than Costco's price. I bought these with some skepticism, but for ~$50 I was willing to give them a try. When I first turned them on I was surprised at how great they sound. I only listened to them for a few minutes and then charged them fully. I took them to work and use them on the treadmill during my breaks. I listen to them for over an hour a day, it's been about two weeks and I haven't charged them again. I let a colleague listen to them and he bought a pair. I bought another pair for my wife.
