I just don't have anything bad to say about these. If you are trying to decide on a great BT headphone, these are your last stop.

review_title: Annoying ticking sound when noise cancelling is on
review_text: There is a very irritating ticking sound when the otherwise decent noise cancelling is on. Any time I move my head there is thus tick tick tick tick. It’s not super loud but audible and annoying. The loud pop when you take them off as described by others is also a ‘feature’ I can attest too. Can live with the flaws I guess because the price is right and sound quality is good.

review_title: Best value for your money in noise cancelling headphones
review_text: These are very comfortable and do a good job at blocking out most noise. I had bought a pair of Sony NC headphones for $150 on sale and I was not happy with their overall sound, so I returned them. These have much better sound quality. Amazing battery life.

These headphones are amazing. I would have never expected such a high quality material and sound from a $50-60 pair of headphones but these truly are a gem! They sound and function just as well (if not a little better) then my friends $250 Sony's.

I usually use it in my work and these headphones are wonderful for its price, the noise-canceling working pretty well, it can disappear the noise produced for the air conditioner without troubles, its bass-up function was working exceptionally. About battery life, Anker always does the thing well in this aspect. To end I feel that its foams are so soft and comfortable. BTW: The noise-canceling can improve to don't affect the bass-up function. I feel that the bass-up function worked better if the NC is off.

review_title: Great sound quality, good build, good noise cancellation
review_text: I've tried noise cancelling headphones in the store - but don't own a major brand to compare. What I can say is that these do sound good - as long as you don't use the Bass Up! feature. The noise cancellation gets rid of the noise of my refrigerator, a loud fan in the next room, most of the noise of a vacuum cleaner, and a good deal of mid-range to upper bass sounds. To be honest the difference is huge in most settings. I use them for telephone meetings since my AirPods started to run down much too quickly. Caveats - minuses: Not USB C A medium "thump" when turning them on as the noise cancellation turns on. It's a lot like the thump you'd hear in a car with a separate sub and amplifier without a pop circuit - just much quieter. There seems to be some sort of noise when I join a call. People frequently ask "Are you ok?!?" They compare it to dropping something huge, falling down the stairs, or a large animal moving rapidly through the room. It's brief, however, so their psychological and aural trauma is hopefully minimized. No case. And with a case it's a huge chunk of real estate in a backpack. Pros: I think they pair as fast or faster than my 1st generation AirPods. Inexpensive - and well worth the price for what you're getting. Sound quality is unexpectedly good. I'm not going to lie - I'm hard of hearing and have hearing loss in several spectra depending on the ear - just ask my wife. I'm not able to boast that I'm an audiophile any longer because I spent too many years working as a "board operator" (disc jockey) in radio wearing headphones turned up too loud. They sound better than many many many headphones in their price range I've listened to. Should you buy them? Personally I'd give an unqualified yes to that question - they're well worth it.

After having for app. 2 months won’t recharge,bought through amazon called mfg. they said couldn’t find invoice of sale. Talked to Amazon rep.online said she had contacted mfg.,should contact me within 2 days. Will wait and see
Good quality and so soft and comfortable. Liked it so much I'm buying another pair for the wife.
Excelente sonido, muy liviano.

review_title: Great value and 95% of the sound quality of Sony WH-1000XM3
review_text: I went through an entire set of headphones to find something that delivered great sound...decent noise cancellation and these delivered. I tried the Sony WH-1000XM3's for a week and while they sounded great were admittedly pricey at $299. On an off chance these Anker at $48 were close, I ordered and then tried and compared these two headphones side by side for a few days. Honestly sound quality was identical, and the noise cancellation difference between these 2 didn't justify the huge price difference for me. These Ankers are really 95% of the capabilities of the more expensive Sonys.
Yes, Lalo likes...

Noise cancellation is very minimal, but for the price it is great product. I'm not an expert but I read many reviews before I settled on these and I have not been disappointed for the price, I would buy them again. Unless you are a huge snob or your job involves sound these work just fine.
Very comfortable for my big head

These are very good budget bluetooth headphone for the price, the sound is good and the ANC is decent for this price. I'm pretty impressed with these headphone, these replaced last years Sennheiser BT 4.50 which I ordered on Black Friday. They had great sound and good ANC but there was a beeping sound every time I changed a track or changed the volume. It got to be pretty annoying. Sennheiser tech support told what to do to fix it but nothing, they still had that beeping sound. These Ankers have no issues at all, so I'm very pleased and I saved some money. Now contrary to what some reviews say these are not comparable or beat the Sony WH-1000XM3's, but for the price they work great. Hopefully the XM3's will drop a bit more in price when the XM4's come out and then I will buy them.
Best in class and value for money!! Noise cancellation is good and only one thing to complain is that it does not have auto off.
Good sound and quality

review_title: You cannot go wrong with it price for the quality you get.
review_text: Good price, awesome noise cancellation and dynamic range of the headphone. I tried some different brand, this by far the best. I also dropped it from snowboarding couple of times, it survived perfectly. Thanks anker!
These are amazing! Especially for the price, the ear parts are very comfortable and the noise cancelling it top notch
Not enough noise canceling

It only had a high battery the first time I used them no matter how long I charged them it always says battery low I wish I hadn't bought them I'll never buy Anker again even with the nose cancelling on you could still hear noise.
Great price point and quality far surpasses what you'd expect for this price. Happy with my purchase, will recommend.

review_title: High Quality, Best Bang for the buck out there.
review_text: Awesome performance, just not enough gain. I wish they would go louder, but I’d probably lose some more hearing.
Fair noise reduction

The right driver is obviously busted and just rattles or bottoms out mostly with tight base. These do not get loud enough at all. Also when you touch more move headband in some parts, you get a horrible static/cracking sound. the noise cancelling is acceptable. I do not recommend these at all.

There are certainly much better headphones in the market, but it would be difficult to find something comparable for the price. Connectivity has been good. No issues with macos or Android. Both sound quality and battery life perform well.
Super duper
Excellent bluetooth range

Sound quality is good, noise cancelling is ok. Not going to get Bose quality sound cancellation but at an 1/8 of the price, you're getting a fantastic deal that works well. Customer support is also super helpful in the event you need to contact them.

review_title: I like their products for their value!
review_text: I very much like the quality to price ratio Anker products provide. I already own the Anker portable Bluetooth speaker. While I already had another set of Bluetooth headphones, I bought these because they were noise canceling. The noise canceling feature works fairly well but honestly, it is hard for me to evaluate since this is my first noise canceling product. I use the noise canceling feature to watch TV while our vacuum robot is cleaning. While it does not completely cancel the noise, it does enough to be able to comfortably listen to the TV. (I suppose the noise canceling works well enough for me not to hear when my wife asks me to do something 🤪)!
Nice headphone.
It was for my husband so he can hear tv better
Great product for the price

It's a great cheap alternative to the SONY and BOSE powerhouse noise-canceling headphones. The noise-canceling by their own admission is ~90% mostly ambient noise. I really like them, battery life is pretty solid too. Overall killer bang for your buck.

Great headphones for the price. I have a huge head and huge ears, and most headphones are eternally uncomfortable on me. These fit well and do not hurt for long (several hours) periods of study time. The music quality is great (I am not an audiophile, I am comparing these to ear buds) and the noise canceling is also effective. However, mine worked well for about a week, and then just started shutting off every ten minutes. So while trying to study they would just power off, (Yes, the battery was charged, every time I turned them back on it would tell me the battery level was high), every ten minutes. So for the price they are not worth it to me. I feel like you should be able to build a pair of headphones for $60 that actually stays powered on for more than 10 minutes.
The sound reduction is ok. Not to the caliber of the Sony, but Bluetooth and audio is very good. All in all, a good value.
Very solid headphones. Decent noise canceling, not completely silent but when audio is coming through them they are nearly silent. Definitely a great buy for the price.
Amazing! !
The sound quality is good. Definitely worth the amount paid.

Primarily use when relaxing, listening to on-line old radio broadcasts, taking phone calls....Don't use noise canceling much, seems to work OK. Sound quality is pretty good, I can listen for hours. Comfortable. The only complaint I have is headband/earcup mount noise, almost any movement of these parts while over the ears is an audible creaking or popping. I can not relate this to the noise canceling feature, I seldom use it and it happens if on or off. Noise is transmitted through the plastic, not cause through the speakers. Once I get comfortable and still everything is nice.
Pairing was easy for these very good sounding headphones.
Used it for a plane ride, absolutely loved it.

review_title: Got it in October. It broke by March
review_text: This product is great for a while. I only used it once or twice a week. Then it fell apart. Good quality sound. Cheap parts.

review_title: Surprising good, but a bit bassy. Excellent value
review_text: I wasn't expecting much from the active noise cancelling but this is surprisingly good. Bass is more natural with ANC on. It's bassy with ANC off. Certain music makes the ANC act weird (death metal, blast beats, etc.). I didn't buy this expecting audiophile experience. With less bass, these would be pretty good. With its level of bass, it's fine. Good for normal music (pop, hip hop, EDM) Good voice call quality also.
Great deal! Excellent sound, easy bluetooth hookup

review_title: Good sound, great for an office work environment.
review_text: I listen to music and podcasts from my phone while at work to help my concentration. I needed a wireless headset as my new phone does not have a 3.5mm audio jack. My previous over-the-ear wired headset leaked quite a bit of background noise, so I wanted to look into noise-canceling options. I have priced out the well known brands for their wireless and noise canceling offerings, but with prices starting at $180 I didn't want to have something so pricey on my desk at work. And many of them touted "audiophile" level sound quality - I didn't want to pay that for something providing background music at work. I came across these when looking into other Anker products on Amazon - Anker is a brand that I've trusted for years for quality cables, USB charging bricks, and some other audio components so I took a chance. I've used them for a couple weeks now and I can't express how impressed I am with them. The noise canceling and audio quality are good for my work environment, but what really impressed me was the fit and feel of the ear pieces and head strap while wearing it. The strap is lightly padded, and the ear cups are deep enough to not press in on my ears, and the inner diameter of the cup itself is ample even for my larger ears. I accidentally left them paired as I was leaving the office and I noticed that they were still connected well over 100' away. I am sure the audio quality would have suffered at that range, but considering these will always be within 20' of the phone that won't be a problem. I'm definitely keeping these and hope they have a long life.

A lot of bass, had to tone it down with an equaliser. Constant grinding/creaking of plastic. Good quality plastic but left hinge creaks when you move your head. Cannot hear the bus or my fan while the noise cancelling. I get around two days of battery life, and I use my headphones constantly.
The quality of the sound is good. Battery life is good too. I wish it plays from USB though. It only plays via sound cable or blue tooth. For blue tooth this is best value.

review_title: Sound quality is Ok. Noise cancellation is weak.
review_text: Noise cancellation is weak. Just use it as a normal wireless headphone. Sound quality is good for the price.
Great for the price, sound is good, battery last very long and they are pretty sturdy.

review_title: Great BOSE alternative for the price
review_text: For the price, the Q20 provides great sound. Sound does not break up at higher volumes, buttons are easily accessible, rechargeable via micro usb, and very comfortable. What I don't like about this are the on/off and noise canceling buttons. You have to press and hold each respective button to turn on, off, the headphones and to activate/deactivate the N/C feature. If Anker can change these buttons to switches, I think it'll be easier for everyone. But I understand these are budget friendly headphones and corners have to be cut. The other feature that's not that great is the microphone. People on the receiving end of the call tells me I sound like I'm on a speakerphone. They can hear me but just not clearly. Overall, great headphones for the $ and I would buy this again. Looking forward to better revisions.
It works great for the price. Of course you can't compare it to a Bose. Bose cost 5 times as much. I didn't want to spend $300. These are priced right for the average person.

review_title: Never had a bad product from Anker
review_text: Great headphones.
Outstanding quality.

I was really excited for these and thought the price/quality ration was great. Unfortunately, they are unusable with the noise cancellation on. If there is any pressure applied to the right earpiece, the noise cancellation creates this weird vibration or reverberation sound. It is like a low pitch quick thumping. It does not do this when noise cancellation is off. I thought I may have a defective unit, but checking the reviews further, it seems like others have the issue too. I did not hear the loud popping sound that others have mentioned though. These will have to go back.
Tremendous value for the money. Great sound. Great noise reduction. Long lasting battery.

review_title: For $60.00, these are an absolute steal!
review_text: They certainly aren't the best noise cancelling wireless headphones on the market, but for the price they are a total steal. Noise cancelling is great, I've used them on an airplane, bus, train, and heavily air conditioned room and I was really impressed with their ability to block out white noise. The controls are pretty minimal but certainly serviceable. I find them comfortable for up to like three hours before I need to take a break which is about the same to what I've experienced with other headphones. The range of the bluetooth is great and the battery life is outstanding. They definitely are lackluster in wired mode and I wish they charged via usb c instead of micro usb, but overall for the price I would recommend these 100% to anybody. For me, best part is I can use them heavily and travel anywhere with them without worry of losing or breaking $400 headphones.
Affordable product for everyday listening.
I like them and they fit my use of using them to listen to Movies and TV shows.
Great value at this price point!
Dollar for dollar - Great buy!
This are the perfect balance between functionality and budget-friendly

I was asked to share my review of Anker Soundcore headphones. This is my third Anker product. The first I was and am still very pleased with, the 2nd I am not at all happy with. These head phones fall somewhere in between. I'm happy with the sound quality and the connectivity is good- especially for the price point. Overall, they delivered what I was looking for in a headphones and I think the price point makes them a good option to consider. The only two cons are that I found them to be a bit big on my head without and option to tighten much smaller and that my original set- purchased in Oct 2019, stopped charging suddenly in February 2020. I will note, I wrote Anker about it, instituted a few of their suggested troubleshooting measures that failed, and then was sent a replacement pair- all within a week. It was a painless process which I appreciated. The new set again work up to my expectations- I hope they don't face the same issues as the last set.
My first pair of noise canceling head phones. I listen to books on tape at work. Perfect. I dont hear any of my coworkers.
Am not sure where it’s coming from but I have the occasional very loud pop or crackle in the right ear. Shocking and surprising every time.
These really help calm down the voices in my head telling I should be singing and dancing show tunes! !
Quickly paired, affordable, average material quality, cheap. Worth...

Abysmal overpowering muddy bass that cuts into the midrange rendering anything you’re listening to to sound awful. Despite this being a relevantly new model it doesn’t not have a USB-C slot to charge. I couldn’t stomach how unpleasant it sounded. So what about the microphone? It’s also garbled muffled and unintelligible. Effectively useless. The only good thing was the ear pads. They’re a light rubbery squishy feeling and felt very comfortable. My experience with these headphones was disappointing.
Good

I have over ten BT over the ear headsets and this one is by far the most comfortable. This alone makes this my go to "cans". I'm not an audiophile so comfort for me is more important. Having said that the sound on this headset isn't bad. In fact, this is the second best sounding one in my "inventory". Again, I'm not an audiophile so you'll need to take it with a grain of salt. Also, I don't own any high end cans so I can't say how it'll compare to those (i.e. - BOSE, Sony, etc). For me this checks all the boxes so I'm quite content with my purchase.
Great for walking in the mall; good but not great for walking next to heavily traveled road. Need to try on plane. Well-worth the price.
Good except loud crack noise caused by anything from a tap on the headband to a closing door. 5 stars if not for this issue.

I've been using these Q20s for several months on and off. My favorite place to use them is in an airplane which I am in often. I'm something of a Bluetooth headphone junkie, and can't seem to become satisfied with a specific type, or brand. To be honest, even though I have several over-the-ear Bluetooth headsets, I only find myself only reaching for these kinds late at night or on weekends once in a while. This is when I can be totally alone and not worried about not hearing others in my family (or even work responsibilities which hit me 24/7). I have used and owned four different over the ear headsets that are of generally speaking lesser-known brands ranging in price from $30 to $60 at the time of purchase. I also own, and consider my premier headset, a pair of Skullcandy Crushers. The Crushers even now still cost a little bit more than these Anker's, even though at the time I purchased them they were $150 (easily two years ago now, probably 3). I must say that Anker makes excellent products across the board. I have owned a number of their products even going back to when they were a much lesser-known brand and especially not something you could find in the big box stores like you can now. Anker seems to be consistent in their approach to making quality products, and if it's of interest to you, their packaging and presentation is always excellent. So, on to these headphones – they have excellent overall sound with crisp highs and mid tones. Bass is clean and weighty, but never “punchy” or overly distorted unless you crank it up too high. I would call them very well rounded but are not going to blow you away with bass or volume levels even using their extra-bass feature (IMO). I’ve listened to podcasts, audible books, videos, and a host of different kinds of music and everything has sounded great. Active noise cancellation is great – a feature I’ve used over and over again on flights. Battery life has been excellent so far, and I must admit I’ve never let them run out. I’ve used them for at least 5 hours on a single day without charging and no issues. Phone calls have been fine and the other side has been able to hear me – but my experience is limited in this area. Ear pads and fit on my large head and are extremely comfortable even for several hours at a time. This has not been an issue for me at all, I even find I don’t overly become sweaty with these headsets on - compared to my Crushers. These do not come with a hard case of any kind so keep that in mind if you like to throw things around or over pack electronic items in your bags. Thankfully I haven't had any issues but will be using a hard case soon. They seem relatively durable even though the collapsible nature of them has become quite floppy over time. It’s probably just an annoyance of mine but worth noting. I have used them both wired and with Bluetooth and neither has given me any issue across three different phones and attached to one desktop computer and one laptop. Stylistically, these are very conservative – and that is a good thing because they’re also not tawdry, tacky, or just plain odd like so many “cheaper” headsets. I very much like the finish of the plastic, lettering, and general appearance. You have a ton of choices in this range of price and style of headset. It's really hard to know where you should land. I think these are worth considering if you are not after a very specific element such as heavy bass. If you want a great well-rounded sound that is crisp, clean, and rich, I don't think you can go wrong with these.

review_title: Anker good producers of electronic products
review_text: Great price for great products. Ankar starting to be a good brand than other well known products

Other reviews have said that, "no these are not $300+ Bose but they're pretty good." That's where I am. And 40 hr battery life is really good. I'm not constantly charging these things. And they're pretty comfortable. In a quietish room, the noise cancelling is so good, I can hear my heartbeat. If you're rich, get the high dollar ones. If you're like the rest of us, these will do very nicely.

review_title: Sounds cuts out when streaming music from Spotify and YouTube on MacBook
review_text: Nots sure what the reason is, but it's intolerable and quite poor compared to the Beats Powerbeats 2 I was using. Unclear at if it can be fixed with an update. Very annoying.

review_title: Amazing value; well worth the price
review_text: The quality and comfort of these blew my mind, considering the price. They pair up very well with all three devices I've used it with (android, macos, linux desktop). The bass response is almost too much WITHOUT the boost. The noise cancellation doesn't seem to cover the high end spectrum and also seems to rely on a fair amount of white noise. I will likely only use it on airplanes.

review_title: Incredible customer service coupled with great value
review_text: I had purchased Anker liberty buds for workouts and was very happy with these (100 hr. runtime - I have charged them only once in 6 months). With that experience and, of course, because of the great price, I purchased Q20 for watching Netflix movies on my long trips (9-13 hr.). The set was great in terms of noise handling and when connected to the PC using the cable. However, the Bluetooth connection was a bit flaky. I wrote to Anker about my experience and Shelly from the customer service immediately got in touch with me. She helped me diagnose the headset to see if the problems would go away. When that didn't work, she immediately sent me a replacement pair and a shipping label to send back the defective pair. I think that Anker did the right thing and honored their warranty. the five stars is for the way Shelly handled this issue - I always felt that she was there live to quickly resolve my issues. Her response was always prompt - not 24 or 48 hours later but within one or two hours. She was professional and prompt in making the determination that the headphones needed to be replaced and made the exchange quickly so that I wouldn't be discomforted

I work in a factory with extremely loud machinery and even louder people around me. There's a policy where we have to leave our phones in our lockers, not allowed out on the floor etc. I can start a playlist and dump the phone in the locker, then proceed to walk 100 feet to my work station where I get CRYSTAL sound quality. These things are no joke for the money. I don't even care if they get me fired

I ordered these in August and they were amazing! the right ear phone stopped working and they were very nice to replace them I filed with the Warranty and they sent me a new pair. And it was very easy. I also have a wireless charger from them that's amazing I really really like this company!

Have had these for a few months. They work great, did have a pair fail (wouldn’t charge). Anker/Soundcore customer support was amazing once again. I’ve used them for lawn mowing, flying on a plane etc. had one trip in a turbo prop and these saved my sanity!
Excellent for the price. I am really pleased. It’s sad I spent triple this for headphones like these just a few years ago.

I thing these headphones are perfect for me. The cost didn’t kill my budget but don’t get me wrong these are not budget headphones. I real like the bass and I can add more if needed. The mics that are built in do a nice job with the noice cancellation part. I enjoy the full over the ear feeling. It might get a little warm but not very noticeable.
Received headphones today, the right channel doesn’t work at all. I expected more out of 60 buck headphones

review_title: Good quality for a low price headphones.
review_text: Great headphones. Sound was very good. Noise cancellation was ok.Great value for the money. Excellent quality. The only reason. I returned its Bluetooth 4.0.
Comfortable
The noise canceling is great! The sound quality is excellent.
These are quite well designed. I picked them up when they were on sale, but they are worth the usual price.

review_title: Ears get hot within 15-30 minutes in Winter. Not able to handle the sweating in ears.
review_text: Most half way decent earphones you can wear for several hours without the heat/sweat that comes from earphones.

review_title: Really good value, The noise canceling is surprisingly good too
review_text: It's a really good fit. Super happy with it. I'm not a sound professional, but it sounds good to me.

I would have to say that these headphones are pretty darn good. Sound quality is very good and the noise cancellation feature works well. Also, the battery life is excellent. For the price, you can't go wrong!
Good deal sound good fast shipping good customer service I will probably buy more

review_title: Comfortable and well insulated against sound, but the ANC is horrible
review_text: Loved them at first.. they're very comfortable for the price, and the sound quality is good.. The ANC however has much to be desired.. It produces a "blowing into a fan" reverb effect that pauses when you move your head, then continues the moment you remain stationary. If you constantly move your head, it works to cancel ambient sound, but the moment you stop the reverb effect starts again and gets exponentially worse until you move your head.. or until you cancel it or shoot yourself. If the ANC didn't produce maddening reverb, they would be 4-5 stars.

review_title: Good value and quality for the pricing
review_text: Was completely satisfied

This set of headphones performed much better than I expected for the price. Highly recommended. Noise cancellation is good, sound quality is good, bass is good, battery life is amazing. Can also connect to two devices at once.
These are excellent for the price. I own Bose headphones and these are just as good and a heck of a lot cheaper.

Any movement that occurs to the headphones while listening results in terrible static. For example riding the bus going over bumps disrupts everything I’m listening too with static noise. Unable to return. Wouldn’t recommend buying.

review_title: Really Nice Headphones, Slightly Too Large, Great Customer Service!
review_text: I am always wearing wireless headphones when I am doing chores and working. I have a cleaning business. The distance range is great as I can wander around pretty much my whole house without having to drag my phone with me. The sound is good, volume is great, if you turn it up loud enough it cancels out noise. lol. The noise cancelling is not as good as my corded Bose headphones but I have no complaints. What I do have a problem with is they slide off my head if I bend over which is very annoying. I have an average size head and wish I could make them fit tighter. I almost returned them because of this issue. Other than that they are great for the price. **UPDATE** After a couple of months they would no longer take a charge. I probably just got a bad pair, a fluke. I contacted the seller and they immediately sent me a replacement free of charge. Wonderful customer service!

review_title: Great product, but stopped working in 45 days
review_text: Everything seemed great about this product. The day before it broke and stopped charging , the device was repeatedly toggling NC every minute. That was the first sign of failure. The next morning, it was not charging or turning on. The NC experience is a must while in flight.

review_title: Gaming, TV or Music. Great sound. Very satisfied purchase
review_text: Sound Great! Bass is good. The ear pads are soft and comfortable. A very slight delay from TV that I could only notice with TV volume on and one ear on headset. You will not notice with the headset only. I have used with the Computer Gaming. They work great and the microphone is very clear I was told.

These ‘phones do quite well at both sound isolation and reproduction on an absolute scale, with strong bass and credible treble; when adjusted for price, they’re really impressive. Especially the extended play time on a charge, and the fact that they play even with depleted batteries. I love my wired Bose cans, but these BlueTooth pups do very well indeed.
Great pair of headphones for the money! Headphones that are comfortable to wear and sound great.
Been using since purchased last month. Bluetooth connection separates sporadically and unexpectedly repeatedly. Contacted Anker customer support for resolution. Will see what happens.

review_title: Very good sound quality. The best headphones I have ever owned.
review_text: I am not an audiophile. I was just looking for a high quality noise-cancelling over-the-ear headset. I heard of these on Leo LaPorte’s The Tech Guy and to me they are very high quality for the price. I have used these for only ~ a month and I do not know how long the batteries last because I have not listened to them for longer than ~ 90 minutes but for my use case they are perfect.

I am really glad I picked these up. The ANC isn't going to match a $300+ pair of Bose/Sony, but it does a decent job. They are really comfortable, have a long battery life, and they sound great. I would recommend them, especially if you can pick them up on sale!

Disclaimer: I am not an audiophile by any means. I was in the market for affordable over the ear BT headphones and saw this pair on a deal site I frequent. The ear cups are very comfortable and the sound is very good, bass, treble all sound better than I was expecting at this price point. The noise-canceling feature does a pretty good job as well. It doesn't kill all surrounding sounds but does a good job IMO. Battery life seems to be good so far. This pair comes with a wire as well so you don't have to use the Bluetooth if you don't want to. Overall, I am very impressed with the sound and comfort of these headphones. Great grab for under $60. I would definitely recommend these to anyone in the market.

review_title: Excellent sound and noise cancelling. A real winner.
review_text: These things are fantastic. Sound quality is very good. Noise cancelling is excellent. Seem to be very well built. I took them on a flight to Phoenix last week and they were great on the plane. They completely blocked out the noise and allowed me to hear every word in the movie I was watching. I highly recommend them.
I first bought these for my mom. She loved them so much I had to get myself a pair. Highly recommend especially for the price!
At this price point I doubt you'll find any pair of headphones this high quality. Well done again soundcore
Good sound, good design, battery lasts forever. I would buy these again for sure.
Good for sound but noise canceling is not very good. The price for it was worth it though.

review_title: Great except for not fitting my small head. Rivaled Bose QC 35 II
review_text: I demoed these along with Bose QC 35 II (Quiet Comfort) and found the sound to be acceptable for such a lower price! Not the same... but completely acceptable. The noise cancellation feature on the Soundcore was acceptable as well... comparable to the Bose. The build quality felt acceptable on the soundcore as well... not as good as the Bose, but great value. However, the Bose fit my small (thin/narrow adult) head very well and the Soundcore were falling off my head too easily even just tilting my head forward or back in the smallest/tightest setting.

review_title: Sounds great, feels cheap, disconnects randomly
review_text: Can't say this was worth it. If it didn't constantly disconnect (and by that I mean just turn off entirely despite the battery being "high"). I was using these for Playstation sound and connected to the controller worked fine and sounded awesome until the sound started sounding robotic and some things were coming through at all any more like one channel just died. Tried different cables, no difference in sound. So I was stuck to using them bluetooth. Which has worked fine until today, when it will randomly turn off. I turn it on and reconnect it and the sound is exactly like it was on the Playstation except this is bluetooth, not a physical 3.5mm jack.... disconnect and reconnect, its normal now.. Oh it turned off again, fantastic. Would not recommend.
The noise cancellation is great up until a few days back. I noticed the noise cancellation was fading away on my right side of the headphones. I would reset it but still have the same issue.

review_title: Something is terribly wrong with the noise cancellation
review_text: When I first got these, I really liked them. They're comfortable and the sound quality is good. However, the main reason I liked these was the noise cancellation on a budget, but this has become unusable. If I turn NC on, one ear cup makes a low, loud rumbling noise at all times. I think it is straining the speaker somehow, because there's also a burning smell when NC is on. Hoping this is just a defect in my pair and not all of them cause I was enjoying these very much.
Sold my bose and beats when I purchased this one. No regrets b/c the quality is the same. Very satisfied with this device.

review_title: Great sound, good battery, noise cancelling technically works, bad build quality.
review_text: Would be a lot better if there weren't so many issues with build quality: makes a sharp CHK sound when bumped a certain way (happens walking down stairs and on the bus), right speaker "wobbles" audibly when I turn my head while listening. Noise cancelling clears out lower droning sounds well - good for transport in general as well as busy streets (unless it's windy), but has a hard time filtering out a lot of other disturbing sounds. Sound is great for the price, plus very good battery-life.
Has the bass and volume control I was looking for in my first pair of over the ear headphones. Noise cancelling was a bonus.

I needed noise canceling headphones to work in an open office environment. These were my first experience with noise canceling, so I didn’t know what to expect. As soon as I charged them the first time, I toggled the noise canceling feature off and on to test that they really did block noise from a loud fan. They worked well at the office, too. There are limitations, of course, but the noise canceling enabled me to maintain focus more often and even lose track of time occasionally while working. I noticed that they cannot be charged while listening. It’s probably safer, so I just need to keep track of the battery level and charge them before they run dry. They hold a charge for multiple work days of use and are still going strong months after I got them. The audio quality seems good and is comparable to similarly priced headphones. The noise canceling feature really make them a good value for the price. And, of course, the Anker brand continues to deliver the great experience that I’ve come to expect from anything they make with a battery or a charging port.
Comfort okay

review_title: It's a very good set of headphones for the price
review_text: The noise canceling is very good. They are built very well for the money. They have decent sound. The controls are very easy to use.
They broke after a month of use one speakers had blown
Great sound
Very good pair of headphones (nicer than the same level of monoprice headphones), good noise cancelling and they don't hurt my head at all

This has some of the best active noise cancelling I’ve seen in sub $250 headphones. They completely remove jet engine noise and do a great job for keyboard clacking as well as ambient conversation. They’re lightweight and comfortable on my head. The battery is rated at 40 hours with noise cancelling but I think I get closer to 50. They last long enough I can make an entire trip with four flights without recharging.
Work
Great for traveling and phone calls. Not good for working out in the gym

These began losing their charge rapidly after two weeks. We decided to keep them in case it was just a matter of charging more often, since the other features were decent for the price. One week after the return window closed, they lost all ability to charge. I'm furious that we can't get a refund on a clearly defective product, and hope others don't waste their money.

review_title: Major functionality fails, would not recommend
review_text: The product generally functions satisfactorily except for what will be mentioned in this review. However, the issues in this review occurred in a brand new purchase, and consistently enough to be cause for alarm. IMO these issues invalidate the cheap cost of the headphones. Most notably: The volume control dial on the right ear jams regularly. Sometimes it cannot be pushed like a button at all; other times it functions but not very well; other times it is satisfactory. The microphone is absolutely terrible, 1/10. My phone or laptop microphone are lightyears ahead of it in quality and functionality. The sound quality is fine but not exceptional. The noise cancellation blocks out most sound but does nothing for wind or loud/persistent enough background noise. Even the slightest bumps (like in a car or bus) cause loud and painful feedback. This renders it utterly useless for long term travel, which it is recommended for. It will randomly shut off entirely, regardless of battery level or usage. For these reasons (and the fact that I had hoped to use this for a long while), I have to reduce the 2/5 star review to 1/5 stars. I can’t recommend this product to anyone unless they are desperate.

review_title: Mostly Excellent, Except Very Loud Pops from ANC
review_text: I've had a pair of these now about 6 weeks and have used them on the city streets, subways, buses, on airplanes, and in the office as a conferencing headset. They mostly do a good job, but they do have several glaring faults: 1) ANC produces very loud popping with medium loud environment transient sounds Whenever there is a med-loud short noise (like sound of my front door closing shut), the ANC produces an extremely loud pop. The original environment sounds are short and maybe around 70-75dB, but the popping sound at the ear is easily in excess of 90dB. This is especially bad on buses and subways when they go over the slightest bump. The pop is pretty painful TBH; it is so bad, I have to turn the ANC off. The ANC algorithm could really use a limiter filter to protect against transients like this. 2) ANC does not work when using wired connection On airplanes, they perform well. They lower the droning sound of the engines pretty well; certainly enough to be noticeable and make the flight more pleasant. I've not had a set of Bose QC cans, so can't compare one versus the other. Whenever you want to use the plane's infotainment system though, you have to plug in wired. This is a problem for the ANC, because it does not work when using a wired connection. The ANC only functions when using a BlueTooth connection. I had to choose between entertainment and ANC. 3) So-so performance as a computer-connected headset When I connect to a phone, the headset performs pretty well for calls, regardless of using phone and a soft codec app. I've asked others how I sound, and they all give a positive response and have no issue clearly hearing me. However, if I connect the headset to my laptop for MS Teams, Zoom, or BlueJeans conferencing, I encounter A LOT of problems transmitting my mic audio; no one can understand a thing I say. I always have to switch to my laptop's microphone array to transmit clear mic audio. There is definitely an issue with conformance to the audio driver.

review_title: CORONA VIRUS APPROVED! SURPRISINGLY WONDERFUL PURCHASE WITH GREAT NOISE CANCELLING
review_text: I work from home and we have hard wood floors and a noisy family. The noise that regularly comes into my office is beyond shocking and distracting. I hear everything. Its like they're in my office. I had been considering many options for sound proofing and decided to give the Anker Soundcore Life Q20 a try. I decided to take a chance on these after researching many headphones and the reviews that followed. I was worried that for the price that I would be disappointed, and I am definitely not. The battery life is insane, listed at 40 hours with ANC on 60hrs off, in Bluetooth mode. The paring was simple and took about 5 to 10 sec. For reference I am using Taotronics Bluetooth adapter for my TV to pair them to my television. As far as the sound its good/decent. A little muddy in the mid/high range for my personal taste, but I found the sound to be actually better with the ANC on, which is not common for other brands. As far as the ANC, it will not drown out 100% of the conversations and talking around you but with music or tv on its so very close. I can't hear the fan in my office. I can't hear my keyboard clatter. I can't hear my family and kids yelling and talking in the other room (for the 1st time in years) with the ANC and any sound input turned on. I should have bought these years ago, especially at this price. I would never ever believed this was possible. They are very comfortable, decent quality. Easy to use and adjust performance features with the buttons. I bought these in hopes of gaining tranquility in my home office, especially with home school going on 10 ft away now due to the Corona Virus. I JUST CAN'T SAY ENOUGH HOW GREAT THESE ARE. My kids are literally 10 feet away, I could always hear every single word spoken, and now as long as I have some sound source on, I can't hear a thing. ITS AMAZING. I can't wait to mow the lawn with these babies. I really expected to be disappointed, and have to spend $100's more, but for my needs these are far better than expected. My only disappointment would be in the sound quality from my tv source. The EQ function is not available from my tv, so its not a reflection of this product. There is also a sight buzz when turning the volume up max. Better when adjusting the source up, suspect related to Bluetooth adapter. Plugged directly into sources with the AUX cable all buzzing is gone, but still mid & high end frequency is fair. ANC is great. Again the only room for improvement would be in the mid and high range sound reproduction. Everything is just flat and muddy, but certainty ok at this price point. Where the product impresses me the most is in the ANC, which scored the highest for mid/high range reduction (I.E. People talking /yelling). I would definitely recommend them especially at the price point.

review_title: Good ANC & sound quality with GREAT comfort
review_text: Decided to give this a shot after reading the review on another consumer site. It's the most comfortable headset I've tried other than the 1 wired set I've bought ($100+) for high sound quality purpose.
Pretty good

review_title: Great value, but not as durable as I had hoped
review_text: PRO: - Sound quality is pretty good. - Ear cushions are comfortable and block off ambient sound on t heir own. - The noise cancelling feature does a good job dampening "humming" ambient noises. - Long battery life. CON: - Ear cushion fabric has separated from the mount and is exposing the inner foam. I bought these headphones back in Sept 2019. Within 6 months, the glue holding the ear cushion fabric together started to fail. The glue has continued to fail to where half of the inner foam is more than 50% exposed. I would gladly pay $10 for a replacement pair of ear cushions, but there also doesn't seem one anywhere.

review_title: Cheaper than Bose but similar quality!
review_text: Awesome headphones! By coincidence I recently received some Bose noise cancelling headphones, and I think these Anker ones are about the same level of noise cancelling but without the huge price tag. The Bose ones have a little crisper sound quality, but honestly, it’s very close. I would definitely recommend these headphones.
Anula todo el ruido de afuera, buenos bajos, buen volumen. Nada que envidiar a los JBL E40BT.

review_title: Anker Soundcore Life Q20 Hybrid Product Review
review_text: To all those that read my review: I purchased these headphones and some Bose Q35 II about a month ago. I have a review on the Bose as well. Pros: Sounds quality is superior for the price point. Full ear cover (I have big ears) Solid noise cancellation functionality Long Long battery life Can turn noise canceling on and off No need for an App to control the headphones Strong Bass sound (I like a good thump in my music and these headphones deliver that) Carry case for the headphones Cons: Vinyl fake leather, I wouldn't have minded paying a bit more for leather ear wraps and head cushion (but then again they add that then it's in the Bose competition level) besides that there are very few cons Summary: The Bose Q35 II headphones are better are noise cancelling. I tested both out in the same environment to see the difference. You can there is a difference but only slightly. These SoundCore headphones are probably at an 80% level if the Bose Q35 where the base 100% operating level for comparison. I got the Bose Rose Gold headphones for my wife with a huge discount, because now a month later they discounted that color option. Overall Anker Soundcore Life headphones deliver. They offer sooo sooo many advantages for quality headphone product at an attractive price point. I'd recommend this product.
These headphones sound amazing whether you are listening to music or audiobooks and very comfortable

review_title: I used them often, I charge them once a week.
review_text: Great headset, although it's cracks when there are bumps on the road while on noise cancellation mode. I drive a 1ton cargo van, and as you know, they have a stiff suspension that are designed to sustain the weight in those vehicles. Otherwise great long lasting battery and awesome sounds.
Sound is good. After hour or so they become a bit uncomfortable.

review_title: Great quality for a great price
review_text: We own Boss QC25 headphones also and these are just as comfortable. The controls are very straightforward and the base up is nice feature depending on the type of music you're listening to. The noise canceling is good but I notice the volume "pulses" when it's engaged. Besides that completely worth it for the price.
Works perfectly, very good for airplanes

review_title: Good value for the money, but the pop noise is real
review_text: I'd like to say first this review is not meant to bash this product. It's a very good product and these are the headphones I wear most of the time. The noise cancellation sometimes makes a loud pop. If you listen carefully to my video there's a buzz right after my car door was shut. It doesn't sound like much in the video but if this happens over your ears it can be painful. I leave these headphone in my house 100% because of this. It seems to be related to sudden shock/vibration. Other than this, I'm very satisfied with the purchase.
Great product , finish and sounds for the price. Fit is not as snug as I'd like, noise cancellation is about 30-50%
I use these when driving a tractor. They work surprisingly well for the price.
Noise cancelling on these cause ear pain, the sound sounds grainy and not clear not even close. Terrible bass.

review_title: New aptx bluetooth and frequency response
review_text: Great sound, I thought I would not use the noise cancelling, but it cuts out the fans on my desktop so I use it now. The ear cups are a little hard but overall a great design. The volume control is a little difficult to feel controls , but since I send sound thru a mixer to bluetooth transmitter it is a non issue.

The headset is wonderful. The instruction manual is a complete waste of time. print is too small, I could not read it even with a magnifying glass. Also, when finally read the write up instructions are worthless.
Love these! Noise cancellation could be better but worth the prices

I only used these a handful of times within the 30 day period. I noticed quite early on a loss in the quality of sound randomly. They would randomly get VERY loud and disconnect. I Thought perhaps it was the Bluetooth on my Mac. For some time the worked pretty good until today they just quit. They connect to my MAC but I am unable to get any sound to come through. Lesson learned! Don't go cheap when it comes to quality. I will be paying the big bucks for the new BOSE headphones.

review_title: These are a lifesaver during a quarantine in a small home
review_text: I purchased these headphones just before the COVID-19 quarantine so I could use my computer without being disturbed by family in my small home. This became extremely important once I needed to work from home with children running around making noise. The noise cancelling is impressive. I barely hear anything, and the only thing that does get through are sudden incredibly loud sounds, which I would want to hear anyhow in case a child was injured. Beyond that, the noise is either blocked outright or reduced to such a level I can easily ignore it. Do you happen to work in a noisy environment with lots of fans or the constant whirring of other machines? Then you definitely need this. The noise cancelling feature works best with noise that is constant. When I activate the noise-cancelling mode, those sounds are completely eliminated. I'm also quite happy with the battery life. The practical battery life in noise-cancelling mode is 20-25 hours per charge. I've not used it at great length in standard mode, but I wouldn't be surprised if it got 35-40 as others have indicated to me. Sound quality is great. Noise cancelling is amazing. Most importantly, they are comfortable to wear for 10+ hours a day, so if you need a way to drown out the rest of the world while working from home, you really aren't going to beat the performance at this price. Hands down, these are the best headphones I have ever owned, wireless or otherwise.

I bought these to connect to my TV when the wife goes to bed early. They work beyond well and the bluetooth connection to my Samsung TV doesn't disconnect throughout the whole apartment. At this moment I'm using them in my home office, while we are working, and she is having conference calls, while i'm trying to muffle them with light music and these are working brilliantly - i can't hear a thing she is doing. I just blasted the sound to high too , and to be frank, for my needs, the sound is amazing. Not mind blowing bass, but good enough, and overall the music is very clear. I couldn't be happier with this purchase, I have wireless earbuds for gym workouts, but I feel sometimes when working certain muscle groups, this over the ear set can be usable as well.

Very happy with these. I have never had "noise cancelling" headphones and the amount that get's "cancelled" isn't what I hoped it would be, but I think I had unrealistic expectations. The overall quality of the materials, fit and finished, etc is great and the sound is really incredible. It would be hard to pay 3-5 times this for a big name brand that might be 5% better. Highly recommend.
Doesn’t seem very effective. Watching tv on tablet but still able to hear fan in the room. Any suggestions?

review_title: Good headset for work and play
review_text: Bought this for use in work calls and meetings. Also wear working out. The are comfortable to wear for hours. Only compliant I have is that when they are jostled they produce a loud bang sound. This is particularly noticeable when I'm wearing while in a vehicle that hits a bump.

noise canceling working fine. The main and biggest problem is sound quality. I'm not a quality sound geek I need just normal sound and i have other headphones for the same price and all good but these headphones have a scratching sound on the background. This noise going much worst when you use skype, I check with my other headphones and sounds fine but when I use this one this noise was all the time. For this price, you can find bather headphones.

During the Covid19 crisis, I am forced to work from home like a lot of people. I've got kids and concentrating on work with all the background noise is a challenge. I've got apple airpods, which I love, but they're not noise cancelling. I did a bit of research looking for a set that wasn't too expensive but still has great quality and features. The Q20 was at the top of the list and I've got no regrets. Definitely worth $60.

These headphones work perfectly for me. They are easy to connect to my devices and stay connected. The sound quality is good, and I don’t really use the noise canceling feature so I won’t go into that. I am impressed with just how comfortable these are on my ears. Last but not least these are easy on my wallet and that is always appreciated. The only reasons I do not give these 5 stars is the fact that they use a micro usb instead of usb c for charging and you cannot use the Bluetooth while charging (there is a 3.5 mm jack if the battery dies though).

Bought these for a gift for my fiance, unfortunately missed the return window since i bought them ahead of time. For sitting & listening these are fantastic, however i think i got a defective product. If you lean your head back with the pair there is a severe rattling, almost as if wires inside have a poor connection. She noticed the first time she took them on a run and they kept having the issue with every stride. Quality is great across the board but i unfortunately must have received a defective pair

After 5 months of light use (maybe 10 hours per week), the headphones have stopped charging. They provided adequate noise cancelling for the price point, but losing the ability to charge after less than 6 months is totally unacceptable. AVOID THESE!
I really enjoy these, but they no longer charge more than 30% and usually they don’t charge more than 10%. Im very disappointed.

review_title: It was ok, not the best
review_text: So once I got the headphones pairing it via bluetooth was great, however when they disconnect and reconnect, I would have to do it manually, some headphones do it automatically which I liked better. While connecting to my Imac bluetooth the sound would sound great at times and then it would sound horrible like the sound would be underwater. So overall not satisfied, or maybe I received a defective unit, either way I am returning this product

Very good build quality, sound, and noise cancellation. These headphones are not quite Bose or Sony's top of the line product, but they're not all that far behind. They also cost about 1/5th what those Bose and Sony products cost. Incredible product for the price.
Loved everything about it... if only my head were that of a giant human. Then I would have kept them.

review_title: Awesome pair of headphones. Wish they kept USB-C
review_text: These are absolutely amazing. Sound quality is great, although maybe a bit too much bass, as one another reviewer said. No issues at all with cutting out on calls, music, or t.v. Really wish they would've kept the USB-C for this model. Honestly doesnt make sense why they would revert back to micro USB. ANC Does work well. Although I have nothing really to compare it with.

Like the headphone size, noise canceling is good, my only problem is I take public transportation (buses) everyday to and from work and home, the motion of the bus somehow there is noise interference really bad like you hear bad static so I have to take off noise canceling feature. Whihd defeats the purpose of using it.

I am so impressed by these headphones. I was expecting the quality to be low because they were cheap compared to other noise canceling headphones. The battery lasts for so long and the noise cancellation is so impressive. You can’t hear anything around you! I would recommended these to ANYONE
Love them with one minor/major complaint- Chassis noise - the left headphone bracket squeaks and flexes like mad. Very distracting. Otherwise, a steal.
It is the best for the price range for the build quality, base, and sound quality. However, please don't expect Bose level of noise cancellation.

Any kind of sudden movement causes loud audio disturbance, even movements in a vehicle or going down stairs. Tried to return via Amazon pickup but the pickup for return never happened so decided to keep them.
Se utiliza con una frecuencia muy baja, a los audífonos dejaron de cargar luego de seis meses de uso muy ligero. Lástima, el sonido es excelente y todo es bueno, pero la vida útil es muy corta.

review_title: These headphones are great! A steal at double the price.
review_text: This is my first pair of wireless noise cancellation headphones (had wired before, cord was a pain). I bought them in October for a trip overseas. They were very inexpensive so I was worried they might not be very good. Boy was I wrong here is why. 1) Battery Life - My intl flights were 16.5 / 14.5 hours long. I got to "medium" battery on each flight. 2) Bluetooth pairing/connecting - I use these headphones with 2 different laptops, my fire tablet and my phone. The pairing works the first time and connecting to the specific device works every time. 3) Noise Cancellation - I sat in coach for my flights in one of the front rows. You know who they put in the front rows on intl flights? Families. There were kids everywhere! I have never been so happy to have noise cancellation in my life. 4) Sound quality - I am not a speaker-phile (headphone-a-phile?) but I think the sound quality on these headphones is really good. I don't normally write product reviews. It is March and I bought these in October. I was connecting them this morning and it just worked and I thought I should really share my experience with these headphones because they are serious value for your money. Other info: I have a big head, they fit totally fine. They can be a little warm but take them off every once in a while, you'll be fine. Hope this helps.
My favorite headphones. They are soft like clouds on my ears and so comfortable to wear. I love how the battery lasts for 40 hours!! Incredible sound.

I have the Bose qc15, original noise cancelling over ear headphones to compare these and I have to say for the price these are amazing! Noise cancelling is not as good as Bose but it really does work great. It eliminates mower noise, and I ride metro daily it takes all that him and track noise away, at least enough I'm not needing to have my volume full blast to hear what I'm listening to at the time. I wear them for 2 hours straight twice a day, and though it's not summer heat yet, these are very comfortable and not hot. Also was surprised how good the bass was and clarity of voices through the bass for music. Overall for the price I don't believe they can be beat for over ear Bluetooth active noise cancelling headphones! !

review_title: Impressive quality for a good price
review_text: These headphones are pretty comfortable and adjustable. It took me a few days for them to not make ears hurt but I've never used over the ear headphones before. The sound quality is pretty good. Definitely good enough for most everyday situations where you aren't super tuned into the audio quality. The battery lasts forever. You can get multiple days of all day use on a charge. Microphone is good enough. Bluetooth connects instantly. Side controls work. Bass double feature is worthless, just blows away all audio but bass. Highly recommend for $60. Not as good as my wife's Boses, but 80% of the way there.

review_title: NOT for active people! Lounging only, read me!!!
review_text: They work great if you're not active. Taking hard steps, working outside, or just jumping up & down makes the audio crack and cut out really bad. I wish I would've known this beforehand. Perfect for lounging....horrible for being active!

review_title: You get what you pay for.
review_text: Tatal crap. Do not by. Bottom line. Spend the extra money on higher quality headphones. You can't turn these up with out them buzzing. I didn't return them. Crap is crap, taking the loss.

I absolutely love these headphones. I had to purchase them due to moving to remote teaching. I opened the box and was a little hesitant at first. However, once I put them on I haven't taken them off. My family even teases me saying they should never have suggested using headphones. :) I love them that much. They are super comfortable as I wear them for 8 hours or more a day. They have great noise cancellation. If you are looking for an inexpensive set of headphones that have the same quality as others then get these. You will not regret it!

review_title: great value for the price + good customer service
review_text: I got these headphones as a gift and they're a great value for the price (I put them on my wish list after seeing them recommended on Wirecutter). They have solid sound quality, are very comfortable, and seem to be very sturdy as well. I did have an issue with my original pair making a loud popping noise (almost like a cable was loose) with increasing frequency when the noise cancelling was on and they were jostled (e.g., stepping off a curb while walking or going down stairs). I emailed customer service and after I tested everything on a single short list of troubleshooting suggestions with no success, they were happy to exchange what I had for a new pair, and the process was fast and simple. Several weeks in to the new pair with no issues and I'm happy with both the product and the service!

These headphones are awesome. I love the feel and battery life. The sound quality is very good for the price. I had an issue with the headphones where they would randomly boot up. I called the customer service they were awesome! They sent me a new set right away and I haven't had a issue. I have bought other products from Anker. I will continue to shop with them again.

I bought and then returned a number of full over the ear headphones as well as TWS in-ear wireless headphones. This one was by far the most comfortable and best sounding of the bunch. Works great so far.
Want to use it while working outside, mowing the yard and inside to listen to my devices

This product had good sound and noice cancellation until it broke during my Zoom meeting. I don't know how, I just took the headphones off and a plastic part holding the ear part just...broke? I'm so disappointed and also perplexed. There's no other visible damage or scratches and I was taking them off my head (didn't drop them). I think the plastic part of the headphones is poorly made.
Good quality audio and noise cancellation but the bluetooth connection is dropping every ten or so seconds.

I use these headphones often. Are they the best ones out there no are they very good for the price yes. I also have a pair of Sony wh-1000xm3 and these are not as good but, the Sony's cost 4 times as much. I wear these as my daily walk the dog and outside work like cutting the grass. My Sony headphones only come out when I am flying.

review_title: Popping sound when adjusting, removing, or putting on headphones
review_text: These headphones worked well for a couple months after purchase but in the past couple weeks they have started making a terrible popping noise when I adjust them on my head or go to remove them. Its loud and its concussive nature hurts my ears. While most aspects of the headphones work well this issue makes them unusable for me.

This unit has been great for working from home. My favorite feature is the ease of Bluetooth connectivity to different devices. I have connected these to my phone, laptop, and iPad - and easily can switch between the devices. Something I've had trouble with another brand of headphones. For the price - they are comfortable, the noise-canceling feature works great, and the sound is good. The only drawback is that they may be a little too big for my head - and I have to adjust them every 15-20 minutes so that there isn't too much pressure pushing down on my ears, but it's not so bad that it bothers me while I'm working.

review_title: Finally a good pair of headphones that don't break the bank
review_text: These headphones sound amazing, there is so much bass. I watch a lot of YouTube videos with people forging things, and it's amazing to hear the depth of the power hammer's hump.

These are good headphones. The construction is pretty solid. Yes, it’s mainly plastic, but it’s not cheap or flimsy - not beats quality obviously, but still good quality for the price range. It has fairly good sound. It obviously depends on what you’re streaming from (some Spotify songs are better quality than others) but it’s good quality. The only thing I have to note is the bass isn’t the greatest, even with bass up on, but it’s still pretty good - just a thing to note if your picky. The mic quality is fine. I’ve been told it sounds clear and good quality, from people I’ve talked to through the headphones. I’ve connected it to a variety of devices via Bluetooth (even my Nintendo switch via Homespot Bluetooth connector), and it was always very easy. Batter life seems fine, I always have noise cancelling on, but it’s too early to really decide. One downside of these is that they’re a bit on the larger side. Making the band a smidge smaller would make them more comfortable for me - and I’m an adult (probably wouldn’t recommend for kids).

review_title: CAUSED INFLAMED EARS AND BUMPS ON FACE
review_text: My ears are inflamed and swollen and the skin on the side of my face right in front of each ear is covered in red bumps. I don't know what the ear cups are coated in but it must be bad. I normally am not allergic to much of anything. Other than that...they were pretty good. Noise cancelling was ok but not the best.

Live these headphones. Great quality of material and sound. The only issue I have and to me it’s kind of a big one is that they feel a little loose on the head. If I’m laying down or leaning my head foreword in any way they begin to slide off, although it’s not a huge problem it really bugs me. Other than that I love these!

review_title: Best bang for buck noise cancelling out there.
review_text: I bought these specifically for a 30 hour round trip flight to Japan and they were worth every penny. I was flying with a friend who was using the Sony WH1000XM3's and I A/B compared them back and forth multiple times to test the noise cancelling and I could not tell a difference. The Sony's were more comfortable and had better sound, but the active noise cancelling was my main focus and for $60, I can't imagine anything being any better.

I have had these amazing headphones for about a few weeks and use them a lot throughout the day. They are VERY good for the price. The sound is good for what I paid- very good bass. The noise cancellation - it is there but not as good as other brands and why this got a 4/5 but for the price it is decent. The buttons are well laid and easy to use as well. Overall VERY good headset for the price.

review_title: nothing fancy, just a good value
review_text: They are made out of plastic so they don't look as fancy as a lot of headphones, but they are comfortable and work well.

I use these headphones at work to listen to interviews. I share an office space with several people and there is constant foot traffic and phones ringing. The noise cancelling is a blessing. It allows me to concentrate on my task without being interrupted by inter office interference. I do listen to music from time to time and I really like how good they sound. Sharp, Crisp, Loud, and very Clear. They also hold their charge well and tell you the power status when you first turn them on. I have never lost blue tooth connection. I can walk office to office and still maintain connection. Only downfall is my ears get hot inside the muffs and I start to sweat where the ear pads contact my face, But I can deal with that.

review_title: Anker Always Delivers above its price
review_text: I am a long time user of Anker products and these headphones perform well above their price point. No they aren't as great as the Bose but they are pretty close.

Pairs easily with my iPhone, sometimes I need to have my Android forget it and rediscover to connect but that's not a deal breaker for me. I don't hear much of a difference with the noise cancelling on or off but I've also only used them at home for work calls (great headset option) and to watch tv after my wife goes to bed. Headphones are comfy and for $60 I'm floored by the quality of the sound, my wife's noise cancelling Bose headphone sound better IMO but not 4x better, definitely recommend these to anyone who is unsure about spending a ton on noise cancelling headphones. Couldn't get them to pair with my windows 10 computer but I sit close enough to that to be wired up

I need a pair of noise cancellation headphone for occasional purposes. This one fits my needs pretty well. The price is very good. Sound quality, noise reduction, battery life, built quality are all good but not the best. I still use my Beats and Apple earbuds but getting to use this one more and more. I previously brought a pair of Bose. While Bose was much better in noise cancellation and sound quality, but the short battery life, the dependency on the Bose app, the problematic bluetooth connections (I own multiple apple devices sharing same login) just forced me to return it. I won't be too picky about sound quality because no headphone is going to do better than my home speakers. So far, the only problem I found is that you can't charge and use the phone at the same time. The charging mode automatically turn off the phone.

I bought this to replace my old bluetooth headset, as my previous pair was uncomfortable on my ears. After using this for about 20 minutes, I can say these are super comfortable! They are great at noise cancelling, and I love that I can control the ANC.

review_title: Great pair of blutooth headphones at a low price.
review_text: The sound quality of these are truly amazing for Bluetooth headphones! The price is fantastic for such quality. The range of these from the device is very far, with no loss of sound quality. This my first purchase of an Anker product, and I will definitely consider buying their brand again!

review_title: Really wanted to like these -- but design flaw with Noise cancellation
review_text: Products fit well, sound good and have excellent battery life. HOWEVER, there is a design flaw when Noise cancellation is enabled. You cannot move or touch the headphones with NC on. Otherwise a very loud crackle is hear through them - repeatedly - every time they are touched. I really wanted to like this .... The customer service is good - swapped them - but new pair still has the same flaw. PLEASE FIX THIS - i want to own these again

These sound good, except that they are tuned for a TON of low bass. That said, I use an audio player app that has a graphic equalizer, and these sound much better with a significant reduction in the 25-40 Hz range (yes, they do rumble down to frequencies way down down in the low 20's!). Bluetooth range is excellent, as is phone call audio. I haven't tried these in the wired configuration. Active Noise canceling feature does a good job of removing low frequency noise (HVAC, for example), but does not block out conversations or other higher frequency signals beyond the passive reduction offered by the over-the-ear form factor. A mild white noise is also audible in the headphones when active noise canceling is engaged.

review_title: Wondering how they work with Fire Tablets and Audio Books?
review_text: I needed a pair of noise cancelling headphones to help reduce the noise I hear while at work. I work for a production company with many machines running throughout the day. They are not loud, easy to converse over if you raise your voice a bit. There are also a couple of radios being used, tuned to different stations. At times, I can hear both above the sounds of the motors and blowers. It takes a little more concentration on my part to keep my focus on the book I'm listening to and do my job. I mostly listen to audio books while I'm working. I have been using ear buds, which are good, but at times I wished I could hear less of what was around me to reduce distractions when things get busy and have better sound quality. Also, ear buds have a tendency to start to fall out of my ears when I'm moving around a lot, further reducing the quality of sound. I ordered these over the weekend and received them midweek, sooner than expected. They were nicely packaged, coming with a soft pouch for storing, a cable to plug them in instead of using Bluetooth if I wanted, a charging cable, and instructions. Syncing them with my Fire tablet was a breeze. My husband and I tested them to see how well the noise cancelling worked. With an audio book on pause, I could almost hear him. With the book playing (volume at 50%), it was very difficult to make out his words. When I tried music, I could hear it more than I liked while the book was paused, but the narrator drowned it out fairly well while keeping the volume at about 50%. I knew it may not reduce the sound of music and voices very much, but I was desperate enough to give them a try anyway. I have worked two days now, using them most of my shift. Here is the breakdown: Comfort: I wear glasses. A couple times I day I need to adjust the cans to reduce the pressure on the ends of the bows. I have had problems in the past with anything over my ears putting pressure on them and my skull leading to headaches. The slight adjustments helped avoid that issue. They are not tight on my head and aren't too heavy to wear all day since I take them off during breaks. They do get a little warm, but not uncomfortably so. Sound quality: What an improvement over ear buds! The narrators' voices are richer with the extra bass and not having to compete with background noise. I have not tried them with music and I have not yet played with the equalizer, the bass set at factory default. Noise cancelling: I was very happy by the end of the first day. With the noise cancelling turned on, I could no longer hear the noise from the machines. Voices and music were muted enough I could ignore them and focus on the narrator. Controls: Once you get used to which can has which buttons, it's easy to use. The left side had the power and noise cancelling buttons. They are distinct in feel so its easy to turn noise cancelling on and off without accidentally turning the headphones off. The right can has the play/pause and volume control buttons. They also are used for the equalizer. The pause button is slightly recessed, making it fairly easy to find. Overall, I am very happy with these headphones. No noise cancelling feature on the market, from what I understand, will totally cancel out background noise. And, where I work, that's probably a good thing. I do need to be able to hear some things. They are well worth the price.

Going from corded to cordless is definitely a game changer. I was worried the mic wouldn't be useful for audio/video conferencing but have gotten no complaints and the sound quality for both conferencing and listening to music is excellent. I highly recommend these headphones!
Better than expected

review_title: Great for such a low price
review_text: Above my expectations for such a low price. Very light and comfortable wore them for several hours without any discomfort on my ears. Also work great plugged in with an aux cord
Noise cancellation not as good

I took a shot with these to get a comfortable over-ear headset with a mic clear enough to use for work calls. I'm on them a few hours a day, and my on-ear headset with external mic hurt my ears after an hour or two and some of my calls are 3+ hours. I've used Anker sport headphones, and their charging cables and battery pack and they've all been great, so I knew these would have good battery and sound, but wasn't sure I could get by without a mic like a headset has. Boy am I happy! The mic is perfectly clear for my coworkers, they're amazingly comfortable, and, as I expected, the battery absolutely meets their "up to" estimate. I can go 3 or 4 days of calls without recharging them. So, let's talk about bass. The bass-boosting definitely increases the bass, to the point where I had to turn it off for a song that had a lot of bass-drum. However, it's more of a trade-off rather than addition.
