You lose some of the clarity of the treble and you have to turn the volume up. But the quality of sound doesn't go down, you just need to decide if you want highs or lows. But it's very quick and easy to turn it on and off. But what about noise-cancelling? Now, I've never had noise cancelling before, so I wasn't sure what to expect. I'm both impressed and unimpressed from what I expected. For unimpressed, with it on, external noise doesn't seem any quieter than with it off. But, it does cancel what I would consider "distortion." Everything, external and internal, sounds crisp and clear. The most noise-cancelling effect I can tell is that the noise from your body disappears. Imagine putting a sea-shell to your ear and hearing your blood-flow echo through it. Then, you push a button, and it's silenced. That's what it's like. You can kind of hear the flow and vibrations of your body and voice inside the headphones, but with cancellation on there is only external noise. Which means while listening to music or calls, you only hear their voice with no distortion at all. It's honestly fantastic. But, again, if you're looking for these to make the outside world silent, not gonna happen. Comfort? Holy crap. I get headaches from computer screens, so I have these prescription glasses that filter glare and makes it comfortable. I'm on a computer all day, and with my on-ear headset I either had to pick the headset or my glasses. There was too much discomfort to have the glasses under them. With these Ankers however, I can wear both. There is no pressure against my ears, so there's no discomfort there. And the padding is so soft, theres also no noticeable pressure where the frame contacts my head/padding. So, if you're someone with glasses, these will work for you no problem. Probably. Overall, they're everything I nervously hoped for. I know this may seem a bit over the top for headphones, but they've made that big of a difference in my work day.

I was really excited about these headphones, I used them for about three months and they were fantastic, especialyl given the price. However, about two weeks ago, the headphones stopped charging (previously they had charged very quickly and without a problem), now I am unable to charge them at all. I've tried multiple charge cords and charing blocks, but i am now only able to use them as wired headphones. Really disappointed.

I use this in my office for the noise cancelling aspect and to listen to music. I recently had a battery charging issue. On contacting Anker, we went through a troubleshooting process and determined that the headset was defective. I received a replacement within a few days. I am now using the replacement with no issues. The product is good and the support excellent.

I’m not an audio file so I can’t speak to any technical aspects but as far as I’m concerned these headphones work perfectly. They sound great, they fit great and the noise canceling works as it is supposed to. Delivery was fast! I recommend this to everyone especially for the price!

review_title: Amazing Product, but Just "Good" Noise Cancelation
review_text: The build quality, sound quality, wireless connection strength, and battery life of these headphones is incredible. I think that they are the best value headphones I've every bought. They sounds as good as my Senn HD280s. The only downside is that the active noise cancellation doesn't work nearly as well as some systems I've tested (Here One Earbuds, Airpod Pro, Bose QC), but does cut out most consistent noise.
No es igual a lo explicado en la reseña del producto tiene buen sonido pero no opaca el ruido total.el bulumen no alcanza el máximo.
I had an issue with the headphones charging. As simple as 1,2,3, I reached out to customer service, explained my issue and they sent me a new pair.

review_title: Good sound quality and noise cancellation. below average in terms of connectivity
review_text: I am writing this review after using these for 2 weeks. QUALITY: 5/5 Initially when I received this product, I was pleasantly surprised at the amazing sound quality as well as noise cancellation features. I must say that I am not much into music but more into podcasts and use it for making calls. I must say that the sound quality is better than my expectations and the mic works pretty well too! I talk to friends as well as join my office meetings and haven't had any issues in this regard. . COMFORT: 3/5 While the headphones are flexible to a degree, they aren't as flexible as other headphones I've seen. It sits over my ears pretty well and my ears do not feel suffocated initially. However, the material isnt the best out there and I visibly saw that my ears got sweaty after using it for a while. This is when the flexibility comes into the fray. The headphones are flexible in such a way that you can not tilt the ear muffs so that they face towards the ear but not exactly cover the ear to give my sweaty ear some kinda relaxation.you can do that by flipping over the headset and switching the sides (Left over right and right over left).I do go to the gym regularly but I really cant see these lasting long in the gym because I do sweat it out a lot in the gym and my indoor experiences with this pair has made me reconsider if I should ever use these in the gym. CONTROL & ACCESSIBILITY: 4/5 I noticed that when I used it on my laptop, it pauses Youtube videos or any media while playing but fails to play it up back again. The buttons are convenient to use. CONNECTIVITY: 2/5 this has been MY BIGGEST PROBLEM to date. I have noticed that if these headphones are connected to 2 devices (laptop & phone), there are connectivity issues every 3 or 4 hours which requires me to reconnect to the device every now and then which is a BIG BIG CON for me. Sometimes, this is also preceded by muffled or shreiky sounds. . The decision of buying these headphones can be made on the basis of the above listed points and your expectations or utilization of the item.

The item performed very well for the price offered, descent play time, maybe 18 hours on a single charge with bass and noise canceling in use. Noticeable change with sound canceling but nothing profound, again good for the price. HOWEVER, the item STOPPED ACCEPTING A CHARGE this week. No change to how, where, how long or any charging methods or hardware used, just stopped charging out of the blue. No changes in usage, hasn't been transported as I'm participating in grad school lectures from home and the device just quit. I've reached out to the manufacturer, will update with their resolution, I'm well within my 18m warranty period.

review_title: Not Bose, but for the price one of the best.
review_text: Dont let the low cost fool you. Noise cancellation is very good and cups are comfortable. Best low cost headphones I've ever purchased.

I bought a pair of Bose and these at the same time. I have to use the headphones for tv while my wife works from home. I can wear these comfortably all day. My ears start hurting after an hour in the Bose. I have fallen asleep with these on.

review_title: Great headphones with a few hiccups
review_text: I love these headphones. The only two issues I've had with these is that 1) the smallest setting is still slightly too big for my head, so they tend to slide around a bit. 2) the Bluetooth tends to disconnect at random, and I've noticed that the headphones turn off at random times as well when used for a prolonged period of time. The battery is fully charged when this happens, and when the Bluetooth disconnects it happens when I've been sitting in the same exact spot the entire time. Still don't know why that happens, but other than that I really enjoy the sound and the battery life, and the noise cancelling feature is quite wonderful!

These are great for the price! I couldn't tell much of a difference with the noise canceling on or off unless I had the volume at full blast. That being said, just having it over your ears blocks a lot of sound. If you are getting these for noise canceling I would spend the $200-$300 for an amazing pair that blocks out everything. These are super comfortable also! I have several ear piercings and wear glasses and these never bothered either of those. I actually forgot I had them on. I also do a bit of woodworking and wear goggles over my glasses and the headphones were still comfortable to wear.
The headphones are not very comfortable and I have a problem with the audio stuttering that I haven't experienced with other headphones.

I got these for a two reasons: 1) I hate earbuds because they hurt my ears after a while and they get lost easily, and 2) I also hate on-ear headphones because they also hurt after a while. So I really wanted over-ear headphones that rest on the head and not on the ear. These really are comfortable, I've fallen asleep wearing them and wake up in the morning, no pain! As for sound quality, they sound great, no complaints. The noise cancellation is pretty good; not perfect, and when there is no audio playing there is a faint audible 'white noise' sound, but when normal audio is playing these gripes are imperceptible, at least to me. Battery life is also very good, like I said I'll wake up in the morning the next day and they'll still be on. Great value.

I always use wireless earbuds or headphones with 2 devices, my computer and mobile phone. This device does not connect my computer or phone automatically, always I have to make on/off the headphone and then Bluetooth of the device I need to use. Previously, I was using a 19 USD cheap headphone that connects my phone and computer automatically, and use both at the same time.

review_title: Very Happy with Quality and Comfort
review_text: My teenage son and I are very happy with the headphone qualities of external noise reduction and richness of sound. They are very comfortable after hours of wear, a quality that my son, especially, values when he falls asleep wearing them.
This isn’t compatible for Sony Android TV. Works well overall and with all iPhone devices. Sound quality is good. Battery life is also good and comes full a full day with moderate to heavy use.

review_title: Bought it for my kid and it was so nice I kept it for me...
review_text: This MUST be the best dollar for dollar NC overear headphones! I'v been flying for six years, and used many different brands and vouch for these puppies. First the price, which I admit was so low that it make me doubt these would be anywhere close to impressive... I bought them for my kids, to save myself from getting mad when they broke them... The package arrive and they were nicely presented, i did not expected that... The manual was easy ti understand and, of course there was the need to charge them before the initial use... I was blown away by how nicely they fold and stow (they do so in the same way my Bose do)... I tried them and was WOWed immediately these freaking things get 80-90% of the job tgat the Bose pair does, and for a fraction of the cost! .... a quick comparison for folks that are familiar with Bose: So, FIRST, on max volume these wont blast off as loud as the Bose, but the blast off enough so your ears hurt and you can listen to dialogue while seating a good 10ft from the head set (they are not the loudest, but mire than loud enough). SECOND, they are just as comfortable as the best brands (I have a Bose set for travel and a Turtle Beach for gaming and the if I had my eyes closed and someone else put these on me the ONLY difference is that the material of the earmuffs on my expensive sets is "gucci AF", - one is like silky and the other is cashemereish - these ones are leathery) THIRD and last, the battery life, I do t know how they did it, but the battery life on these suckers is better than my other sets, in fact I been charging them here and there out of precaution (I left one of them blasting off at full volume for at least 12hrs with NC extra bass on and used them for another week or so about 2hrs a day - I ended up plugging them because I did not want to drain the battery all the way down and run out of juice mid-use). Amazing product, I an buying two or three more.

review_title: Nice set of headphones but be careful if you have a small head.
review_text: So far these are a great pair of headphones. They sound pretty good and feel comfortable. I definitely don't regret the purchase so far.

Pros: * Very comfortable * Well made quality * Great volume and blue tooth connection * Great price * Good noise canceling, garage door engine noise. Cons: *Noise canceling won't block all of a lawn mower but blocks 75%
On the smallest setting the headband is still an inch from the top of my head! What were they thinking?! ?

I generally like Anker products. These headphones are pretty decent but do have some flaws. Ill start with the good. They are comfortable to wear. The ear cups enclose my entire ear despite seeming small. The battery seems to last long even with everything turned on. The noise canceling is quite good. As others have said it doesnt cancel out higher frequencies but that is acceptable to me and may not even been possible for all I know. Also as others have said, they are quite bass-y, which is fine with me. A couple negatives is that even as moderate volume the sound seems to get crackly in the higher frequencies. Also automatic pairing with bluetooth can be spotty. Sometimes it will connect by itself and others I have to manually make it connect, but once it is the connection is solid. I can walk across the house and still have perfect sound.

review_title: Great cans from a great company (at a great price no less)
review_text: I've bought Anker products before so when I was in the market for a quality set of headphones I checked this brand first. I bought the wireless earbuds for my wife and I was impressed with the sound quality from such a small package. Someone from Anker needs to tell me if these have the same graphene drivers as the earbuds because I just gotta know (I'm geeky like that). I use these for gaming, YouTube and occasional music and I am pleasantly delighted by the sound quality. What's impressed me the most is the spacial effect I'm getting while gaming. I can hear sound transitioning around me while I'm playing and this blows me away. I don't pick up on that via YouTube but listen to the new Tool album and it's there again. I can't speak to the bass boost because I just haven't found a need for it yet. I am particularly amazed at the noise dampening ability of these headphones. If you expect perfection you are looking for the impossible. It took me a while to pick up on just how effective these are. I have a water fountain/bowl (for the cats) that makes a lot of noise when the level is low. I had been gaining for a while and it hit me as soon as I took these off. I also have to take them off when someone is talking to me. Really the only thing I'd like to see on these is a swappable battery. With that said I have every reason to believe that I'll get great battery life. I just don't like the idea that I have to throw away an otherwise great product for something as simple as a battery. In closing I'd buy these all day at $100 but I'm glad I didn't have to. And yeah I'll continue to buy Anker products because they just work.
Nice to get such great quality for a reasonable price.

review_title: I use these everyday for general use.
review_text: I love these for the price. I thought about buying BOSE or some other brand but ended up buying these for the value. I use them to connect to my TV when my daughter is asleep, or to game, or anytime I don't want to listen to my wife(most of the time). The work great for general use, never drop off, and the battery lasts a long while. I love them and they are much more comfortable than the in ear ones that came with my phone.

I have a wide range of Anker products ranging from charging cables to projectors and Anker never disappointed me with their super quality products. This is a great noise canceling headphones with 40hr playtime. Can’t ask for more in a $70 headphones! !

review_title: Solid all around at a great value.
review_text: Solid build, look and feel. Easy to pair and work within minutes. Great value. Comfortable and perfect for home office conference webex. Voice crystal clear.
Worth the money. Good Noise cancelling Bluetooth headphones. Holds up charge for hours and days... Good for office and while mowing lawn ...

review_title: Poor sound quality, and lots of distracting white noise
review_text: Even though the headphones manage to cancel some external noise, they produce a significant amount of distracting white noise. This makes them quite uncomfrotable to use.

One of the best purchases I've made on Amazon. Can't recommend these enough. Noise cancelling works great. Good bass (the bass boost seems to add too much). Super comfortable, used it to work from home in my basement and heard nothing going on upstairs all day (3 kids) and it didn't get uncomfortable. Great sound. And the battery length, 60 hours w/out noise cancelling is super awesome. Got on and sale and would buy again in a heartbeat

As all reviewers have noted, these headphones are good value and, while my overall rating is a 3, I would rate them a 3.5. I purchased these mid January and they have particularly been helpful to get some alone time during self-isolation. They do a pretty good job at canceling noise and I particularly like that you can turn the noise cancelation on and off. They fit comfortably and the battery life is great. My main complaints with the headphones are that there have been occasional times that I put them on and suddenly hear loud static that hurts my ears, I'm not sure what causes this. Also, after owning them for three months, the right headphone is noticeably louder than the left. I imagined that this budget model would last for at least a year but I worry that I'll have to replace them sooner with the unequal noise. All in all, I recommend these noise canceling headphones for their great value but you may want to handle them with care to ensure the longest life possible.

review_title: Great product for the price. Even better customer service
review_text: The product themselves were great. I use the vents in the restroom to test out the noise canceling features, and you can notice a significant difference. The sound quality leaves little to be desired, though there could be some improvement. If you have fat fingers like me, the volume buttons could be a bit of an issue, but its easy to navigate once you've got a feel for them. The customer service representatives were hands down the best I've had to deal with while being on Amazon. Anker takes there products very seriously and will work with you to address any issues you may have. These guys are amazing.

These are good for the price, especially when on sale which seems to happen fairly often. I'm sure they don't stack up to Bose, but hey, it's Bluetooth. If we cared about sound quality, we'd be hard wiring. Bass is respectable and the bass boost is noticeable but may be too much depending on the kind of music you are into. Overall clarity and definition is better than their price range. I listen to a wide range of music from Hard Rock to Fold and Acoustic and I am rarely disappointed by the sound of these. The best feature is that they seem to play forever on a charge. Maybe if you're one of these people who hides from the world and has music in your ears every waking minute, you'll disagree, but I can go almost a week on a charge with a mix of videoconferencing and music for multiple hours a day. I also find them to be a very comfortable design to wear for an hour or more at a time. They are fairly secure but I would not recommend them for anything past light activity and mostly when stationary at your desk or in bed.

I love the clarity of sound that these Anker Soundcore Life Headphones bring to my music and podcasts. The treble and bass are perfectly balanced and the Bluetooth is easy to pair up with my computer. I don't like ear buds so these over the ear headphones are perfect for me. When I want to tune the world out, the noise cancellation feature is just what I need. These are the perfect headphones for my needs.
Good noise cancelling headphones. I've never owned a pair, but this was just the right price, since I don't use them that often. I would recommend these.
Not disappointed with this product. It is everything that I expected and works great.

review_title: Powerful noise canceling, great value for price
review_text: I was looking for a pair of Bluetooth, wireless and noise canceling headphones for under $100 as a temporary replacement for my broken Beats. I ended up finding these, under $50(!) and have been incredibly pleased with the quality of the headphones. The noise canceling feature is really powerful, for even the loudest of background noises. A godsend for ADHD. The battery quality is very good as well, however it does take a while to charge to charge from dead-full battery. I usually do it overnight as it takes a few hours. However, the battery lasts forever - and even with days of constant use, I’ve never had them die on me. The sound quality is relatively mediocre. It’s to be expected for what you’re paying for, and nothing I’d complain about. The Bluetooth feature is easy, and has been compatible with both my iPhone X and MacBook Pro with no issues. If you use these while laying on your side, you do get that loud screech sound some people have mentioned - but I’ve just learned to avoid that. For phone calls and FaceTime the sound can be a little garbly with some echo, but I primarily use this for music and the noise canceling feature. Overall, I’m really impressed with the quality of these headphones - especially given the price, and would definitely recommend them if you’re in the market for a lower priced Bluetooth wireless set.

review_title: Sounds great, happy with my purchase!
review_text: For the price, these are a great deal. I can't imagine that $200+ headphones would sound much better, but I'm not an audiophile. Easy to connect via bluetooth and battery life is very good. Recommended.

The noise cancellation adds a fair amount of extra noise, particularly for quieter passages of music. It sounds like a cross between tape hiss and background noise on a weak FM radio station. The noise cancellation works best for low frequency sounds like bumps, thuds, lawnmowers and air conditioners. However it barely does anything for higher pitched sounds like screaming children. The fit is good--snug but not too tight on my much larger than average head. Battery life when using noise cancelling with a wired connection is very good (I haven't tried bluetooth). This is the first set of noise cancelling headphones I've used. I give four stars instead of three because of the relatively low price. If I had it to do over again, I'd probably go with a more expensive model in the hopes of getting better sound quality.

TERRIBLE! The headphones are so large that they don’t fully stay against my head so it doesn’t cancel noise very well. Now I’m petite but I’m not that small! I would think most people under 5’5” would have the same issue (maybe even people taller than that!). I would not recommend these. I also don’t like that it doesn’t come with an actual case. I get the price point is less but I would pay another $5 for a real case. Also they have a strange smell! Overall wouldn’t recommend.

review_title: Good value, inexpensive, works well, reliable.
review_text: Using the hell out of the thing, especially during telework, and its held up very well. A great low investment option with high returns given the entry level price. No, its not up to par with Bose or Beats, but it cost a sixth of the price. Controls are comparatively clunky, wish it had a mute on the headset, but I manage. Controls are straightforward to use, just not state of the art. It’s good on trips. Works well with in flight systems. The sound is pretty good. I’m no audiophile, sounds fine to me. It charges quickly and holds a charge for many hours. I fly to Asia frequently and it gets me through the flight. My complaint is that the noise cancelling is weak. I find that a noise cancelling app does a better job.
Works well. Connected to my phone easily and calls are clear. Connected to TV quickly with no problem. NC is good, battery life is good. Very pleased with the purchase, good value.

Very good headphones! There's really nothing to complain about other than comfort but it could be due to the effective Noise cancellation Pros: - Build quality - Sound - Noise cancellation - Price Cons: - Comfort (can get a bit hot when using in bed)

It worked great until i had to charge it. Nothing happened when I plugged it to the charger. I went to the forums and it turns out it's a common issue. I was sent a replacement and hopefully, this one is not faulty.

review_title: Broke after around 3 months of use
review_text: Do not buy are poorly constructed barely held together by a small metal piece with cheap plastic that broke. The sound quality and noise cancel was great plus good battery life but if it breaks then what is the point.
Works great. Good price.

review_title: Perfect for watching Apple TV in silence
review_text: I use these headphones to watch Apple TV in silence so as to not disturb my sleeping husband. Although noise cancellation isn’t as good as some higher-end headphones, it’s perfect for my use. It’s amazing how many more details I hear on my shows/movies versus listening through speakers.

review_title: Very Happy, I Use Them Everyday
review_text: When I first got these, there was an issue with one of the speakers. I reached out to customer support and they helped troubleshoot the issue but ultimately sent a replacement. Since then I've had no problems. These are great headphones for the price.

review_title: Great Quality! Beats out my old High End Headphones
review_text: I bought these as a replacement for my high-end headphone I demolished on a long haul flight! I will say. I went on a 12hr flight and connected to an 8hr flight and I loved them! They did their thing! The Noise Cancellation and the Base-Up feature is all I need! I travel a lot for work and pleasure and I must say they are sooo good I had to order 2 more as gifts for my best friends! They Loved them too!! Anker always has the best products and I refuse to stray away.
Excellent product for the price very good Bass!

For the price I am happy with these headphones. The noise cancellation works pretty well but doesn't drown out everything completely but does a good job. The sound quality is decent but not fantastic, sometimes the sound fades in and out but it's usually temporary. The volume is very good though. Overall these are a good pair of noise cancelling headphones and are worth the price.
Super comfortable earphones that cancel out noise and distraction. I love them. I bought them for my podcast but use them all the time! Great buy for under $100.
The sound quality, material, and having not too many buttons to fiddle with is great.
Pros: Price, Easy Setup, Comfortable, Lightweight, Bluetooth 5.0 Cons: MicroUSB (prefer USB-C at this point), Can't charge and listen at the same time
Great buy

For the price these are a win! Great/clear sound, BIG bass (even w/o turning on the bass boost.) I think they're made of plastic but looks and feels premium. They're also relatively lightweight w/ super soft earcups and phone conversations are clear. No Anker Soundcore app support for sound customization and whatnot but I'm cool w/ that.

I bought these headphones about 4 months ago, and I am totally satisfied with them. The audio quality is great, as is the noise cancellation. The battery life is fantastic--I can literally use them for days before recharging. I was using them on my daily commute to work on public transportation (train and bus), and I could retreat into my own private world of music (or movies). With COVID-19, I'm telecommuting; so, I haven't been using them as much--just on my electric bicycle rides to the store and other essential errands. (These are not designed to use while exercising because they are not sweat resistant.) TOTALLY SATISFIED WITH THIS PURCHASE.

review_title: Frustrated...they are turning off every 20 minutes of use
review_text: So, the quality overall is ok, given the price...when they are working. I just got these and have only been using them for 2 days. Today they are only working for about 20 minute chunks of time, then they turn off. I turn them back on and they run for another 20 minutes...and so on. They are charged and the battery is full. It is not fun to use them when the just turn off on my every 20 minutes. Otherwise, the quality is good!

I read the reviews about the headphones being large. I have a normal-sized head for a female and they fit. Leaning forward they slid a bit, but otherwise are fine. They are comfortable. The sound quality is excellent for the cost. My complaint is the poor, lacking information in the user manual. It is on their website as well if you want to check it out. Not quite sure why they state to have the headphones off when trying to pair them to your device.

I liked these headphones very much. I originally bought them to replace a very old pair of Bose noise-canceling headphones. The Bluetooth function worked well, noice-canceling was very good, and sound quality excellent. However, after only a couple of months of very gentle use (used only at a desk for a couple of hours a day, 2-3 days a week), audio died in the left headphone. Generally, I'm a huge Anker fan, but these were terribly disappointing.
Great value, great sound, easy to connect and comes with an aux option. What more do you need?

review_title: Sounds great, but doesn't get real loud.
review_text: Has great quality audio, but doesn't get as loud as I'd like. Bass is decent. My wife can be sitting next to me on the couch and I can't hear her when she talks. Great sound isolation!

review_title: Garbage. Quit working entirely after less than 4 hours of cumulative use
review_text: I bought these for occasional use, price was decent, as you'd expect by my low review, you get what you pay for. I bought these in Dec 2019, used them maybe 4 hours total as I don't listen to much. In any event they have a red light on them now permanently (as long as it has power). None of the buttons on it will make it respond in any way It will not power on, or off, or do anything. Super disappointing even for the price I paid. I normally regard Anker products to be decent, with regard to replacement batteries, or portable chargers etc. Probably wouldn't buy anything besides those again. I have reached out to the seller, Anker Direct, and depending on what they elect to do, I may modify this review if they make it right.

review_title: Solid affordable headphones. No discomfort while wearing glasses.
review_text: Overall, I really love them. They easily pair to different devices (tv, phone, tablets). Sound quality is pretty good. Cushions are soft. I wear them with glasses, and I was concerned about the comfort; they haven't caused me any pain or discomfort after hours of use at a time. They feel a little loose on my head and wiggle a little when I move around. However, I think that is part of the reason that they also don't cause me pain while wearing glasses. People with narrower heads may prefer a fit that is more snug though.

review_title: Best Price Value and Premium Design
review_text: So I thought to review this product after first complete battery usage. And my thoughts are... It has a very decent sound quality, volume levels and especially good "Noise Cancellation" quality. The NC is not ultra/super (if you are expecting) but at this price value you are getting the very very best option in all features. Indeed the battery last as up to expectations. The build quality is solid and the design is most beautiful thing I love about it. It has a premium looking design and build. I also accidentally dropped it once but it got no damage or scratch at all. There are so comfortable to wear for hours but I do recommend to wear it off for long. Without NC its still very air tight. It takes 3 hours to charge which is nice. Apart from getting one USB cable, you are also getting a very nice and high quality pouch. I do recommend this product.

review_title: Great quality for a great price
review_text: You cant beat the quality you get for the price. I got these at the beginning of the COVID-19 Pandemic when my company shifted to work from home. With 7 people now in my home I now was required to have something to stop the constant screaming of 3 kids that are 3 and under. These did the trick. With the 60 hour battery life they are magical. One charge and we are set to go for the entire work week. I charged them when I needed on the weekend and we are ready for the week. The built in mic could be a little better since it doesn't extend down to your mouth but thats nothing really to complain about. So what can I complain about? connectivity I suppose. I do connect it between my phone and the computer. And trying to get it to switch between the two devices is cumbersome. But that seems to be with almost any device, so even that is not a big deal. The range on the headset is phenomenal depending on the device I am connected to. On my old laptop its okay, but on the S20+ its great! These are highly recommended.

I like the more bass-heavy sound. The sound quality of these speakers is really good, but they don't get very loud. I am clacking away on my mechanical keyboard and it sounds like a faint regular one. The TV in the other room is barely if at all noticeable. Can I tell kids and wife are screaming outside my office? sure, but it's 70% better. I had to buy these, working from home during COVID is driving me crazy with all the noise of the family.

They sound great and they look great. I’m not a huge headphone connoisseur, so keep that in mind. I’d recommend these to “the average” person that needs/wants decent noise cancelling headphones under $80.

review_title: Very good but a little big
review_text: I really liked the sounds quality and the controls. It was also very easy to pair. It was just too big for my head lol

review_title: TOP least Expensive compared to CNETS 200. Bests
review_text: GREAT ...But NO instructions. I had to Delete in Computer and re-install 2nd time ..worked great since
Good quality however the device keeps disconnecting and turning off. Yes

review_title: Was great until is stopped working in <4 months
review_text: I purchased these to watch TV in the morning when I could not sleep. The worked great! Good sound. Worth the $60 I paid. Until one morning last week (<4 months after purchase), they stopped working. No power. I charge and I get a red light. No good. And they were gently used. Going from a drawer to my head to the charger. Very gently used. Very disappointed in this product.

review_title: This is not a review for commuters
review_text: I don’t know well this headphones will perform against plains, buses, trains, etc. I don’t use them in those scenarios. If you are like me, though, you needed an inexpensive set of headphones to indulge in music, movies/shows, and the ocasional audiobook in your living room while the family and five dogs are living there too. This are perfect for that domestic pleasure. Great heft, comfortable on the ear, paired via Bluetooth with no problem, excellent sound and volume. Easy to use controls and charges through a regular miniUSB. I have just been using them for a few days and love them. My only surprise was that the ear pieces kind of rotate and they don’t (or I don’t know how) lock them straight. That is great for storage, though, and not a problem for wearing. Really a great buy. Bonus comment: there’s a playlist in Spotify called music to test headphones. It really helps to showcase the sound range of the headphones.

review_title: I’m not a very good judge
review_text: I seldom choose to use headphones so I’m not really a very good judge
They do not live up to their billing.
Comfortable and perform as expected. Extra-long battery life is a plus. Would order them again.

review_title: For the money it is hands down the product to buy!
review_text: It's early, I just received them today but I have several comments based upon other reviews: The quality is perfectly acceptable and actually well above the cost! The function is a little tricky as the instructions really suck....but with a little fiddling around it paired with my Galaxy S10 5G. The fit of the ear pieces is very comfortable, the weight is fine, the NC is really better than most and way better than anything in its price range IMO. I have purchased several NC bluetooth headsets over the past few months looking to replace my trusty old Logitech's that have worked for years. The signal strength is amazing, I can walk from end to end of my house which is 216' long, and go outside on 1400 sq. ft of deck, without a hiccup from the signal using Pandora as a constant! NO other bluetooth has ever accomplished that, laptops, headsets....very high marks! The sound is good with music, although I have little to compare to with lousy tinnitus impacted old eardrums...bass is strong WITHOUT the boost. The microphone for calls has already been heralded by several people....it sounds good and apparently broadcasts just as well! For now, I highly recommend these headphones!

The sound was unremarkable with noise cancelling off, but with it on it was clear, bass was heavy but I thought it was fine, and worked great for streaming at 256kb/s. noise cancelling was just a but worse than air pods pro, but don't expect it to cancel out every noise. It did cancel out about 70% of the noise from my bathroom fan. They only broke when I dropped them in the toilet. recommend

review_title: Really impressed with the performance! Frequently disconnects from phone
review_text: I purchased these since I'm working from home during quarantine with kids in the house. The sound quality is great, and the noise cancelling works better than I expected! However, I have to reconnect to my phone fairly routinely (every hour or so) due to the headphones randomly disconnecting. I don't have this issue with other devices that connect my phone. Not the end of the world. The sound quality is in the $100-$150 price range. This technical issue makes these headphones a good purchase rather than a steal.

review_title: The worst Anker product I've owned!
review_text: Enjoy the headphones for about a month and a half when one day, they stop operating. Anker's customer service did a great job of quickly replacing them. But after a month with the new headphones sound stopped playing in the right ear piece. Very disappointing! I'm done with Anker's headphones. Great customer service. But after this experience I will be hesitant with future product purchases.

The headphones are really good. The sound is full and clean. The mic is another story. Whether using them via Bluetooth or the provided cable, I'm told I sound like I am speaking from the bottom of a well. If all you need is a solid set of headphones, these are great at $60. If you rely on them for work as a wireless headset for phone calls, I would not recommend them.

I got these headphones after returning the Microsoft Surface headphones. I was looking for something a little more affordable and there were quite a few options out there. I went with Anker because I’ve seen their brand around a lot and they seem pretty trustworthy. The headphones themselves accomplish everything the Surface headphones did, except for the controls, for less than half the price. I’m never really a fan of when buttons have multiple functions, but for the price you can’t really beat these headphones. The noise canceling is very effective and not being an audiophile, the sound quality is great. I mostly use these for tv late at night so as not to disturb anyone and they get quite loud, which is perfect. Overall, great noise canceling headphones.

These were given to me as a gift and I'm happy they were. I was getting tired of in ear in buds. These are so comfy and the sound is perfect. The noise cancelling could be better but it's still really great for the price. In could wear them just about all day and feel comfortable where after an hour of in ear buds my ears are irritated and need to take them out. If you like ankers products I definitely recommend these.

review_title: Good Value, but don't buy if you want to use them for exercise
review_text: Great price for what you get. The headphones have a nice sound and are comfortable. Even after wearing them for a long flight. I have noticed that they can slip off your head fairly easily. Also, there is a feedback noise that happens with sharp movement. Sometimes while walking and there is a bit of a bounce the noise will pop up. So, if you're planning on using them for any type of exercise expect that.

review_title: Same problem as others - right out of the box, they won't charge
review_text: Bummed. Tried every cord and USB slot in the house. No luck. Was looking to using these for the many many zoom meetings. Hate to get an exact replacement because it's a known problem and I don't want to return 2 pairs.
Awesome product, highly recommend

review_title: Popping noise and turns off randomly.. it's comfortable tho.
review_text: **update** 4/29/20 11 pm When I connected this to my phone it suddenly said the battery is high. Earlier today around 3 pm it kept saying the battery is medium when its connected to the laptop. I used the aux wire for 2 more hours and then decided to connect it to my phone. For some reason it says the battery is high.. weird. Anyway, I listen to music and never had any problems. No more popping noise. It's not turning off anymore. Hmmm will update again.. might keep it after all. Giving it 4 stars. Ill check in again in one week So I just got this today (04/29/2020). It arrived a day early, and I've been using it for a couple of hours and here's what I noticed about it. 1. It pops, like it would disconnect type of popping noise, and then the music would continue. 2. IT TURNS OFF BY ITSELF and sometimes I won't hear anything when it's on and I have to completely turn it off and turn it back on to reconnect it. Right now it has "medium battery" I'll update again after I charge it. 3. Very comfortable I love that it's around my ears and not sitting on top of it. 4. Audio is kind of basic I do like the bass. If the music is loud enough it's nice 👌 For now I'll be using the wire to continue listening while studying. Just not sure if it's worth keeping. $60 for a hybrid headphone that turns off randomly? Idk we'll see. I'll update again for sure
. When activating the NC the left earphone loses the bass, listening to the bass only in the right earphone, this is something really annoying I prefer not to activate the NC

The headphones are good for what you pay for them. Noise canceling doesn’t work well and the max volume is disappointing but the base is heavy and clean. Overall not a bad product for what you pay for them.
Easy setup. Great sound.

You usually get what you pay for but in this case these headphones exceeded all my expectations. Every genre sounds incredible. Noise cancelling is so good I couldn’t hear the microwave beeping. Bluetooth range is superb. Highly recommended.

This is my first Anker Product and I am actually very surprised. The quality of material is good. Sound is really good and the ablitty to add base it's awesome. The noise canceling future is ok. Headphones itself mute a lot of exterior sounds. Especially when you are playing music. But it does help to have it as extra. I like that they are soft and pretty light. I had already meeting and used this headphones on my laptop. Worked perfect. Clear sound. I wish the charging cable was longer, but it is universal so easy to substitute. Nothing negative to add at this moment.
Performance wise these are fine but they are a bit large for me. I also wear them with glasses and they pinch after about 3O minutes so they weren’t the right product for me!

review_title: Great headphones, Anker never lets me down.
review_text: As others have said, the noice cancellation is a little jacking but everything else is great especially for the price.
Great battery life. Does reduce some sound not all
Love Anker products. Made great works great and priced right.
The noise cancellation works pretty decent and the sound quality is good, especially for the price. Definitely would buy again.

review_title: Good sound quality. Don’t love the weight/fit.
review_text: Great sound quality and noise cancellation. But these are heavy and the rotating ear pieces annoy me. I guess I have a small head. These feel too big.

I'm not an audiophile and I mainly purchased this for its noise cancelling. This audio is great and clear when connected to a phone, PC, and laptop. Not without issues (bottom). Pros: - Very good noise cancelling feature and it is very easy to turn on and off. I often forget that it is noise cancelling. Its just quiet. - Good sound. Not a lot of bass at least to me it doesn't. The sound is clear especially when used for gaming or entertainment purposes. I could really hear what's going on in the scene and area. - Let's me know when battery life is High, Medium, Low. This is great but why not take it a step further by giving a quantitative value - Has decent padding for the crown of the head. (This may change over time) * - Good surrounding the ears. * Cons: - The crown area was tight at first but eventually loosened up and maybe a bit loose for my liking. There have been times when I would quickly move my head and the headphones would slide off. - From my experience the headphones do not turn off on their own when it is disconnected from Bluetooth. My other headphones automatically shuts off after a given time when disconnected from Bluetooth this head set doesn't do that. - Lacks a power indicator to indicate when it is powered on/off/standby mode. There is light to show it is charging. There is a green light when NC is activated but when I turn off the NC feature I can never tell if the headphones are connected or not. NC is on by default. Issues: - There were times when I would have it connected to multiple devices and the headphones would suddenly malfunction and make a very loud screeching noise. It was difficult to turn off the headphones but it eventually stopped either by holding the power button or plugging in the mini usb. - The headphones pulsate A lot when pressed against the ear. - When using the jack with the NC on there is often static. It sometimes happen when using PC or using it with my console controller.
I just got this product today and I already think they are the worst pair of headphones I’ve ever owned. Just get beats the price is high but quality is so much better!

I guess the sound quality threw me off, it's not all good (wirelessly). Also wired isn't that great. Plus the came with a lot of static when in noise cancelling. Because of that, I'm not giving a great review.

review_title: Sound transmitting issues on my Macbook Pro
review_text: Worked great on my flight and works well connecting to my iphone. When connected to my macbook pro, the sound stutters even after setting up the pairing again. Wish there was a firmware fix for this!
The only thing I dont like them is that they swivel. It always feels like they are falling off your head. I was not very upset after learning the big hi dollar ones swivel too.

I ordered these for my son, as he likes to listen to music during his break at work but ambient noise is rather loud and can interfere. When I saw these; I realized that this would be a great option. What I Like: Had not heard of Anker before but these headphones really sound great - especially taking the price into account - under $60! The noise cancelling works well - I have a pair of Bose that are clearly superior but they cost nearly $400! There are 4 integrated microphones that detect outside noises and "cancel" the sounds - it works! Construction is plastic - to be expected in a sub $100 pair of headphones - with that said they feel like they are made rather well. The earphones are rather comfortable - definitely when compared to "ear buds" which I find to be uncomfortable. The battery life is EXCELLENT! My son used these for the better part of two days and the battery did not run out! Manufacturer states 40 hours of battery lie with up to 60 hours in "Standard" mode - incredible! These are bluetooth - no wire to deal with and they connected to his cell phone effortlessly. What I would Improve: An integrated microphone to accept phone calls would be nice but not included- again, these are a budget headset and for the price you cannot expect to have the full functionality o much more expensive equipment. Recommend!

review_title: Comfy, great sounding pair of headphones - perfect for my office
review_text: I have been using wired ear buds for the last few years at my desk in a semi-open office (cubicles with walls to 4'-6"). While the ear buds do the job of delivering music while I work they didn't help with ambient noise, kept me tethered to my computer and became uncomfortable, especially during long days at the office. The first thing I liked was the packaging. Almost everything (box, plastic insert etc.) was recyclable. Additionally the headphones came with everything one could need to use them, including an audio chord just in case you forget to plug them in and run the battery too low. Functionally - they worked. I took them out of the box, turned them on, put my surface pro into discovery mode and i was listening to music in a matter of seconds. No pairing issues. I am not an audiophile, but the music seems balanced and the base is adjustable. There are also volume controls on the headphones themselves. The noise cancelling is a dream, making it really easy to tune the rest of the office out. They are also pretty comfortable, slightly heavy on the head so we will see how comfortable they are for hours on end. But so far I am very happy with the product.

review_title: Not sure how long these will last
review_text: First thing when I pulled these out, they naturally unfolded and pinched my finger. They are kind of floppy and flimsy. They do have some noise cancelling, but it wasn't as good as a pair I have that were priced similarly. Having said that, they do work, and they work decent considering the price, so I give them four stars.

review_title: Great sound and exceptionally comfortable. Effective active noise cancellation.
review_text: This is a review of Anker Soundcore Life Q20 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones I have a fairly good opinion of Anker products so was somewhat optimistic about these headphones. Upon the first listen I was extremely pleased not only with the sound quality and effective noise cancellation, but also the comfort. The cushioned, over the ear pads were very comfortable and cushy. They did a good job of passive noise reduction right off the bat. Turning on the active noise cancellation only improved that. Some noise cancellation headphones have a very noticeable degradation in sound quality when the noise cancellation is engaged, but these maintained a very good sound even when NC was active however the volume was reduced and there was some reduced clarity in the mid & higher frequencies. Speaking of the sound quality, at this price point these have great sound. Listening to "Somewhere over the rainbow" by Tommy Emmanuel was wonderful. The clarity of the higher notes was excellent and defined. "Love Lockdown" by Kayne West rattled the fillings in my teeth. The bass was pumping but not overwhelming. The left and right ear cups are clearly discernible because of a large "L" and "R" woven into the fabric inside each ear cup. That's so helpful because it is sometimes very difficult to know which is which. The left ear has the power and noise cancellation buttons. The right ear is where the headphone jack, microUSB port, volume/track buttons are located and in between them is a multi-function button. Quickly pressing the multi-function button pauses play while a longer press activates voice-control of your smartphone. A quick double-press turns bass up or back to normal. I actually found normal bass to be quite sufficient and turning up the bass usually resulted in mushy sound especially with music that already had a lot of bass in it. I rarely use the enhanced bass feature. There are ridges between the buttons that give you good tactile feedback so you know which button you are pushing. As for using these to take and place phone calls, they were OK. People told me that my voice sounded a little digital, but still pretty good. The problem with using these for phone calls is that your ears can't hear you talk as well as you can hear the person talking so it's a little weird to use them that way. But it can be done. Battery life is stellar and I really like that I can use the included wired connection if the battery dies and continue to enjoy the sound of these headphones. Of course, there is no active noise cancellation when using the wired connection with a dead battery. Also included is the microUSB cable for charging the headphones. Although there is no hard carry case for the headphones, a soft vinyl pouch is provided. The lack of a hard travel case is not a huge big deal for me but it would have been nice to have one. These headphones provide a good value and I'd recommend them to others.

Below is my review as of 3.5 months ago. These headphones have now been in use almost daily for all that period but lately, they've begun to fail significantly in battery life. As shortly as two months into use, I noted a battery life falloff. The original 40 hours dropped to maybe 30 when I first noted and then 20. Now the headphones will not accept a full charge anymore and the battery life is less than half of new. My suspicion is that these are powered by NiCads rather than LiO2. Thus my charging them when they weren't fully down set the battery memory up and up. To say I'm disappointed is to put it mildly. My original review: *************************** Executive Summary: These headphones are every bit as good as the manufacturer claims. Battery Life: After a full charge, I used these for a timed 20 hours. At the 20 hour mark, the battery level voice, which sounds on startup, said the battery level was ‘medium’ after having said it was ‘high’ for all the preceding time. Checking the battery level in the control area of the various iDevices I paired these phones with confirmed with a visual indicator of 60%. I’d say the 40-hour battery life is substantiated. Sound Quality: Here’s where things are, to me, most important. It’s clear that these phones are modeled after Bose given the way they fold up (please see the photo) the naming convention and that they have two modes of equalization – normal and heavy bass. Also here’s where the personal opinion comes in to play. I have no interest in reference, unbiased, headphones. I want an equalization which sounds terrific to my ear and I have it here in normal mode. The bass boost mode does boost the bass significantly but at the cost of the phones’ brilliance which is a tradeoff I don’t wish to make. So my subjective evaluation of the phones’ sound quality is that it’s absolutely top-notch and that’s comparing the sound to three Big Name Big Expense headphones. Noise Canceling: It’s better than expected and also superior to the Big Name ones. Most ANC over the ear headphones do a good job with constant noise such as when you’re a passenger in an airplane. These do fine with steady sound but also reduced the noise level to a significant degree in a gym, in my yard with a neighbor’s dog barking and in my home when a family member had the TV turned up too loudly. Clearly the technology here is superior to the old ‘reduce the droning noise’ technology. The ANC does exact a small cost in sound quality. Ergonomics: These are light and comfortable for all-day wear. I should know having worn them for two days as much as I could starting at 5:30A with an hour and a half in the gym evaluating ANC there and then back at my home office for the balance of the day ending at 7P listening to public radio while reading. The ANC on/off as well as the power buttons are easy to use. There’s an English speaking voice to announce ANC on/off as well as bass boost on/off. Curiously, the power on/off signal is a tone instead of a voice. There’s also, untested by me, controls to speak on a phone. I view this as an annoying added complexity to any headphone lacking a mic. Pairing was easy and worked as expected with several iDevices and Android ones. If you choose to use the supplied 3.5mm tether instead of Bluetooth, you can do so with the power switched off. Conclusion: The few trivial drawbacks are vastly outweighed by the superb sound (subjective), comfort and easy to use controls. These phones are an easy five stars for me.

I love Anker products. Everything I’ve gotten from them has been well-made, attractive, and priced fairly. I really love their Soundcore true wireless in ear monitors, for instance. Which is why I expected slightly better sound from these. But they suffer considerably from over-accentuated, bloated and fuzzy bass. Even with the “bass up” feature turned off, it’s just way too much. Unless you like to listen at quiet volumes, you may find that listening fatigue sets in very quickly because of the pounding your ear drums are getting. Some people like a lot of bass at the expense of the rest of the music, and if that’s you, you’re going to love these. You can use the “bass up” feature to equalize even more bass in so that bass is pretty much all you’ll get. However, at quiet volumes the bass is tamed a little and you can listen for an hour or so without pain. So, because of this problematic sound signature, I won’t be listening to these or adding them to my collection. However, sound preferences are subjective, and you might like a surfeit of bass. What’s not as subjective is the build quality, which like all things Anker, is excellent at this price point. Noise canceling is also on point. I tested it with a commercial coffee grinder and a vacuum cleaner, and in both cases the already excellent physical isolation was augmented considerably by the ANC technology. Also, the Bluetooth pairing and other firmware tasks worked flawlessly. The headphones come with a nice carrying sack (insofar as any sack can be said to be nice), a 3.5mm male to 3.5mm male patch cable (in case you want to skip the Bluetooth part) and a charging cable. The headphones fold a little to make travel easier. You won’t go wrong with the build or the wearing comfort; I’ve dealt with Anker before and they stand behind their products. The only thing problematic here, at least to me, is the ridiculous sound signature. If Anker were to release a version with non-atomic bass, it would be a winner.

I really like the look and color of these headphones. There is a large letter "L" and "R" on the inside of the headphones. They adjust about an inch on each side. The top and the ear piece are padded and very comfortable. The ear pieces rotate about 90 degrees, and they can be folded in. There is an audio jack, a mini usb port, a volume increase and decrease button, pause button, noise cancelling activation button, and power button. The volume button controls the volume on the device you have it connected to. When you press the volume button, for some reason the media stops for a second then adjusts. When you turn it on, it makes a noise and tells you the status of the battery. The headphones are pretty loud; I was able to hear what was playing clearly while holding the headphones in my hand. The sound is good too, all the bass from my sons came through and sound the same as if I was in a car. The noise cancellation comes on automatically when you turn them on. I feel like when the music is all the way up, it is noise cancelling and I cant even hear myself yelling what (not at the top of my lungs). As I turned the music down, I could begin to hear myself a little more, but I couldn't hear things outside of that (this is with the volume at about 80%). The true test was turning on my tv with my sound bar on (and it's a really good one) and I kept turning it up and didn't hear a thing. I took these headphones off and my tv was blaring, so much so that my sub woofer was vibrating the bed, but I didn't hear a thing. So, these are DEFINITELY noice cancelling.

As you should expect from a fine headset, the sound of the Q20s is quite good. Frequency response at both ends of the sound spectrum is good, even with the BassUp feature disengaged. Turning this feature on-- for my musical tastes anyway -- has a negative effect with the bass deadening the mid and treble frequencies. It would be news if the sound reproduction was sub-par and in every listening situation, from music to movies and video editing, the sound reproduction is excellent. What sets the Q20 apart is the fantastic Bluetooth and the noise cancellation features. The wireless connection is exceptional, staying connected quite a way from the source where other headsets have failed. Noise cancellation in the Q20 is better than expected, shutting out the world around you when you want it to and with a push of a button, allowing you to be aware of the sounds around you. All the features are easy to engage while using the headset once you have figured out which buttons on the ear cups perform what function. The Q20 is a mid-priced headphone that will give higher priced devices from the big names a run for their money. Sound is good, connection is good, and the quality feels good. What else do you need?
I bought this because it advertised a high quality mic, however the mic quality was poor. Additionally, the mic required "calling mode" to work, which some apps don't support.

review_title: Very comfortable; great ANC at this price
review_text: These are very good headphones in this price range. The ANC is very good. You're not getting the same as $300 pairs, but it works very well to make voices and sounds (I ran my vacuum, which is about as loud as engines on a plane from a distance) recede into the background. They're very comfortable and the controls are intuitive and easy to use when you're wearing them. Battery life is good and charge time is pretty quick. I have a power bank from Anker that I really like and that has given me solid performance, so I am hopeful these will as well. I have a pair of Cowin headphones that I love dearly and I haven't found a pair I'm willing to trade them for yet, but I'm going to try these on my next flight. These pair to BT easily and the controls are much easier to use when they're on my head than my Cowins. Most important to me is the ANC, and these are the closest I've found to my current pair in quality of ANC. My only complaint about these, and the reason I can't give them 5 stars, is that they don't come with a case; instead, they come with a cheap bag that will do nothing to protect them as they're smooshed in my carry-on. Most headphones at this price range include a semi-rigid case, and these should as well. Recommend, but you'll need a case to carry when traveling.

I'm a hardcore music lover. I don't cheap out when it comes to sound equipment. These headphones offer high quality sound and effective noise cancellation. You get 40 hours of wireless use. Bass tones are enhanced with the BassUp technology. A handy travel kit is included. It's easy to fold the headphones and toss them in any bag. They work with Bluetooth and a normal aux cable. A micro USB cable is also included. If you travel frequently or like to use headphones at work, these are perfect for reducing ambient sound. The ear cups are ultra soft and squishy. They're ideal for those with sensitive skin or for extended wear. These headphones are pretty awesome. If you're a stickler for great sound quality, I highly recommend them. Thanks so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope the information that I've provided makes your decision a little easier.

These are good noise cancelling headphones. For the money they are quite a good value, but they are not as good as higher end models that cost significantly more. I have a Bose and AKG for comparison. Sound Quality – Good for the price. I have some other headphones in the same price point, and it meets or exceeds the sound quality. But those looking for audiophile level of sound quality will be disappointed. Noise Cancelling – Pretty good. Again, not as good as the Bose or AKG but better than some other so-called noise cancelling headphones I’ve tried. The noise cancelling is strong and obvious. Keep in mind its not magic, you still hear stuff, just not as much even with higher end headphones. If the Bose is a 10/10 this is a 8/10. Comfort – Good but not exceptional. The ear cups could be made of a better material for softness and noise reduction. I’ve worn them for hours and they are similar to others, just not quite as good. Controls – One area I’m not thrilled about. The controls are all push and hold, no switch. So to turn it on and off can be a bit of a pain. There is a noise cancel on and off, again push and hold. Volume up and down are normal. There is a center multifunction button that will do different things in different modes. When you turn it on you get a Low/medium/high battery life wisper tone. Newer android OS’s will tell you the battery life % when you connect to Bluetooth. One nit pick is there is not auto off option if you don’t get signal. So if you fall asleep it will continue to run all night. Battery life is good though so its probably not the end of the tunes when you wake up in the morning. The light – One thing I do NOT like about it is the LED On indicator light is really bright. Bright enough that if your laying the dark and you open your eyes your going to see stuff. Too bright. Case – Comes with a little slip bag, not a hard case. Cord – One area that is better than the higher end headphones is that the wired connection. The Bose and AKG use a 2.5mm input. These have a 3.5mm input. Most cables you buy are 3.5mm on both sides. So if you lose your cable its easy to replace vs a special order know what you need thing. Cables are handy when you’re on a flight with in flight movies. Overall this unit is excellent value for the money. Overall its about 80% of the more expensive units but around 1/3 the price. For value that is hard to beat. If you want a solid set of noise cancelling headphones but don’t want to be hundreds, then these are a good choice.

Initially got these for my daughter to gift to her for her birthday but might keep them for myself! I will start off by saying I'm not completely tech savy but have owned a few noise canceling headphones in the past. These would be the midrange price between the three I've owned and are almost perfect (for the price). Comes with everything needed plus a soft black carrier case. The ANC on the Soundcore Life Q20 is adequate enough to drown out the majority of excessively lod noises. They’re comfortable and well-constructed. So if your looking for budget friendly headphones, these are it!

They look and feel like a high-quality product that I recommend you. Besides for this price (currently about $60 USD) point I think they deliver great value for the money. I recommend you this product. Pros: -Battery life is great: I listen these about 4 hours every day and I spent 8 days before charge was required. Please note that battery life depends on many factors and the most important is the volume. I listen these at very low volume. -These are my first headphones with noise cancellation but I am very pleased and I think works excellent. -Sound quality is good for me! My comparison point are the Jaybird X3 and this ones fit the bill very well. -They come with male-male 3.5mm audio cable so you can use them as wired headphones! Cons: -I tried to use them in the gym and they are too hot and my ear sweats a lot so not good for sports. - They come with a soft transportation bag and I wish they come with a more sturdy case. -The connection for charge is micro USB. I wish they were USB-C like my phone, now I have to carry an additonal cable.

review_title: Great sound, noise cancelling works well situationally
review_text: When I opened these, I was reminded of my Bose QuietComfort 25 headphones, which our family has used for years, as Anker copied Bose’s headphone folding technique. Hey, if it works… These headphones worked well in several areas. The Bluetooth set up perfectly on the first try, the sound is quite nice, and the headphone’s over the head band has plenty of room for larger heads, while fitting my quite average woman’s head size. The ear pads fit over the ear, but I wish they had been just a bit roomier. While I have small ears, I still felt the oval shape had them pressing against the sides of my ears, which I don’t care for. If the ear pads had been rounder, they would have worked better. I don’t have much use for the bass boost, but I suppose some might, and it seems to work okay. I would definitely leave it off. I liked the sound very much overall. I listen to Korean OSTs a lot, so quite a bit like American pop, with not tons of bass needed, imo. The noise cancelling worked very well to block people talking around me, but didn’t work if someone was playing a video or music too close to me with really clear sound. The noise cancelling seemed to not work at all in those cases. But for listening to music while someone talked around me or regular TV was playing, those seemed to cancel pretty well. So the noise cancelling seems situational in how well it’s going to work. I love the Bluetooth in these, because my Bose headphones are wired, which sometimes irritates the heck out of me when I need to move around. Overall, these are similar headphones for a much smaller price. I don’t know if these will hold up for the many years that my Bose headphones have served various family members through various stages of life/work/usage. But the Anker headphones definitely work enough like the Bose that I find them quite satisfactory. As I am not an audiophile, your mileage may vary. Overall, very pleased with these headphones which will be used mostly to block out people talking. Let Amazon donate to your favorite charity! Use Amazon Smile (smile.amazon.com) when you order and Amazon will donate to the charity of your choice when you make a qualifying purchase. Check out how Amazon Smile works at https://smile.amazon.com/gp/chpf/about/ref=smi_se_rspo_laas_aas. My shopping is donating to my favorite charity, Canines for Independence at no cost to me. Awesome!

I'm a big fan of Anker products. I got these for travel and phone business meetings although music on occasion. The packaging was typical Anker style, high quality neat and a nice experience. I have yet to test and compare the noise cancellation these with my Bose set during a flight. I will update later if notable. The sound quality is great, although a bit heavy on bass, which the younger generation would appreciate. The highs are a bit attenuated for my taste. Would I buy these over the Bose, yes. Even though their respective technologies differ, the Anker is a great value. My only concern is the headset fitting seems bigger and its smallest setting. I have a big melon, and these barely fit snug, so smaller beans beware. :) Hope this helps.

These are a great pair of noise-cancelling headphones for the price! -They feel comfortable to wear, with the padded headband and earcups. - The earcups block out a lot of ambient noise. Plus the active noise cancellation works well to cancel out low-to-mid-frequency sounds; you can really hear the difference when it's off. - Most importantly, the sound is fantastic! You get clear mids and highs and nice bass. It's a very balanced sound, and you won't need the bass boost feature most of the time, unless you're in that kind of a dancing mood. - Great battery life with 40-60 hours playtime, depending on how much noise cancelling you use. Wishes: - I wish the bag were a little larger. A more rigid case would have been even better, but I guess that adds to the price. Summary: Wishlist notwithstanding, these are still a great pair of ANC headphones for the price.

review_title: Long battery life and feel great
review_text: I used this for my gaming laptop and connected with no problems. I like using these at night where I don't bother others. They are very comfortable and easily wearable for hours, the memory cushions are on these are fantastic - even fell asleep a couple times just listening to music. The sound is great for gameplay and adequate for music. Bass is nice and tight and high and mids are expectable. The battery life seems very good since it has lasted a couple weeks so far one charge. Overall, music quality isn't bad, gaming quality is great, and the comfortability and design of these headphones are fantastic.
Great Headphones, comfy padding and amazing sound.

review_title: Wow, that's a lot of bass...
review_text: These are attractive headphones with a nice carrying case. I am happy that they provide both Bluetooth and 3mm jack as options--allowing me to listen to my phone or plug into an airplane jack on long flights. The noise cancellation is excellent. I put them on with no music and the HVAC, children in the next room, and cats beating each other up all disappeared. They are very comfortable over even my larger than normal ears and can be worn for hours--again perfect for long plane rides. The loss of one star comes from the fact that the bass is a bit overwhelming. These offer two sound equalizer modes--"normal" and "bass up". In normal mode, the bass is too high. In "bass up" mode, you feel you are sitting equidistant between the drummer and bassist and the other band members did not show up. I cannot imagine anyone wanting to listen in this mode, except maybe that guy who drives around in the purple car with the after-market spoiler, fuzzy dice, and the music blaring from his ever-open windows.
Since I have owned 2 Anker blue tooth speakers,I counted on them for over the ear headphones and they nailed it! Everything is there......the bass,the mids and the highs are on point!

I would have LOVED to have kept these.. insanely disappointed because I can’t even keep them on my head. They are too big and they fall right off if I tilt my head forward even slightly. I’m 5’2 and small, but I have a normal sized head. Sound quality is excellent, and I love the deep bass sound! For the price, you can’t beat the quality on this sound.. just entirely too big.
I'm an owner of Bose Quiet Control headphones. This headset's noise canceling runs rings around Bose. It's hard to belive at 1/5 the price but it does.

The sound quality is great for the price, they sound better than Beats or Skullcandy headphones. The foam on the cups is very comfortable and has not caused me any discomfort. Ive used them for about 20 hours without charging and they were at half battery so I believe the 40 hour battery capacity is accurate. The noise cancelation is okay, not great. It'll cancel our ambient noise like ventilation or humming of electronics (ie: refrigators) but don't expect them to block out noisy coworkers completely. 5/5 great headphones for the price

My initial experience with the Soundcore 20 headphones was positive and I'd originally started writing my review as a 4/5 star review for solid headphones with minor issues. As the month has gone on since my initial use of them though, I've found that they are not reliable and have enough issues that I must move my review of them down to 3/5 stars. For reference: I have paired these with an android phone, an older Mac, a relatively newer Mac, and a very new Windows machine. What's Good • Very good sound quality. I sampled several genres of music during my listening throughout the week. I also listen to podcasts pretty regularly. Voice was clear. Bass and balance of sound were both strong and worked well for my preferences. Nothing sounded tinny. I really noticed the sound difference when I switched to other headphones. • The noise cancelling is excellent. Office noise and chatter are significantly diminished, almost completely gone. They also work well for spaces like traveling on trains and public transport. • They fit well and are comfortable on the ears. I have a small head which can make 'big' headphones unwieldy, but these sat well. With headphones like these, I find it is easy for my ears to get sore after extended use. I haven't had that problem. • Long battery life. I charge them up at the beginning of the week, and easily used them for several hours per day for 6 days without needing to charge up. They also charge up quickly (1-2 hours). The headphones let you know when you turn them on what their energy level is, and will give verbal warnings when their battery is almost out. • Bluetooth has a good distance. I am able to move around my house or office area without disconnection. • The headphones alert the user of incoming calls, and call quality sounds good. What's Bad • The bluetooth interaction is very hit and miss with the computers I've paired them with. The biggest issue I've had is bluetooth dropping without warning. Troubleshooting the bluetooth connection had limited success in fixing the issue. Turning the headphones fully on and off again to reconnect did not do anything long-term to fix the issue. This happened the most on the Windows machine, but I have had some issues with the Macs as well. • The headphones did not come with any instructions about troubleshooting bluetooth issues. • Sometimes the headphones randomly turn themselves off, without any clear reason why. • On the older Mac machine, the bluetooth connection seemed to only sort of work, leaving the sound quality bad (However this may be related to the Mac rather than the headphones.) • Do not use these to work out. Heavy up and down movement will cause crackle and snapping that is outright painful to the ear. I've even had this happen when my foot hit hard stepping off a small curb. I can't tell if the sound is the audio itself or the physical headset, but either way, it is not pleasant. What's Medium • Button use. After the first week I found it easy to tap the 'next song button', but I found getting the pause button tricky. The length you have to press for different functions on a button also doesn't always feel instinctive. Summary These are good headphones for office work or needing to concentrate on a project. They do decently for moving around casually, but are not for a very active user. The sound quality and noise cancelling aspects are strong. If the bluetooth frustrations could be worked out, these could easily become a 4/5 or maybe even 5/5 for me.

review_title: Does Not Support aptx-LL and Right Channel Failed
review_text: Great range, comfortable, long battery - what's not to like? Well - I bought the headset for TV viewing. And while it does support relatively low latency it isn't the 40 msec necessary to lip sync with the TV video. Also, after trying them out for a couple days to see if the delay was bearable the right channel went dead.
