Tried other headsets, rebooting transmitter, rebooting headset, repairing etc etc. Nothing worked. The other headsets always had two channels but when I tried the Soundcore Life Q20 no right channel. Gave it a 3 as non TV users who get a good unit will be happy. If they had been true low latency and the right channel had worked I would give it a 5 star.

I use headphones a lot, both at work (I work in an "open environment") and at the gym frequently, but this is my first noice-cancelling headphones. I'm super-happy with these! I wasn't sure what to expect when I got these, but I'm pleasantly surprised. The sound quality is quite good. The battery life is also good. I generally use if for a few hours at work, and maybe an hour at the gym, then re-charge, and have never run it all the way down. The noise cancelling is interesting. It's not like it blocks out all other sound, but it does dampen it quite a bit, relative to what you're listening to, even at modest sound levels. I like how you can turn the noise cancelling on/off at the press of the button. I have a plane trip coming up and I'm stoked to have these for that trip! One other thing I really like about these headphones is the interface. Most of the headphones I've used have really awkward, counter-intuitive interfaces which require navigating through menus and such just to do simple things like pairing them with your phone. Not these. Just hit a button and it pairs. I didn't even need to crack the instruction booklet it was so intuitive. The only potential negative thing at all with these, is that for something like use at the gym, or jogging or such, these are a bit on the heavy/bulky side. Still very usable, but I'm used to use headphones that are maybe half as heavy and a bit less bulky. That said, I've adapted to these pretty easily.

review_title: Wireless headphones with great battery life
review_text: I gave this a full charge when I first took it out of the box in mid November. After using it for a day, I left it off for over two weeks when I went on vacation. When I returned to NY, the headphones were still charged. The voice battery indicator when you first turn it on will give you a high, medium etc. on the current battery status. I used it for over a week (during my commute to and from work) before it dropped from high to medium. The noise cancellation Feature was ok but not perfectly. I have other in ear headphones that does a better job at keeping out noise. What I really like is the coverage the headphone provide in the winter. Replaces the need for earmuffs and kept my ears toasty during my commute. Will be using these over the next couple of month until the weather warms up again. Don’t think these will be suitable over the summer, I can just envision the amount of sweat around the earmuffs...Great for the current December weather though.

review_title: Big sound, big comfort, but small price!
review_text: So I have to say, I am very impressed with the quality of these headphones. I've used a few wireless headphones in the past few years, but I haven't used any of the big name high dollar ones so I'm not sure about an exact comparison. However, I feel these could be up for the challenge. So first thing I noticed was the light weight feel of these. They fit well and aren't too noticable, but the light weight didn't mean cheap plastic like some of the others I've used. The head strap material has some flex so they don't feel like you're going to break them putting them on. Also if you have trouble remembering which ear goes which, they have a big L and R on the inside of the muffs. Speaking of the ear muffs, they are extremely comfortable and seal well to keep out noise. The ear muffs and padded head band allow for hours of comfortable wear. Battery life has been excellent and I like how the headphones will audibly tell you charge level when you power on. This is my first set of active noise cancelling headphones and I wonder why I never got a set sooner. I love how I can have a low volume to relax with music rather than having to crank them up to drown out other noise. The controls are within easy reach on the bottom of each ear. For the price, I definitely recommend these headphones!

I was alerted to the 33% drop in price and I'm glad I acted on it, very comfortable, light, long battery life so it says but willing to give it time to try that out, noise cancelling is not 100% if on and no music, however with music on and NC activated external noises are mute, youll need to learn to read lips if they are talking about you, overall, I've quit enjoyed them so far, I'd recommend them to anyone...
Nose cancellation is awesome, on par with high end headphones that cost well over 200. Sounds quality is also excellent

review_title: Great headphones for the price point.
review_text: Noise cancelling is good for what you are paying for these headphones The battery life is really good. They sound good not as good as aptX hd or ldac but they sound really good for a normal Bluetooth codec.

I got this for my son as he doesn't really like the earbuds. This provides a much better coverage for his ears and is much more comfortable to use. As far as testing the product, it sounds good, it's comfortable, and the best part is...it's bluetooth so no wires. My son has enjoyed using it and there's been no complaints. I would consider that a win-win.
Excellent quality with noise cancelling ability.
I love Anker products! These headphones sound so good! Better than other brands I've tried. They're soft, comfortable, and the battery is great. You can't go wrong with them!

Noise cancellation is not as good as my Bose headphones but for the price, they are awesome. Build quality is excellent and sound is good. Like these so much, I bought a second pair for a family member.

review_title: Stellar performance and a great price point
review_text: I buy a lot of headphones. Bose noise cancelling, AmazonBasics over the ear, Apple AirPods, Beats... PROS: These Anker noise cancelling perform just as well as the Bose QuietComfort models at a fraction of the price. I've used them in an airplane on a recent flight and all the people noise around me just fell away. Very comfortable for hours at a time. Battery life is great. Comes with a plastic pouch and wires for audio and micro USB charging. CONS: While the power and noise cancelling buttons are separate and easy to use, the volume up/down and pause are in a rocker which is hard to distinguish each function by touch alone. I would deduct 1/2 star of usability for this. Would I buy these again? Unquestionably.
My daughter loves, it's was a Christmas gift...

I am a neophyte when it comes to audio/sound quality. With that said, the sound quality is superb but the noise cancelling is disappointing. Perhaps I was overly optimistic but I expected a drastic muffling or silencing of outside noise but I didn't. In fairness, I purchased this unit simultaneous to the TaoTronics SoundSurge 60 and both active noise cancelling were similarly disappointing. In terms of fit, finish, and feel, it felt very comfortable. I liked that when I activated the noise cancelling, it prompted me with a voice notification as opposed to the TaoTronics, which was just a toggle with a light indicating on or off. This isn't very helpful when the headset is on. My biggest gripe with this Anker headset isn't with the actual headset but rather that it doesn't come with a carrying case but rather a drawstring bag. Howe disappointing is that? Not very practical when traveling. Even my cheap MPow 059 headset came with a case. Anker being $10 more than the comparable TaoTronics that has a nice case, should have at least came with a case. To my tone-deaf, tinnitus affect ears, both the Anker and TaoTronics sounds surprisingly good. Both feel very comfortable. I like the controls on the Anker better but the TaoTronics has bigger ear cups, although I really can't tell the difference when I'm wearing them. The biggest gripe I have with the Anker headset again is the lack of a case.

review_title: Solid product for the price, easily.
review_text: I love these things. I was shocked at the sound quality (including the bass) for the price! The sound cancellation is solid for the price also. I listen to rap, rock and some house/upbeat tempo music mostly and these had me covered on all of my music. If there was a color other than black and silver (like red, beige/cream/champagne type colors) I would buy another pair just for the gym so I can have one for gym use and a pair for casual listening. That’s how much value so feel I have in this product for the price.
Love these. Very comfortable, and I have a large head. Sound quality was great on the airplane.
My first wireless headphones...so far i love them. Very comfortable
These are amazing for the price. Highly recommend!
Great light headset . Enjoy the comfort of the padding.

I was really excited to receive the headphones because I thought they would be a great bang for your buck especially after reading all of the great reviews. Unfortunately, as soon as I received them I turned them on to find out the right headphone didn’t even work. I will not be making the mistake of purchasing these again.
Worth the money!
They are very good for the price.
Needs a little more punch, but great looks and quality.
Want an inexpensive set for a trip. These turned out to be tter then I expected for the price. NC was very good and was top notch. Battery life is better then my $300 set.

review_title: Great price for a great product.
review_text: I was not sure what to expect, I like the company for its battery and Cell phone charging items, thought why not give it a try. Very positively surprised, great sound, feels found around the ears, very easy to link with my cell phone, made calls from upstairs with headphones on and phone was downstairs, easy to understand when talking to people, clear and no feedback. Happy I tried the headphones, and. Sn’t wait to take sling in my next flight to check out airplane noise cancelling capabilities.

review_title: Good deal for the price factor
review_text: House work noise reduction with longer battery life.
Use it for travel. Perfect purchase.

These headphones are made for giants. I’m a 5’10” male and the headphones fall down the side of my head when set at their smallest setting. They don’t look anything like the individuals in the promo pictures on me. I like everything else about them. I didn’t realize headphones should come in sizes until now...when even the smallest setting is too big. I didn’t have this problem with Bose or Sony. I was hoping to avoid their price gauge...sigh.

review_title: bang for your buck, buy based on reviews and don't pay for a brand name
review_text: Great headphones with good all around quality for the price.

review_title: They feel pretty good for the cost
review_text: There are better headphones out there. For $60, though, these aren't bad at all. They are about as you would expect for the price point - I did have high hopes though because Anker is usually pretty great. These feel kind of cheap and compared to the Bose ones, the noise canceling function is pretty weak. Not too bad for the price, just don't expect a premium product.

Very impressed with these. I love Anker products in general and these are right in line with what I thought I would get. Quality and no bull features. the noise cancelling works as well as the headset. Even my wife, who is really discerning about gear like this likes these. She has BOSE and likes these better with bluetooth. I like the price too compared to Bose! Not really a "tech review" but if they work well and sound good, that is the net for me.

After frustrating with a competitor's product- Three examples each defective in different ways, I was very happy with this Anker set. Good performance immediately, very nice for the price. My ratings- Noise cancellation only 3 because I have not used the headset in a noisy environment; Battery life seems more than I need and; Sound quality is quite good for the price- I doubt they would be as good as sets costing ten or twenty times the price. Don't think one can go wrong with this headset

review_title: Great headphones. Better than the price would indicate.
review_text: Just like every Anker product I've purchased, these headphones do not disappoint. 1. Amazing build quality! They're solid, feel well made, and physically feel "expensive". 2. The Noise cancelling is superb. I owned a set of the Bose in-ear QC headphones (the gold standard in noise cancelling, and $299 a set) and though these Ankers weren't quite at that level, they were WAY better than the price difference would indicate. If the Bose were a 10/10, then these Anker headphones are solid 8/10 in the noise cancelling functionality. 3. The earpads are extremely comfortable. Better than any other OTE headphones I've ever used. 4. The sound quality is superb. Now, I'm not an audiophile by any means, but it sounds good, it sounds good. And these definitely do. 5. I especially liked the mutli-foldability (if that's even a real term) so they can much more easily be stored when traveling etc. All in all, great product, at a phenomenal price. And no, I wasn't given these for free. I purchased them, and will continue to purchase Anker products as I have NOT been let down yet. They by-and-large make some of the best, most affordable electronics and accessories available on the market today.
Nice Headphones, very soft and nice look. The sound is amazing and the noise cancelling works perfect.

I recently left my Bose QC35 headphones on an international flight. Instead of spending another $300+, I decided to give these much less expensive (not cheap) ones a try. I was shocked by the OUTSTANDING noise cancellation. I think they are better than my Bose. The sound quality is just as good as my Bose. Comfort level is a 9.5 out of a 10! I purchase from Amazon all the time and seldom leave a review. This product has earned 5 minutes out of my day!
permanent static noise on right headphone.

review_title: Get these especially if you are on the fence.
review_text: For the price, you cant beat these. They sound great and keep out distracting noises. I never new just how loud plane travel is until using these and taking them off mid flight. Even at full price these are a steal.

review_title: Good sound, bad fit and feel.
review_text: I'm simple really. These headphones have a good V shaped sound. I looked up the frequency response on rtings.com as well. Bass was soild and treble seems good but not too bright. Middle frequencies didn't seem recessed even with pronounced Bass and highs. I'd say they sounded pretty good for $60. In that group (budget) of over the ear headphones, they sounded above average. But you could tell it wasn't stellar, and that's fine for $60. I was happy with the sound. However, I returned them. Why? It's simple really. 1. Clamp force is weak. Instantly upon putting them on my head I felt a sagging feeling. Weight was hanging down in the ears. This was because the clamp force combined with the dimensions. Slight head movements and they slip around or off your head. I was unable to tighten the head clamp either! It was fully closed so I could not tighten the fit. My head is above average large too! Always has been. So the fit and sizing of the head band is just way to big. Not doable. 2. Within minutes my ears were hot. The memory foam pads are comfy but way to warm. These headphones use actual memory foam. They get hot, just like all memory foam products. Other workable foams are available Anker. Why use something that makes your ears feel like they are in a heater? Not doable. Anker came close with the sound but fit and feel is off. It's a shame really. I'm not willing to put up with B+ sound for a set of headphones that hang heavy on my ears, slip with causual movements and heat up my ears like little heat packs. Three stars is being generous just because they sound decent. But it's kind of embarrassing how the other mistakes were made with the design of these that could have been prevented. I guess that well rounded budget over the ear headphone is still a myth because Anker fulfilled the stereotype here. Not well executed. Close, but no cigar.
Love these

review_title: I really wanted to like & to keep these headphones because they looked so good but unfortunately...
review_text: Update: Anker has the most phenomenal customer service of any company I have ever had to deal with!!! I won't say just exactly what they did to rectify my issue with these Q20s (because I don't want people to take advantage of them), but what I will say is that you should feel very safe in trying out ANY product of their, because they sure seem to always have your back if that product doesn't work out for you. I've been customer of theirs for several years now and they've handled whatever issue I've had in exactly the same phenomenal way! I've upped my initial rating for this product to 3 stars just because of Anker's fantastic customer service and I wasn't asked to do this; I was inspired to! My initial 1 star rating is just simply because they didn't work out for my music listening needs; but you may have a completely different experience with them. So I say, give them a try (especially if you like a lot of bass) and if they don't work out for you, Anker is very very likely to have your back on your purchase. Again, wow! What a great company!!! :-) Now, please read my initial review below to help aid you in your decision, but still consider what I have said above. Thank you for your time reading my review and my update! _______________________ I really wanted to like & to keep these headphones because they looked so good but unfortunately, they had some issues that made them not worth keeping. The things that I really liked about them: 1) I really liked the construction of the headphones; the felt like they were very well made, very close to premium quality. 2) I loved the design of them and they look really great on my head. They are beautiful looking headphones! 3) They were really comfortable; my girlfriend has BOSE QC35ii and I couldn't sense ANY comfort differences. 4) Some of the frequency range sounded really good, mostly in the mids and highs area. 5) The buttons were very responsive and they didn't feel cheap at all—on other headphones I tried, they did. The things that I didn't like so much: 1) These things have way way way too much bass and this is just in the normal bass mode. And the bass sounds kind of loose and not well defined. And when you turn on the BassUp feature, well, I really don't know how anyone could listen to music like that in that mode—they become super muddy sounding! Anyway, they have so much bass that I would say that the regular BassUp "OFF" mode should be the "ON" mode and the "OFF" mode should have considerably less bass. I had to go into my Macbook's EQ settings to pick some preset EQ modes to show just how much the bass needed to be turned down (and this is just in the normal BassUp "OFF" mode) to get them to sound better. ...SEE PICTURES of needed EQ settings. ***NOTE: iPods and iPhones are NOT easy to access the EQ settings as they are in: Setting>Music>EQ>Then select the EQ Preset you want—no Manual mode on iOS portables. *** 2) Other problems I was having were when I had them connected to my 2011 iPod. They would cause the music to skip or interrupt 1 to 3 times (almost every time) when I would scan through a track to a another section in a song (it would happen after the scanning) or when I would skip forward or backward to another track. I have other Bluetooth devices that this iPod does NOT do that with, including 3 Anker SoundCore Motion Plus speakers—which I really really LOVE, by the way—so the problem isn't my iPod. ***NOTE: I don't know if I just got a faulty headset regarding this issue but I was too afraid to try another headset. *** 3) The other issue I was having is: I was getting this noticeable volume up & down pumping or oscillations in the music whenever the A.N,C. (active noise cancellation) was "ON"—it would not do this with the A.N.C. in the "OFF" position. Anyway, these volume oscillations would occur with nearly every device I would try them with: a 2011 iPod, a 2012 MacBook, a 2016 iPod, and a 2019 iPhone—it would be more noticeable with some songs than with others and also in some sections of songs rather than in other sections. It did not seem to do this with my Android LG phone but I don't use this for music—I very much dislike the Mp3 format due to the smaller files and the lack of any integrated seamless playback feature. Maybe these Anker QC20s work better with Mp3 formats rather than the Apple ACC formats, but who knows. ***NOTE: I don't know if I just got a bad headset regarding this issue but I was too afraid to try another headset. *** 4) The other thing that I didn't not care for was when the fan was blowing on me I could clearly hear amplified wind noise coming through the A.N.C. microphones which are suppose to help the A.N.C cancel out noice, but in this case they were actually accentuating it through headphone speakers. ***NOTE: this issue wasn't completely a deal breaker for me like all the other issues were but I could see how this would be a problem if I was outside using the A.N.C. on a windy day or if I was hot and I needed a fan directly on me. *** I really like most Anker products that I buy: the power banks, portable backup battery chargers for phones, their Bluetooth speakers (several models)...etc. Unfortunately though, these headphones just weren't able to do it for me this time. :-(
so far so good but i do not know how long the battery will last

review_title: Best bang for your $, ANC is working and I like it.
review_text: It is the second time I am trying ANC, after once trying Sony MDR 1000Xm3. And need to say, that I am surprised with ANC, it is blocking low frequencies very well, so in public transport feeling comfortable like in Uber) Sound quality is good, but they are NOT AS LOUD as I thought, but still works for me. Battery life is great, week of us in my case with 50% Good deal for 50$!! !

review_title: Cannot listen while charging, even in aux mode
review_text: I was hoping for headphones that I can use wirelessly until the battery is gone, then plug in for a while and continue listening. It appears that you can't charge these while you're listening, even in aux mode.
Tyygg

Overall, I really like these headphones. I could have used a manual that was a little more detailed, but I figured it out. As you can tell, I'm not an expert on this type of product but I have been very satisfied with the headphones and the price that I paid for them.
Great sound. A lil heavy on my head but worth the struggle to jam as I want to!

These Headphones worked perfectly on a long airplane flight. When the cable for connecting to the airplane's sound system became frayed, Anker was very quick to replace it for free. Great product, great service

Ordered these for two reasons. First, I wanted to replace a cheap "tester pair" (to see if I even liked the concept of rechargeable headphones) that I bought a year ago, which began to show their age after only about 6 months - and second, I adore Anker products. I have their portable battery pack, two of their charging cables, and a double-USB wall port. None of it has ever failed me, and I've been using most of it for a few years now. Anker is legit. Needless to say, I was SUPER excited when I started shopping around for new headphones and realized that Anker was an option (which then became the ONLY option). Right out of the box, the headphones look amazing. Nice finish. Broad headband. Softest ear pads I've ever touched in my entire life. The fit is incredible, like wearing nothing. The controls take a few practice tries to figure out by feel, which I assume is true of most pairs. You'll probably hit the wrong button a few times (I did). But once you get used to where everything is, and how long to press for which command, then it couldn't be easier. And, coming from owning a much cheaper pair, it's SO NICE to be able to skip songs without constantly having my phone in my hand! Tested the noise-canceling feature for the first time while vacuuming. I could still hear the vacuum roaring (I can't imagine ANYTHING would be able to muffle THAT entirely), but instead of the usual abrasive racket, it sounded more like someone was running a hair dryer about two rooms away. I didn't have to turn up my music to a skull-blasting volume in order to hear it, which was a first, and a very welcome one at that. The battery life so far is ridiculous (in a good way). My old pair could only go about three hours without dying. I've used these several times now, and still haven't needed to charge them. It's like I borrowed some kind of luxury headphones from a rich person. Basically, Anker continues to come in clutch, shocking absolutely no one. Buy the headphones. Do it. Stop reading - why are you still reading, I said stop reading - and buy the headphones.

review_title: Great for the price...active NC hiss ks noticeable
review_text: Amazing for the price! Unreal battery life and active noise cancel...hummm mine may be faulty but there is a slight ringing hiss

Pros: - Good noise cancellation - Good sound when it's connected - Pairs with MacBook Pro quickly Cons: - I work in a crowded office with a lot of folks using bluetooth. The interference breaks up the sound repeatedly. - The native OS X volume controls aren't compatible with the headphones. I often had to reach up to physically increase/decrease the volume on the headphones rather than just using the keyboard controls.
Pretty decent, very happy with them.

review_title: Sound limited to 95dB, unacceptable in my eyes
review_text: I did not know the sound was limited until I got them, put them on and I could still hear the outside TV and noises with noise cancelling on. Reason being, the sound in the headphones is much too quieter, even with NC on, you can still hear some of the sounds from outside. I did a bit of reading and there it was, they're limiting the sound to 95dB. Not like we're adults and can turn up or down our sound. They're "protecting" us and looking after our health. I can understand if they were children headphones, but they're not. To me it's unacceptable. I went and bought the highly rated Sony and already had the Bose QC 35 II which do not do that. I am not happy.

review_title: 60 dollars’ price for 60 cents’ worth of sound quality and noise cancellation
review_text: When your budget is trash you get trash. Without the silly “BassUP” feature these sound like pre-Apple Beats on a bad day with fatiguing boomy bass. Noise Cancellation vs. a bus or a plane results in wavering volume, amplified high-pitched outside noise, and an occasional ear-piercing burst of static. Additionally, the multifunction button is too hidden (identical too, in between, and right up next to the volume controls) and performs too many functions. On the plus side, they are very comfortable, they look decent, and the physical build quality is better than you’d expect at this price. That must be where your $60 goes, because it sure didn’t go into sound quality or noise cancellation.

Very good head phones for the price. They cancel outside noise well. I have noticed a crackling sound near full volume. But that should get to big an issue as how often are you listening to music that loud.

review_title: Amazing value- Great sound, extremely comfortable
review_text: I never write reviews on anything but the value offered by these has to be noted. The biggest thing I was worried about is comfort- inexpensive headphones often feel cheap and don't fit well- these are a huge exception. The ear cups are very, very soft and the headphones feel much more expensive than they are. The sound quality is fantastic, the noise cancellation is great. BUY THESE
They work great fit nice

review_title: Didn't fit small face - My rating is not based on sound quality
review_text: 1. This is a review for Anker Soundcore Life Q20 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over-Ear Bluetooth Headphone. 2. I am a small woman who wears glasses while I work. 3. These headphones were too big, so their weight was uncomfortably resting on my head. They still somehow pinched my head painfully where my glasses go over my ears. I wore these headphones for 40 minutes and then processed my return with Amazon (that was easy). 4. This is not a review of the sound quality. I am no sound quality expert. I have no other experience with noise-canceling headphones, and I work in a low noise environment...Notably, the 40 minutes of quiet provided by the headphones was an absolute joy. I'm going to try another brand.

review_title: Incredible value, comfort, battery life, and range
review_text: These were a convenience lifestyle buy for me. I own dozens of headphones and IEM's, but only a few Bluetooth-enabled models. I wanted a comfortable pair of over-ear phones with great battery life and ANR for early morning and late-night listening that I could wear while cooking or doing chores, and which would do yeoman's duty with podcasts, news, music, and video using my phone and tablet as a source. It also needed to handle phone headset duties. The Anker Soundcore Life Q20 checked every box at a great price! I have a different model Bluetooth headphone that I use as a daily driver for conference call duty, but I like the Anker's better for anything away from my home office desk. Pro - Ease of use; pairing; simple controls. Comfortable. Lightweight. Excellent fit and finish for the money. Long battery life. Great range. (I went outside to skim leaves out of the pool this morning while wearing these and listening to news. I thought my phone was in my pocket, but it was on the kitchen counter about 40 yards away. Didn't even notice as I never lost the connection.) Great sound for the money. Only one BT headphone I own sounds better with music (soundstage, transparency), but those don't fit my large head well and I can't wear them for extended periods. I could wear the Q20's all day long.. ANR is moderate but effective for background hums and white noise. Con- Clamp pressure could be 10% tighter for my taste. Build quality acceptable. No complaints, but you'll never use the phrase "built like a tank" with these.

I purchased these to replace Sony wh1000xm3 headphones. I was attracted to the over-ear design and noise canceling features. In practice, the noise canceling on the Anker headphones work well when you're sitting motionless (in a library, office, etc) - however when in motion (on a plane, in a car, etc) I found it to be poor. The noise filtering while in motion is spotty - sometimes there's still quite a bit of background noise compared to the Sony product...but the biggest problem by far is the BUFFETTING NOISE. In both cars and planes, I consistantly heard a noise similar to when you have wind buffetting through a car (one window rolled down and the others up) projected through the headphone speakers. This is extremely annoying and distracting, and eventually led me to turning the noise canceling off. With it off, the audio quality really isn't anything to write home about, so I will be returning these.
Noise cancelling could be a bit better. Overall I think they are good for the price. Wireless has a very good range.
Very nice
Excellent headphones for the money

review_title: I can hear a plastic bag clearly from 10 feet away with noise cancelling on.
review_text: I asked my dad to get me these to help with studying. I have been shocked to find how much I can hear with noise canceling. These are more like noise muffling at best. I ride the train a lot. the nc does block out a lot of the lower rumble of the train, but terrible at blocking out everything higher pitched. No one talks super low like that so I hear EVERYONE talking. Even when there are very few people on the train. I'm surpised they market these as noise canceling. my cheap ear buds do a better job at blocking noise out. As I put in the title, I could clearly hear someone getting into a plastic bag from 10 feet away. I've never tried Boise Quiet Comfort or any other "noise cancelling" headphones before. I've trusted Anker for good products like charging cords and power banks, (I've had good results there) However, I'm SUPER diappointed in Anker this time. These "noise canceling" headphones are useless. The sound isn't even that great.

My 1st Experience With Anker Soundcore Was With The Liberty Air 2 Which Sound Excellent As Long As You Have The Right Sized Ear Tips . Now I Own The Q20 Over Ears And While They Are Not Going To Dethrone My Sony 1000X M3 ANC HEADPHONES . For $60$ They Are Amazing And Worth Every Penny . The ANC Is Just OK But The Sound From The Q20 Is Excellent With Plenty Of BASS . The Silver Model I Went With Is Beautiful Eat Yer Heart Out Bose . Overall im Very Satisfied With Them And Am Listening To Them As Ive Written This Review .

Great headphones that have great noise cancellation and audio. Only downside for me is that I wear them when I donate plasma and the ear area rotates. The ear area can’t be locked into place (They do hold tightly onto the ear though) so it makes it really hard to put them on with only one hand free. I have a pair of Beats though and I would highly recommend these over the beats. Beats were expensive and the plastic broke in less than two years of use

I had high hopes for this item. For about an hour they worked great. Then I started hearing static. Then after it got worse. They have the sound like if the speakers are blown. Volume was at 40% so I could have not damaged them. The speakers were defective. Contacted customer support but they kept giving me useless troubleshooting tips. They did not understand that the speakers were defective. Waste of time since they had offered a 15% discount on another order and then for me to return and wait for an exchange. Really? My time is valuable. Bad customer service. I will return them to amazon for a refund.

When I first got these I was very delighted of the comfortability and sound signature that these produced. Then a few days later I started hearing loud crackling noises. I read in the comments that people were saying it was due to movement and wind which is understandable in a certain way but then I started hearing them while idle just sitting down. I’ve tried resetting the headset and forgetting the device on my phone and then repairing but the issue still persist. I thought these were going to be the best bang for the buck headphones but I made end up returning them.

review_text: I bought these when there was a coupon on Gizmodo and they were highly reviewed. They are giant

review_title: Good office headphones if you like EDM/Techno
review_text: Overall, these are great entry-level noise cancelling headphones. These do everything you'd expect from a $60 pair of headphones, and more. Pros: - The noise cancelling is decent, able to block out fans and low noises, but struggles to block out higher pitches noises. If you add music, you're pretty well isolated from everything. - Very comfy - EXTREMELY light. Maybe the most underrated feature of these headphones - Sound quality is pretty good for bass-heavy techno - Battery life is good - Bluetooth connection speed and pairing is superb, and the quickest to attach of any headphones I've used Cons: - The sound quality for anything other than techno is abysmal. If you're listening to song for the drums, then forget it, the whole lower end of the spectrum is completely muddled. - The "Bass Boosted" mode is awful, I can't imagine anyone wanting to use it, it makes every song sound like a bootleg Youtube *BASS BOOSTED* version These are $60 headphones with noise cancelling. Half the price of the next closest name-brand version. If you need a pair of headphones for the office to cancel out keyboard noises or your boss, get these.

review_title: Nice sound, nice noise cancellation, nice price
review_text: Very nice sound and noise cancellation at a great price! The headphones feel good, too. My kids and I are very happy with them.
I like the product

Beautiful sound on an incredibly inexpensive pair of headphones. These have equal or better quality than any $150 or less pair I've owned. They're also very comfortable. If it weren't for the heat generated after 40-50 minutes I might be able to wear these all day. Noise cancellation is also surprising in the fact that you don't notice it. When I'm not wearing headphones I love white noise. It lets me ignore the distractions around me, and focus on my work or play. When I am wearing headphones I hate it. As soon as I notice it in a pair of headphones, I start to worry that I've missed something. Either a phone call, or a family member, or just a noise that I might need to hear, all start to weigh on me and I can't help but take the headphones off. With the Anker headphones all I notice is the lack of distractions. It's simply a very light improvement on the around-ear attribute. And I am very happy with it. The only drawback is the fit when laying on your back, and I do not believe that to be worth the loss of a star. But if you like to listen to music as you fall asleep, this might not be the product for you. The top of the headband makes a break for lower altitudes as soon as you tilt back beyond 50 degrees. Recliners and even piles of cushions on the bed could be the end of your listening session. Overall, great product. And I'm very happy with it.
The headphones don’t hold a charge.

This was a very nice set of noise canceling headphones. I especially like that you have the opportunity to choose to go wireless or to use a cord. Very comfortable. The only thing I would change is to allow the band to be shortened more as it is a little large on my head.

review_title: The only thing it's missing is forward and backward buttons for navigating your music
review_text: Love these headphones. Wore them on a flight and did exactly what they were supposed to do.

Excellent battery life, solid sound, noise cancelling is good. Excellent purchase for price.

review_title: Sound great. Noise cancelling is meh.
review_text: Only 3 stars since I got these specifically for noise cancelation but they didn’t work well. When on, I couldn’t hear my coworkers right next to me, but still could clearly hear people across the room. These notoriously loud people were the reason I bought these, and sadly the headphones didn’t even dull their voices unless music was already playing. Other than that bit, the sound for music is great and these have a very comfortable fit, which makes me sad the noise cancelling isn’t better.
Great sound I use them for working out
I will use it ion my airline flight this week.I always have trouble hearing movies and music on a plane because of the engine noise. I am looking forward to using my noise-canceling headphones!

I purchased these headphones because they not only have bluetooth , they also have a 3.5 mm jack. They fit over my ears well and are snug but not too tight. The sound is good for the cost. The noise cancelling is ok for low droning noise but any louder noises can be heard. For the price I'm happy with them but they seem a bit fragile.

Big fan of listening to Lofi Hip Hop streams and they sound amazing on these headphones. I honestly see the only flaw with this is I cant go crazy with the volume control but to be fair its more then loud enough for me. The plastic feels a little cheap in some areas but the cushion around the ears feel absolutely amazing. Overall I think these are amazing headphones for 50 bucks. I would be sure to get a hard case for them though to keep them clean and protected, I can definitely see a hard sit breaking the headband.
DO NOT BUY! They are great headphones...if you only have ONE EAR! My first travel experience and the only one I guess

review_title: Low quality, Look nice, decent sound for price point.
review_text: I wanted to like these based on the fairly positive reviews. They look nice, but are very cheaply built. I can shake my head side to side and hear parts in the right ear cup moving around. I realize these are budget headphones, but I have another pair that I bought from another brand for the same price and the quality was much higher on the other brand. Also like others mentioned they are very loose on the head, I have a fairly large head and these were loose on me on the smallest fit level fully closed. The "multi function" button is also a terrible design flaw, they should have just dedicated buttons for the main functions not one button and try to make it work for multiple functions. The sound is good not great, the noise cancellation from what I can tell is adequate for this price point. I did buy a 3 yr extended warranty on these based on reviews of this model breaking a lot, will update my review after some months to see how it has held up. This is not a main pair of headphones I will be using daily, but for occasional use it may work. I would pass on purchasing these again. Thanks Update 03/29 Anker reached out to me and offered to send a replacement pair to me. I received the replacement pair, and while it did not work out for me as far as what I was looking for, their customer service was outstanding in trying to make it right. Ultimately they issued a refund on my purchase. I would not hesitate to buy Anker products in the future which I still do. 5 stars for the customer service and doing what they could to make sure customer was satisfied.

review_title: I get a lot of Popping sound when I walk
review_text: They are fine if you are sitting down. But if you walk with them, the noise cancelling causes a lot of popping sounds...not sure why?
Bluetooth quality very good. Sound quality good but not stellar. Adequate for airline travel.

review_title: Solid performance for a low cost device
review_text: Excellent sound quality except when volume is maxed (low frequencies become distorted)...otherwise this would have been 5 stars. Noise cancelling is above average but does not completely filter out louder sounds. Volume button works but is a little clunky. Great battery life so far, and you get an audible indication of battery when you turn them on. At this price point these are excellent speakers, and had to buy a second pair for my wife after she used (and was fully impressed with) mine.
Comfortable and long lasting. Noise cancelling not good on moving vehicles as bumps will be jarring.
Descent for the price. If it had a hard case it would have been better. The noice cancelling is descent the softness is great. The sound is good. I will buy it again for the price.
All well around headset
I haven’t flown with them yet but the sound is great. They’re very comfortable and the controls were easy to learn. I would purchase again.
The sound quality is excellent. I love them...dance all over the house with them on. Glad no one is home to watch.

Love everything about these headphones, except for the way they fold up to store in the inc lm used travel bag. They aren't as sturdy as I'd prefer, but they're unbelieveable afar as the rich & full range of sound & the noise cancellation works very well.

I’ve only used these for 2 days but they are vastly better than my pair of wired Audio Technica noise canceling phones that were falling apart after 8 years of occasional use. Pros: Excellent audio quality, smooth sound with good detail, no need for the optional bass boost Noise canceling is effective and unobtrusive (have not tested them in a vehicle yet) Easily fit my large head, cushions are comfy Very quick pairing with my iPhone and iPad, and no trouble remaining paired Cons: Made my ears slightly sweaty when exercising for 25 minutes (but all headphones do that) No hard case provided, but soft pouch seems adequate

Got these for $49.99 with a $10 off coupon and they are worth every penny and more. Are these on the level of Bose? No, but IMO they are not far behind at all. VERY comfortable fit - and I have a rather large noggin - and they fit over the ear, so that keeps a lot of sound out without even using noise cancelling. Have not tested them on an airplane, but that is probably the main place you would need the noise cancelling, unless, of course, you have maniacal kids running around - in that case enjoy your peaceful, quiet bliss. Sound is very, very good. Picked up some subtle sounds in songs that I had not heard before over my PC speakers, which are pretty high quality speakers. I have some other Anker products and this has reaffirmed my belief in their quality at a good price.

review_title: Best purchase I’ve made in a long time
review_text: Worked better than expected.
I loved this product up until one day the battery was on medium and then it was not connecting with my phone. If this happens again I will have to return it.

review_title: Nice budget headphones with great features hampered by some bugs
review_text: First off, the feature set on these is really good IMO. They have BT 5.0 with awesome range, advanced codec support, multi-pairing, two equalization settings (ie. normal and bass-up), do not squeak, have good fit, and sound fine for phone calls. Heck, Sony's top-of-the line ~$300 1000mx3's have more limitations than this headset (Older BT 4.x, no multi-pairing, poor microphone performance). The headphones sound decent in normal mode albeit I found the soundstage to be rather tight. When using bass-up however, the bass turns muddy and the midrange takes a hit. They went a little too far with it I think. The headphones also sound different with ANC on and off, and when being used wired vs wireless. The headphones are plenty comfortable for fit, but my ears get crazy-hot if I'm not using them motionless. Definitely won't be able to mow the lawn or exercise with these w/o a stream of sweat pouring out of the earcups. Regarding those bugs: The headphones sometimes make a LOUD static noise. This noise is usually related to either putting them on or toggling ANC. The second issue is if you have them too close to something (ex: a pillow if you're using them while in bed), the ANC will go into a positive feedback loop and will create an uncomfortable beating noise until you move them away from whatever object they were near. I haven't tried using them on a plane but I'm thinking this will be an issue there also. Other notes: They still use microUSB, which to me is not a big deal but it would have been nicer if it was USB-C. The silver color will make you look like a Cyberman - so get the black unless you like that look. Overall, I think they are a good value for the money but I'm not sure if I can live with the hot ears, static noises, and crazy ANC. Hoping that Anker will fix the bugs and release and updated version. They love to put "updated" next to the listing titles on these budget brands so here's their chance!
OK, they are not studio quality sound, but the sound better than my Bose that I paind almost $300 bucks for!. More volume than the Bose at way less bucks. I would buy these again.

review_title: Would buy again - best bargain for active noise cancelling while working
review_text: I bought these hoping for the best but perhaps expecting something mediocre. I was looking for something to else block out noise in my house. I have EXTRA sensitive hearing, and I live in a new build neighborhood with lots of construction near a major roadway. I often work from home during the week (and yes this was before the COVID-19 pandemic) when I'm working on writing tasks. It was becoming a major struggle to pay attention to my computer and work with so much distracting background noise including my own barking dogs, who just cannot resist the opportunity to bark at strange noises. When I'm not working outside sounds don't bother me quite as much, but something about working just amplifies sound. Overall, I've been pleasantly surprised in the past month with how well these headphones have been able to block outside noises while I do work and keep a steady charge. There are few things that are probably worth noting. 1) These don't have the best sound quality in the world. Yes, it is still pretty good sound quality all things considered, but I do have other headphones and ear buds that provide a better overall sound quality. I use these headphones mostly to play soothing rain and babbling brook sounds while I write. 2) This has really good active noise cancelling all things considered. I can't compare it to Bose or other more expensive brands and options, but it does what I need it to do. Deep bass noises are minimized but not completely eliminated. Higher frequency sounds are pretty much gone. 3) The passive noise cancelling isn't bad either. Even if I don't have the active noise cancelling on the headphones still cup my hears even to drown out most outside noises.
These are great headphones. I have a hard time finding ones that not only sound fantastic but also are loud! The sound on these is great but I don't think it's that loud. Overall, what I expected.
Intuitive, easy to use and great sound. A bargain for the price. Also I found the bluetooth range to be longer than I expected!

They work very well with good highs and lows. I primarily use them at night while watching movies or playing Xbox. They allow me to have great sound while not disturbing my neighbors in my apartment building.
All good but headband not adjustable so it’s a little big and loose

review_title: There an on ear not over ear
review_text: There a good headphone set

This product allows my husband to listen to podcasts privately without disturbing the rest of the family, the controls are easy to use & the instructions clear. It seems to be holding the initial charge well. Fit is slightly loose.
Worked well. Easy to pair.
They sound great, fit well and are good noise cancelling.

review_title: Great Headphones, but CAN NOT use while Charging
review_text: These are great headphones. Noise canceling seems to work. Unfortunately, I have to take back one star because you can not listen to the headphones when they are charging. This is a design flaw in my opinion.

They’re great...but i feel like one side cancels noise more effectively. I am able to feel more of the thump and machinery that cancels out noise on the left better than the right. Is ut supposed to be like this?
I used this for my son.

review_title: Very disappointed. Started malfunctioning within 1-2 months.
review_text: I bought these headphones because of numerous good reviews I had read and how much I like Anker as a brand. However, I have to say I'm severely disappointed with these headphones. I'll keep it brief: Pros: + The sound quality is good for the price point Cons: + The biggest "con", and a non-starter honestly, is that the headphones make an unbearably loud static sound several times per hour when Noise Cancellation is on. It's painful to the point that you would visibly / involuntarily grimace every time it happened. If you're wearing these headphones in public or at work, this is clearly not something you want. (Nor is having to turn off Noise Cancellation, given that was a key feature I was looking for.) + The second "con" is that volume control is difficult. The headphones apparently have their own volume "dial", which is separate from that of your Mac, iphone, etc. (Versus all other headphones I've had, which control your device's volume itself.) So essentially, with these headphones, you have two volume dials to worry about, which can be a hassle for a number of reasons. Would probably have tolerated this, but con #1 made the decision easy. Anker is a solid brand and I don't plan to shy away from their other products, but I would recommend staying away from these. Hope this helps.

review_title: This is the second pair because they're AWESOME!!!
review_text: I bought my first pair on a lightning deal, showed them to a colleague which also bought a pair, then bought a second pair for my wife. I wear these every weekday while running on the treadmill on my lunch break. I have a pair of roughly $100 Sony's that I gave to my daughter because these were much better than the Sony's. I can't imagine any BT headphones in this price point that can compete with these Anker's. If you're debating whether to get these or not I would get them.
Wonderful
Comfortable and high quality sound
My boys received these as Christmas gifts and absolutely loved them, but they have both stopped working as of April.

I got these headphones as a birthday gift before a road trip. I love them so much and everything works very well. I was very surprised with how well the battery works. I can use them a few hours a day and they still last a week or two. The only thing is that it is noise canceling to only a certain extent.

I initially tried a pair of $300 Sony noise canceling headphones and they were really great with a few features that these do not have, but I decided $300 was far more than I wanted to pay. I read about these in an article and decided to give them a try for $53 and they really are quite good for the money. I have not had a chance to try them on a plane to test how much help the NC will be but the Sony's blocked all noise in my house and these do not. Still, they do block some noise. Battery life seems to be among the best. They are a little bit loose on my head so if I bend my head down I need to be careful that they don't slip off. I like the look of them (I got the silver ones.)
Great battery life. Good value and performance for money. Silver color matches MacBook.

review_title: Nice Headphones, Work Well & Nice Quality
review_text: Sound is better compared to two other casual listening headphones I have. I'm a bit of an Audiophile and have been for over 50 years. With that said, these are good sounding but not for serious listening but they are very good for casual, commuting, or airline listening. The Noise-Canceling is very good. Very happy with that. The quality is very good as well. The features are nice and is what I would want in casual headphones. Very happy with the purchase, now my wife wants a set.
My wife lost her favorite super fancy, leather-covered pair of Parrot Zik. These sound at least as good and the ear cups are super comfortable.

review_title: Great sound for the everyday person.
review_text: I love this brand. They always deliver amazing sound. This is my first pair of noise canceling headphones. Dont room to compare. They work ok? There was only one issue that I had with them. Started losing sound on the right earpiece. Got in touch with customer service, very nice people. After some troubleshooting, they work fantastic.

review_title: Just what I was looking for in a budget set of Headphones.
review_text: Very comfortable to wear. The NC works good enough on flights but it does lesson the sound quality a bit. In a regular office environment with NC off they have above average sound and the ear cups effectively block out the sound. If using NC in an area that does not have a constant sound and they are not perfectly placed on your head you will get a sort of helicopter effect. Having said that they look and feel great on, and work very well on the plane. There is no noticeable latency issues when watching a show and using bluetooth.
It works for me. I bought it primarily for noise cancelling.
Not so sure the battery life is 40 hours as advertised but it definitely works for a 10-hour workday with no problems
For the money you cannot go wrong with these headphones. I have also purchased Sennhiser that cost me 6x times as much and I prefer to use my Sound Anker Q20 on a Dailey basis
I love my new Anker headphones! They are truly noise cancelling and the sound quality is amazing. Headphones came by the estimated delivery date and we're new and in the package. Would order again! !

review_title: Does not hold a charge, plays music for 20 seconds
review_text: Headphones do not hold a charge
Really nice sounding light weight headphones

Great sound and feels good on your head. I had these on durning cutting my grass. Had little noise from mower and more from music. They fit well over hat and safety glasses. Controls are well placed, but take some getting used to However, they don't filter out the noise coming from my wife. I've tried!

I don't know what the purpose of noise cancelling headphones are but I wanted them for shop/yard work where I was making noise. These don't really seem to work. The microphones pickup wind noise outside and give you a whooshing sound in your ears. I'm not at all impressed with the noise cancelling part. The playback sound though and blue tooth connectivity work just fine. I guess if you want to watch or listen to something while not bothering anyone else these will work fine. If your environment is noisy and you want to block that out while being entertained these aren't for you.
These are great for the price. The sound quality is incredible and the battery life is impressive
Best noise cancelling headphones in this price range. I would recommend to my friends and family!
For the price these are very nice Headphones.

review_title: Great product at a very reasonable price point.
review_text: Expected it to be an okay headphone at a very decent price. Unboxed it, listened to some old favourites, the sound response was better far better than what I expected. Great product from Anker. Keep this coming.

review_title: Great headphones at a great price!
review_text: I love having wireless headphones so that I can walk around without being worried about being connected to a device. The noise cancelling feature works very well! I have been very pleased with these headphones especially since the price is much more reasonable than other over the ear noise cancelling headphones from brands like Bose. Very happy with this purchase!
It lives up to the description and sound wise it has a very high fidelity!! !

So, these arrived yesterday while I was at work. They charged relatively quickly and I got down to testing. To be clear, I am not an audiophile, or audio pro. these are the first BT headphones I have listened to. So, feel free to take this review with a grain of salt. I’ve the last two evenings, I have listened to quit a bit of different music in many genres. Overall these sound great! Sometimes I feel there might be something missing in richness in the middle. Still, it is a minor thing. Vocal clarity is excellent, the bass boost is as good as can be expected from40mm divers. Very happy with this purchase. Today I had my wife try them out while I was at work. She and previously owned an early generation of Bose BT headphones that she gave away for being too bulky for her. She particularly likes Bose products too. When I asked her thoughts on these. She liked them, and mentioned that she listened to an audiobook on her iPad and had great range in the house. So, I had to look at that tonight. We have 2660 sq/ft 2 story house, and when connected to my laptop on the bed of the master bedroom upstairs, there was no place in the house where signal cutout. Pretty impressed with these. I suspect, I will be buying the wife her own set before much longer. I have to say, these are worth buying.

review_title: Perfect for keeping spouses from annoying each other during quarantine conference calls
review_text: Got these for my spouse since I am on conference calls often and we live in a tiny apartment -- a recipe for quarantine frustration. With these headphones, he can now get plenty of work done and I can keep doing all those wonderful conference calls. ;)

review_title: Great for the Price. Helps me focus!
review_text: Use this to help me focus on class and for work. They do the job. They are significantly worse than Bose or Sony ANC headphones, but they are $60!!!! Great value. Comfy, and look good too.

I am very happy with these headphones. The sound quality is great and they are comfortable enough to wear all day. Also, I had to contact support because of an issue I had with the headphones and they took care of it right away. Very happy!
Lightweight on my head. Works over hearing aids!
